title: 9-Hour Dolphin Snorkeling Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Swim with dolphins in the open sea 
Explore the stunning coral reefs and relax on the sandbanks 
Experience the beauty of the colorful underwater world 
Enjoy water sports Banana Boat and tablet
fullDescription:
Getting picked up from your Hotel in an air-conditioned vehicle to the boat pier, where you will be greeted by the captain and the crew. Beginning an unforgettable sea voyage, snorkeling in the Red Sea, and a chance to swim with dolphins.

The captain will take the boat to locations well-known for dolphin spotting, maintaining a respectful distance. The well equipped boat will travel to several spots to ensure time for dolphin watching and scenic snorkeling. Enjoy the beauty of the coral and brightly colored fish. Along the way, remember to sit back and enjoy the boat ride.
The crew will serve  a delicious lunch during the cruise. You will return to the boat pier in the afternoon and then be transferred back to your hotel.

title: From Hurghada: 3-Hour Desert Safari by Quad Bike
experiences:
Experience an exhilarating ride on a quad bike
Visit a traditional Bedouin village
Explore the magnificent desert
fullDescription:
Explore the desert by quad bike on this exciting tour from Hurghada. You will be picked up at your hotel and taken to the quad bikes, where you will have the chance to test drive and learn all the important details of the vehicle before setting off on the tour.

Get into gear and conquer the sand dunes. Let the desert flash past you and feel the adrenaline rush through your body. After about an hour you will reach your destination – a Bedouin village.

Here you can relax, drink black tea, and experience the Bedouin lifestyle. You can also enjoy a camel ride before heading back through the sand dunes to the starting point.

title: Ras Mohammed National Park: Snorkelling Trip
experiences:
Visit the Ras Mohammed National Park
Snorkel in the most beautiful reef in Egypt
Experience an impressively colorful underwater world
See mangroves, the only trees that grow in salt wate
Discover the magical deep lake, which is suitable for swimming
fullDescription:
Be collected at your accommodation in Sharm by a modern air-conditioned mini-bus. Take a for a short drive to the Ras Mohammed National Park. Your guide will tell you interesting facts on the way there.

Have the opportunity to go snorkeling in Egypt's most beautiful reef. Marvel at a remarkably colorful underwater world. Mangroves are the only trees that grow in salt water. In the Ras Mohammed National Park, you can find these unique trees that are actually native to Central Africa.

Discover the Magic Lake, a large deep lake suitable for swimming. The Bedouin gave his name to the magic lake and you will learn fantastic stories about him. After your snorkeling experience at the Ras Mohammed National Park, be returned to your accommodation in time for dinner.

title: From Cairo: Dinner Cruise on the Nile River
experiences:
Enjoy live entertainment while savoring a delicious open buffet dinner
Sail down the Nile River as you peer across the water towards the city's shining lights
Cruise from old Cairo to new Cairo as you take in the beautiful architecture
Experience a unique Arabic outing on this 2-hour journey
fullDescription:
Begin this wonderful dinner excursion from the lobby of your hotel at 6:30 PM. Join the 5-star deluxe Nile Cruise and set sail for a 2-hour trip from Cairo and discover the beauty of the ancient Egyptian city by night.

Take in the wonderful views of Cairo illuminated by the glaring city lights as you savor a special open buffet dinner. Enjoy a belly dance show, Arabic songs and music, along with a Tanoura show while delighting in your endless meal.

This amazing Arabian night experience ends with a drop-off at your hotel. Dinner is included in the tour price but beverages are not.

title: Day Trip to Valley of the Kings, Luxor
experiences:
Marvel at the Temple of Karnak
Enjoy delicious Egyptian dishes at a high class restaurant in Luxor
Be amazed by the Colossi of Memnon
Visit the Valley of the Kings
Dive into the history of Ancient Egypt and the Pharaohs
Visit the temple of Queen Hatshepsut
fullDescription: After pick-up from your hotel, drive to Luxor to visit the most famous monuments in all Egypt, including the temple at Karnak. After that, relax over lunch at a local restaurant in Luxor. Then get on board a Felucca, a type of sailing boat typical in Egypt to cross over the Nile to the City of the Dead (optional).\r\n\r\nThe impressive Colossi of Memnon will greet you there – the the last remnants of the Temple of Amenophis III. Be enthralled by the magnificent architecture of the Valley of the Kings and visit the temple of Hatshepsut, one of the female rulers of Ancient Egypt. After you've had enough time to explore the extensive monuments to your satisfaction, you will be driven back to your hotel.

title: From Hurghada: Sea Scope Submarine Trip
experiences:
Discover the Red Sea onboard a semi-submarine
Admire the colorful underwater world
See coral reefs and fascinating fish
Enjoy 40 minutes of Snorkeling
fullDescription:
Climb aboard a fascinating semi-submarine and explore the underwater world off the shores of Hurghada. Semi-submarines have large panoramic windows and do not dive very deep. This gives you the best views under the water, especially near reefs.

After breakfast you will be picked up at your hotel in an air-conditioned vehicle and taken on an unforgettable trip. Immerse yourself in the Red Sea and marvel at the colorful fish, reefs and corals. You will have approximately 40 minutes to make the most of the opportunity to enjoy snorkeling and experience the fascinating nature.

Enjoy taking memorable photos before ending the tour with the drop off at your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Safari Quad Biking, Bedouin Village and BBC Dinner
experiences:
Discover the vastness of the Sahara, enjoy a desert safari to a Bedouin village, and admire the beautiful sunset over the desert
Experience a thrilling ride by quad bike ride and dune buggy
Learn more about the traditional life of the Bedouins
Enjoy a traditional Arabic evening with camel rides, an oriental show, and a delicious barbecue dinner
See a terrarium with desert snakes and scorpions
Enjoy the sunset on the Hurghada desert between mountains
fullDescription:
Discover the vast expanse of the Sahara and the desert mountains. After the pick-up at your hotel in Hurghada you will start your tour in the desert. Upon arrival at the first location, you will get a brief introduction on how to use the quad bikes. You can then enjoy the thrilling ride through the desert sand. Afterwards you will get in a dune buggy and enjoy a very special driving experience.

You will then continue on to a Bedouin village. Enjoy the typical hospitality with Arabic tea and fresh flatbread as you learn more about the traditional life of the Bedouins. You also have the option of taking a camel ride before heading to the terrarium with impressive desert snakes and scorpions.

Enjoy a cozy evening barbecue in the open air and admire the fantastic views of the sunset. Watch a traditional show and marvel at the fire-eaters, Tanoura dancers, and belly dancers. You can also enjoy smoking a shisha pipe in the relaxed atmosphere.

In the late evening you will be driven back to your hotel.

title: Hot Air Balloon Ride Over Luxor
Giftun Island National Park Full-day Snorkeling Trip
experiences:
Visit the beautiful Giftun Islands National park
Explore the underwater marine life of the Red Sea
Explore the fascinating Magawish reef
Stop off at 3 different snorkeling locations
Soak-up the sun on the lounge deck
Enjoy water Sports banna boat and tablet
fullDescription:
Take advantage of the marvelous warm weather in Hurghada with a full-day out on the Red Sea. Travel by boat out to Giftun Island, where you will spend a relaxing day snorkeling, exploring the island, and enjoying a buffet lunch.
After you are picked-up from your hotel, transfer to a boat docked on the Red Sea. Then, head out on the water, stopping off at a variety of spots to catch a glimpse of the colorful underwater life. In addition to seeing fish and coral, you will also have the chance to swim with dolphins!

Upon arriving at Giftun Island, have the opportunity to take part in water sports, or visit the national park on the island. During this time, you'll also be served a buffet lunch. Finally, as your day winds down, you will be transferred back to land and returned to your hotel.

title: Hurghada: 6-Hour Dive Trip with Two Dive Sites
experiences:
Enjoy the fantastic underwater world in relaxed atmosphere on a wonderful dive trip
Discover the breathtaking diversity of fish species as well as beautiful coral reefs
Explore the beauty of the sea accompanied by experienced dive guides
fullDescription: Early in the morning you will be picked up at your hotel in Hurghada for an exciting dive trip. The boat will be waiting for you at the port of Hurghada to take you to the fantastic dive sites nearby. During the dives you will have the opportunity to relax and unwind. This is particularly appealing for inexperienced divers and also offers contact with other diving enthusiasts.\r\n\r\nExperienced diving instructors will guide you and tell you the specifics of the dive sites before each dive, so that you can enjoy a relaxing day. Lunch will be served onboard the boat during the trip. After diving at 2 different sites you will return to the port of Hurghada and then be dropped off at your hotel in Hurghada.

title: Cairo and Giza Full-Day Highlights Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Discover the last surviving 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Explore the ancient pyramids of the Giza Plateau
See antiquities of Ancient Egypt at the Egyptian Museum
Add on optional extra camel rides and more
Learn more about the pharaohs of Ancient Egypt
fullDescription:
Travel back in time to experience the heritage of Pharaonic Egypt on a full-day tour to Cairo and Giza, with transfers by air-conditioned vehicles from the Red Sea.

Following a pick-up from your hotel, get some great views of the landscape en route to the Egyptian capital. Stops can be made whenever you require. Upon arrival in Cairo, visit the Egyptian Museum on Tahrir Square, and discover one of the most comprehensive collections of Ancient Egyptian relics in the world. Explore treasures that tell the story of a highly-developed culture.

For a supplement, you can enter the Mummy Room to learn all about the mummification process, and come face-to-face with some of the Egyptian royals of the Pharonic days in mummified form.

Transfer to Giza in the afternoon to see the Great Pyramids and Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau. Marvel at this last surviving monument of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, built more than 4.500 years ago as everlasting graves for the pharaohs Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinos.

Marvel at the mysterious Sphinx statue of a Pharaoh’s head with a lion’s body. Optional activities in Giza upon payment of a supplement include a look inside the Great Pyramid or Small Pyramid, a ride on a camel, or a visit to the Solar Boat Museum, where you will see the legendary boat that Pharaoh Cheops had built in order to sail through the underworld

Transfer back to your hotel in the evening for the end of tour services.

title: Private Transfer between Cairo Airport & Cairo/Giza
Full-Day Tour of Historical Alexandria from Cairo, Egypt
experiences:
Relax with comfortable air-conditioned transfers.
Benefit from informative and professional Egyptologist guides.
Discover the main attractions of ancient Alexandria including the Roman Theatre and the Catacombs of Kom el Shaqafa
Stroll the ramparts of the 15th-century Qaitbay Citadel.
Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a quality local restaurant.
fullDescription:
Explore the rich history of Alexandria; tracing time from its ancient Egyptian roots, through the Classical period, to Roman times and beyond on an informative full-day tour from Cairo. Enjoy meet-and-greet service pick-up, and drop off from your Cairo hotel, and the comfort of an air-conditioned bus.

Begin the journey with a visit to the Roman theater in Kom El-Deka; a marble theater that once seated 800 spectators with galleries, sections of mosaic flooring, and a pleasure garden, all surrounded by Roman baths and villas.

Continuing, explore the Catacombs of Kom el Shoqafa; the necropolis of 3 sub-levels dating from the 2nd century AD merges aspects of Egyptian, Greek, and Roman culture in its features. See the Roman triclinium – a banquet hall to honor the dead, as well as statues, reliefs, and a pillared lobby featuring depictions of Egyptian gods in Roman armor.

See the site of the Alexandria Library. Concluding the tour, walk the ramparts of the 15th century Qaitbay Citadel, built upon the ruins of the ancient Alexandria Lighthouse. End this day of discovery with a relaxed evening drive back to Cairo, and your hotel.

title: From Luxor: Full-Day Tour of the East and West Banks
experiences:
Tour the East and West Banks of Luxor with an Egyptologist guide
Admire the towering Colossi of Memnon
Marvel at the Temple of Karnak, the oldest religious structure in the world
Explore the lavish tombs of the 3 pharaohs in the Valley of the Kings
Visit the spectacular Temple of Queen Hatshepsut
fullDescription:
After breakfast you’ll be met by your Egyptologist guide to begin an 8-hour tour of the West Bank and East Bank of Luxor.

West Bank: Your guide will take you straight to the West Bank of Luxor, which was known in ancient times as the City of the Dead. This is an archeological paradise with its wealth of pharaonic temples and is considered a gateway to Valley of the Kings.

Valley of the Kings: There are actually 2 valleys: the East Valley, where the majority of the royal tombs and temples were constructed; and the West Valley. In all there are approximately 65 tombs and chambers located in this burial site for the major kings of the new Egyptian dynasty. Your visit includes entry into 3 tombs. If you wish to see either the tomb of Tutankhamun or Ramses 6, there is an additional ticket fee.

Temple of Hatshepsut: Visit the Hatshepsut Temple, named for the Foremost of Noble Ladies. Queen Hatshepsut was the fifth pharaoh of the 18th dynasty of ancient Egypt and the daughter of King Thutmose I. She established the first world trade network and her temple is considered one of the most important temples of ancient times.

The Colossi of Memnon: Before lunch, you’ll visit the Colossi of Memnon, the 2 massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III. For the past 3,400 years (since 1350 BC), the statues have stood in the Theban necropolis as guardians at the entrance to Amenhotep’s memorial temple. The statues are made from blocks of quartzite stone.

Lunch:Your guide will escort the group to a 4-star restaurant to have lunch and a chance for some rest before the afternoon tour.

Temple of Karnak: This complex was originally dedicated to god Amun Ra, his wife Mut and son Khons. Later, around 30 additional kings added their own touches to the complex. The site is vast, covering nearly 1 mile by 2 miles in area with more than 20 temples in all. What makes the Karnak Temple complex special is that it includes several of the finest examples of ancient Egyptian design and architecture, such as the Hypostyle Hall, one of the world’s great architectural achievements of all time and the Temple of Amun, a spectacular forest of giant papyrus-shaped columns.

Shopping: At the end of the day, you’ll be able to spend about an hour shopping for Egyptian antiques. If you’re not into shopping, you can take some photos around the area, wait in the coach or do pretty much do anything else you like.

You'll be transferred back to your hotel or Nile cruise ship in Luxor.

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramid, Sakkara & Memphis Full Day Private Tour
experiences:
Marvel at the famous Great Pyramids of Giza with your Egyptologist guide
See the ancient Step Pyramid of Djoser at the Sakkara archeological site
Visit Egypt's former capital of Memphis, once the cultural center of the ancient world
fullDescription:
Great Pyramids & Sphinx (Giza Pyramid Complex ) , Saqqara Step Pyramids and Memphis open air Museum :

Start your day with an 08:00 AM pick-up at your hotel and travel with your guide to the Giza Plateau. On this 9-hour tour you’ll visit the Great Pyramids, the ancient capital of Memphis and the Step Pyramid of Djoser in Saqqara.

When you reach the Giza Plateau, your Egyptology guide will introduce you to the famous Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus.

Marvel at the Great Sphinx statue and visit the Valley Temple, which is a part of the same ancient complex. Learn about the burial rites of the pharaohs.

The next stop on the tour is the Step Pyramid of King Djoser, at the fascinating Saqqara archaeological site. Built around 2630 BC, this special pyramid is the world's oldest major stone structure.

You’ll continue on to Memphis, the capital of ancient Egypt. Having reigned as a cultural center for over 3,000 years, Memphis boasts stunning ancient sites.

title: Desert Quad Bike Safari in Hurghada to Bedouin Village
experiences:
Zip across the desert sand and over dunes on your own quad bike
Try your hand at camel riding
Visit a traditional Bedouin village and learn a new way of life
Sip a tasty, hot Bedouin tea with the locals and smoke a traditional water pipe
fullDescription:
Make your way to a traditional Bedouin village via a half-day quad bike safari departing from Hurghada. Learn about the lives and traditions of the people and enjoy tea and hookah as you watch the sun set in the desert.

After you are picked up, you will be driven to get your bike. Then head out, driving 18.5 miles (30 kilometers) to a nearby Bedouin village. You will travel for 40 minutes by quad bike before transferring to an enclosed vehicle to continue your journey.

Upon arriving, enjoy a camel ride across the desert. Then spend time talking with the locals and finding out about their culture and traditions, before watching the beautiful sunset.

title: Giza Pyramids, Sphinx and Sakkara - Private Full Day Tour
experiences:
Go on a private full day tour of the Giza Pyramids, the Sphinx, Memphis and Sakkara with a qualified Egyptologist
Go inside of the Great Pyramids and visit the Mummies room
View the Step Pyramid in Sakkara, only 27km from Cairo
fullDescription:
Embark on a full-day tour to the Giza Pyramids, the Sphinx, Memphis and Sakkara.

Start your tour by visiting the Great Pyramids - Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos. The highlight of this section is getting close up to the Sphinx - the legendary guardian with a lion’s body and the head of King Chephren. Admire the impressive statue and get your photo taken beside it.
You will then visit Sakkara, a 27 km journey away from Cairo. The highlight of this section is the Step Pyramid. Built for King Zoser, it is considered an important part in the process of the pyramid evolution.

Finally, you'll head over to Memphis. Not the home of Elvis, of course, but the ancient capital of Egypt!

title: Morning Quad Bike Adventure from Hurghada
experiences:
Discover the desert of Hurghada on an exciting quad tour and ride into the sunrise
Visit a traditional Bedouin camp and enjoy the hospitality with a black tea
Experience an exceptional adventure and ride on the back of a camel through the desert
fullDescription:
Experience the endless expanse of the desert of Hurghada and immerse yourself in the traditional culture and life of its inhabitants at a Bedouin camp. Enjoy a sunrise pick-up by your tour guide from your hotel and head to the quad site.

After a short trial drive, experience the incredible rush of adrenaline of driving a quad through the desert. Ride into the sunrise and experience the incredible play of colors as the sun rises from the sea and the desert awakes.

Then, visit a Bedouin camp and enjoy the hospitality of the desert inhabitants with a cup of black tea and a camel ride.

title: Giftun Island National Park Snorkel Trip from Hurghada
experiences:
Take a boat ride from Hurghada out onto the Red Sea
Make a stop at a premium snorkeling site
Spend an afternoon at Giftun Island National Park
Eat lunch on the boat and then relax on the beach
fullDescription:
Head out to Giftun Island National Park on a 6-hour excursion from Hurghada. In the morning, transfer from your hotel to a boat, where you will set sail in the Red Sea.

Along the way to the island, stop off at a snorkeling site in the region where you will see corals, myriads of colorful fish, and many other underwater animals and plants. Then, have lunch on board the boat before finally arriving at the island.

Once you arrive, you will have plenty of time to relax! Enjoy the laid-back Caribbean atmosphere as you walk along the white sandy beach, spend time sunbathing, and swim or snorkel in the clear turquoise water. Return to your hotel in Hurghada in the late afternoon.

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramids Sound and Light Show with Dinner
experiences:
Experience the magic of the Pyramids of Giza at night
Learn more about the ancient pharaohs during a spectacular sound and light show
Enjoy a delicious dinner at a local restaurant
Marvel as the Great Sphinx comes to life and speaks the words of a long dead Egyptian ruler
Get great views of the pyramids illuminated at night
fullDescription:
If you’ve been impressed by the Pyramids of Giza by daylight, experience the magic of the monuments at night with a ticket to the Sound and Light Show in the Giza Plateau.

Transfer from Cairo by air-conditioned van, and take your seats in the spectacular setting of the pyramids and Great Sphinx in the desert. A recorded commentary will tell the story of the Pharoahs of Ancient Egypt as images are projected on to the temple walls.

Learn more about Ancient Egypt and each ruin as the story unfolds, climaxing when the Great Sphinx comes to life and speaks the words of a long dead pharaoh. End with a delicious dinner at a local restaurant before the transfer back to your hotel in Cairo.

title: Hurghada: Full-Day Trip to Cairo and Giza Highlights
experiences:
Explore the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World at Giza
Tour the Old Town of Cairo
Go to the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Square
Marvel at the high Pyramid of Khufu, the oldest in the Giza Plateau
Learn how the pyramids were built from an Egyptologist guide
See the reclining statue of the Great Sphinx
fullDescription:
Discover the “City of a Thousand Minarets” on a full-day tour of Cairo, with round-trip transfers by bus from Hurghada. Relax in air-conditioned comfort on the long journey, admiring views of the Gulf of Suez.

Upon arrival, your private Egyptologist guide will take you to Giza Plateau to see the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World. Get breathtaking views of the Pyramids of Giza as you explore the mortuary temples of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Learn the story of how the temples were constructed, and hear the stories behind their legends.

Continue to the Great Sphinx, the giant statue of a reclining mythical beast with a lion’s body and the face of the Pharaoh Khafre. Go to the Valley Temple opposite, attributed to the Pharaoh Khafre, and marvel at the feat of ancient engineering.

After lunch, drive into central Cairo to explore the artifacts of the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Square. Designed by French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the museum’s collections exceed 120,000 masterpieces from the pre-dynastic to the Pharaonic and Greco-Roman periods. Learn about the mummification art of Ancient Egypt before your return transfer to Hurghada.

title: Hurghada: Day Trip to Cairo by Plane with Transfers
experiences:
Visit the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Marvel at the Great Sphinx and explore the Valley Temple
Admire the vast array of artifacts at the world-renowned Museum of Egyptian Antiquities
fullDescription:
Marvel at the majesty of the Great Pyramid of Giza and the treasures of the Egyptian Museum. With your own private Egyptologist guide you’ll enjoy this full-day exploration of Cairo.

Early in the morning, you’ll be picked up at your hotel in Hurghada by air-conditioned van for the transfer to Hurghada airport and your flight to Cairo. When you arrive you’ll meet your Egyptologist guide and begin the tour with a visit the famous Giza Plateau.

Marvel at the Great Pyramid, one of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, as well as the other 2 pyramids and mysterious Sphinx, the Father of Terror for the ancient pharaohs.

The tour also includes a visit to the Valley Temple that faces the great Sphinx, before you stop for lunch at a good quality restaurant.

After lunch you’ll visit old Cairo with your guide before heading to the world-renowned Museum of Egyptian Antiquities. Built in the neo-classical style and designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the Museum is home to more than 120,000 masterpieces of Egyptian art and artifacts.

After some free time in Cairo you’ll be transferred to the airport for your return flight to Hurghada, followed by a direct transfer to your hotel.

title: Luxor Guided Tour with Overnight 1st Class Train from Cairo
experiences:
Travel from Cairo to Luxor by 1st class train
Discover the ancient temples of the East Bank of Luxor
Explore the necropolis in the Valley of the Kings on the West Bank of Luxor
fullDescription:
See some of the finest monuments from Ancient Egypt on a guided tour of the East Bank and West Bank of Luxor. Catch the overnight train from Cairo and get wonderful views of the Nile River Valley at the first light of day.

Day 1:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Cairo or Giza, and then travel to the train station to catch the overnight 1st-class train to Luxor.

Day 2:
Arrive at Luxor in the morning and meet a licensed tour guide to take a tour of the monuments by private air-conditioned vehicle. Start on the West Bank and visit the Valley Of The Kings, last resting place of the kings Tutmosis I, Tutmosis III, Tut-Ankh-Amon, Ramssess VI, Mrenptah and Amonhotep II.

Continue to the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, and learn about the only female ruler of Ancient Egypt. Discover the mortuary temple of Amenhotep III at the Colossi of Memnon, and then cross to the East Bank to explore the most splendid site of worship at the Karnak Temple. Visit the Temple of Luxor before getting dropped off at the station to take the overnight train back to Cairo.

title: Hurghada: Parasailing Adventure
experiences:
Enjoy the stunning views over the red sea
Parasail either solo or with a friend next to you
See the amazing world of Red Sea at a bird's-eye level
fullDescription:
Be picked up from your hotel in Hurghada by a representative and then transferred to the Marina.

Take part in parasailing, a recreational activity where a one or two people are towed behind a boat while attached to a parachute, ascending up to 40-50 meters (about 164 feet) in the air with a full 10-13 min flight time. For this activity, no training is required. Your friendly and experienced captain and crew will do all the work to ensure your comfort and safety. Choose to fly single or two people at a time.

Know that your safety is the number one concern; both captain and crew are CPR and Advanced First Aid Certified and all parasailing equipment is regularly inspected and certified.

title: Hurghada Horse Ride: Sea and Desert Tour
experiences:
Take a ride in desert and get a feel for the real Arabia
Breathe in the desert air, and have your fill of the picturesque landscape
See the stunning desert sunset on the back of a horse
fullDescription:
This is one of the most exotic destinations for horseback riding in Egypt, and to top it off, it is reasonably priced!

The ancient horse culture is very much alive in Egypt, and it is doubtful that any part of the world can match its rich and broad mosaic of history.

Take this horseback tour with the finest bred horses and experience trainers.

Horse trainers are also provided to give you pre-ride coaching, and to assist you throughout your ride.

Another must-do excursion activity while in Hurghada, for horse lovers of all kinds! This is a family friendly activity.

Traveler safety:

• This tour is child appropriate
• A helmet is provided to each rider
• Pregnant women are not permitted to ride a horse
• A disclaimer form against damage and personal injury required to be signed prior to the tour

title: Giza Pyramids & Sphinx, Saqqara & Dahshur Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Get up close to the Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx
Learn more about Ancient Egypt from an expert guide
Visit the step pyramid of the Pharaoh Djoser at the archaeological site of Saqqara
Hear how pyramids were built
Marvel at the unique Bent Pyramid in Dahshur
fullDescription:
Journey back in time to the days of Ancient Egypt and go to the Giza Plateau to see the legendary pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus. Get up close to the Great Sphinx and visit the Valley Temple on the site where the pharaohs were laid to rest.

Next, journey to the Step Pyramid of Djoser in the archaeological remains of the necropolis of Saqqara. Learn more about Pharaoh Djoser from your Egyptologist guide. Continue to Dahshur on the west bank of the River Nile and go inside the unfinished Red Pyramid, named for the rusty color of its limestone rocks.

Learn how the pyramids were built.

title: Magawish and Giftun Islands Full-Day Snorkeling Trip
experiences:
Stop to snorkel at 3 different spots around Red Sea islands
Marvel at the colorful coral reefs and underwater life
Enjoy lunch and soft drinks on board
fullDescription:
Your adventure begins when you’re picked up in the morning at your hotel and then head out for a day-long snorkeling trip to Red Sea destinations. Sail to Magawish and Giftun islands, keeping an eye out for dolphins along the way.

When you reach the islands, you’ll have a chance to snorkel in 3 different spots, where you’ll see astonishing coral reefs inhabited by colorful fish.

You’ll be served lunch, soft drinks, and mineral water on board. Relax on the sundeck and enjoy the fresh sea breezes while cruising back to the marina.

When you arrive you’ll be transferred back to your Hurghada hotel.

title: Hurghada Jeep Safari, Camel Ride and Bedouin Village Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a BBQ dinner with deliciously grilled delicacies
Enjoy an exciting camel ride in the desert
Discover the Sahara in a four-wheel drive
Visit a Bedouin village in the desert and explore traditional culture
Enjoy the traditional tanoura show and belly dance
Experience an exciting jeep safari
Sip a tasty, hot Bedouin tea with the locals and smoke a traditional water pipe
fullDescription: Experience an exciting jeep safari through the desert from Hurghada. You will be picked up at your hotel and driven to the Sahara. Enjoy your time away from the hustle and bustle of the big city and be amazed by the wonders of the desert.\r\n\r\nWithin an hour you will reach a Bedouin village, where you have the opportunity to experience the culture and daily lives of the inhabitants. You can also enjoy a camel ride through the desert sand. Admire the breathtaking views and watch the beautiful sunset over the desert. Round off the day with a delicious barbecue dinner and grilled delicacies.

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramids, Egyptian Museum & Bazaar Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Explore the history and culture of Ancient Egypt
Wander through 120,000 masterpieces of art at the Egyptian Museum
See the treasures from the Tomb of Tutankhamen
Visit the Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx, the last remaining of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World
Pick up some souvenir bargains and learn to haggle at the Khan El Khalili Bazaar
fullDescription:
Enjoy a full-day tour exploring the history and culture of Egypt at the Egyptian Museum, Great Pyramids of Giza, and Great Sphinx. Then, shop for unique bargains in the historic Khan El Khalili Bazaar. An expert Egyptologist guide will be on hand at all times to offer helpful explanations of this most ancient of civilizations.

Start your tour at the Egyptian Museum. Designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon, the museum is located in a handsome neo-classical building on Tahrir Square. Its collections exceed 120,000 masterpieces, ranging from the pre-dynastic era, to the Pharaonic and Greco-Roman periods. Undoubted highlights are the collection of rare treasures of King Tutankhamen, and the Mummies Room, which you can enter for a small extra charge.

Continue to the Great Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx, the oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, and the last still standing. Explore the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Your guide will describe the story of their monumental construction, and tell you about their mysteries, before you explore inside one of the pyramids.

Proceed to the Great Sphinx, imposingly standing in the desert sand after thousands of years. Admire the colossal structure, before moving to the Valley Temple of the Pyramid of Cephren.

Drive back to central Cairo and end your day at the lively Khan El Khalili Bazaar. Master the art of bargaining for great prices on fine brassware, copper, perfumes, leather, silver, gold, and antiques.

title: Hurghada: 5-Hour Private City Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a city tour in a small group
Explore the different districts of Hurghada
Experience a journey through time and see how fishing boats are built and restored using traditional methods
Visit the old town with its original character
Discover the modern, vibrant neighborhoods
fullDescription:
Discover the different districts of Hurghada on this city tour. Explore both the traditional old town and the new, modern city. After being picked up at your hotel in an air-conditioned vehicle, you will drive to the fishing village and visit original, simple houses that only have one floor.

It feels like time stands still in this part of the city. The fishermen get up with the sunrise and go to sleep as the sun sets. Life is simple and traditional. Visit a shipyard and see how fishing boats are built and restored using traditional methods.

The largest mosque in Hurghada is situated nearby. Here you can learn more about Islam, the main religion of Egypt. You will then continue to the oldest Coptic church in the city. At the end of the tour you will visit the large fruit and vegetable market before you are dropped off back at your hotel.

title: From Hurghada Trip to Luxor and Valley of the Kings
experiences:
Visit the famous Valley of the Kings
Admire the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut
Explore the Temple of Karnak
Marvel at the impressive Colossi of Memnon
Enjoy delicious Egyptian dishes at a high-class restaurant in ‎Luxor
Enter the history of Ancient Egypt and the Pharaohs
fullDescription:
Start your tour of Luxor with the pick-up at your hotel in Hurghada. Discover the fascinating world of ancient Egypt on a visit to the most beautiful sights around the city.

Visit the Temple of Karnak and admire the columned halls, the chapels, and the sacred lake of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. Enjoy lunch at a selected restaurant in Luxor before heading to the other bank of the Nile River.

Here you will explore the City of the Dead and the Colossi of Memnon. Admire the only remains of the Temple of Amenhotep III and visit the Valley of the Kings. Be inspired by the stunning architecture and discover the Temple of Hatshepsut, the only female ruler of ancient Egypt.

title: Aswan: Tour to High Dam, The Obelisk & Philae Temple by Boat
experiences:
Visit the Philae Temple, built in honor of the goddess Isis
Enjoy a visit to the magnificent Unfinished Obelisk
View the High Dam of Aswan – a miracle of engineering
Marvel at the River Nile from a motor boat
fullDescription:
Start your day tour in Aswan by getting picked up from your hotel or cruise ship and drive to the High Dam of Aswan, an engineering miracle when it was built in the 1960s. From the top of the High Dam you can gaze across Lake Nasser to the Kalabsha temple in the south and the huge power station to the north.

Continue to the Unfinished Obelisk in the granite quarries of Aswan, where much of the red granite used for ancient temples and colossi came from. The Unfinished Obelisk still lies where it was carved when a crack was discovered as it was being hewn from the rock. Your qualified Egyptologist guide will explain how the 1 tonne obelisk was carved, and why the crack caused it to be abandoned.

The last of the 3 famous Aswan sites you will see is generally regarded as the best. Philae Temple was carefully moved to its current location (around 500 meters from the original site) when the construction of the High Dam caused surrounding Nile waters to rise. A short motorboat ride takes you to the island, where your guide will take you on a walking tour through the temple before allowing you free time to explore further on your own.

Dedicated to the goddess Isis, Philae Temple has a beautiful setting on an island in the river which has been landscaped to match its original site.

After finishing your tour, you'll be dropped off your hotel or Nile cruise in Aswan.

title: Hurghada Sindbad Submarine: 3-Hour Tour
experiences:
Descend 22 meters below the surface of the Red Sea on the Sindbad Submarine
Marvel at the underwater life of the coral wonderland
Enjoy a diving experience while staying dry and comfortable
fullDescription:
Add the thrill of adventure to your Hurghada holiday and experience a unique and entertaining underwater excursion on board the Sinbad Submarine.

You’ll be met at your hotel on this 3-hour trip and then head to the pier to begin a memorable undersea adventure.

The only submarine in the Middle East, the Sindbad Submarine carries 44 passengers and has a capable 2-pilot crew.

Enjoy a thrilling underwater adventure as you head 22 meters below the surface of the Red Sea. Marvel at the spectacular varieties of coral and colorful tropical fish.

There’s no need to be a scuba diver to discover the wonders that await below!

title: Great Pyramids and Sphinx Adventure
experiences:
Visit the iconic Pyramids of Giza before the crowds and the heat
Tour inside the Valley Temple and marvel at its construction
Enjoy spectacular views of the Sphinx and the overall Giza Plateau
fullDescription:
Experience the magic of the Land of the Pharaohs on a 5-hour visit to the Giza Plateau with an Egyptologist guide. Travel in air-conditioned comfort and start out with a visit to the Great Pyramid.

Continue to the second pyramid, which is also the second-largest and the only pyramid that retains part of its original casing. See the third and smallest of the pyramids as well.

Visit the interior of the Valley Temple and marvel at the construction. See the Great Sphinx of Giza, a statue with the body of a lion and the head of a man.

Stop at the panoramic viewpoint to take in all the pyramids from one spot.

title: From Cairo: Full-Day Tour to Alexandria with Lunch
Cairo: Quad Bike Desert Safari around Giza Pyramids
experiences:
Enjoy a quad bike tour around the Giza Pyramids
Discover the desert around Cairo
Take a close-up look at the Sphinx
fullDescription: After a pick-up from your hotel in Cairo or Giza, you will be transferred to the Giza Pyramids. This is the starting point for your easy quad bike ride. The tour is simply the most exciting way to discover all the ancient wonders of Egypt. The custom-made buggies are capable of whisking over the dunes at speeds over 50 mph taking you to places where most tourists never get to see. Riding through the desert is a thrilling experience and will make your holiday in Egypt unforgettable.\r\n\r\nTake amazing pictures and see the Great Pyramids - Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos. After this, visit the Valley Temple and have a close-up look at the Sphinx. At the end of your tour you will be taken back to your hotel.

title: Hurghada Quad Bike Safari: Full-Day Trip to Sahara Park
experiences:
Explore the Hurghada desert on a quad bike
Marvel at the sunset during an open buffet dinner
Enjoy an evening Tanura show and belly dancing performance
View the stars in the desert sky by telescope
fullDescription:
Your full-day desert adventure begins when you’re picked up at your hotel in Hurghada and driven to Sahara Park. On arrival you’ll stop at the quad bike station for a test drive before heading into the Hurghada desert. Stop twice along the way to see a mirage and climb up a sand dune.

You’ll be welcomed with a drink and lunch box when you arrive at the Bedouin village. There will be plenty of time to tour the village and learn about traditional Bedouin life. You’ll also take a ride on a camel!

Enjoy sunset views from the mountain along with an open-buffet Bedouin dinner. Following dinner you’ll be entertained by the Sahara Park Evening Show, which includes a Tanura and belly dancing performance.

Later, you can explore the desert night sky and view stars by digital telescope, before the drive back to Hurghada.

The tour price includes pick-up at Hurghada hotels. An extra transfer fee will be applied for pick-up at hotels in Makadi Bay, Safaga, El Gouna, and Abo Soma Bay.

title: Sunrise Hot Air Balloon Tour from Luxor
experiences:
Float silently above Luxor’s West Bank and the Nile River in a hot-air balloon
Enjoy complimentary drinks and breakfast
See the Valley of the Kings and the Temple of Hatshepsut from high above
fullDescription:
This 3-hour program begins very early in the morning with a pick-up at your Luxor hotel or Nile cruise ship. You’ll then transfer to a motorboat to reach the West Bank, and enjoy a refreshing drink en route.

Once you disembark you will be transferred to the take-off area, where your hot-air balloon ride above the world's largest open-air museum begins.

The balloon ride is scheduled right in time for you to experience a spectacular sunrise. The flight lasts for 45 minutes, and takes you over the Valley of the Kings and the Temple of Hatshepsut.

After you’ve landed you will be transferred back to your hotel or ship.

title: Cairo International Airport: Private Hotel Transfers
experiences:
Avoid the unreliable local taxis and pre-book a safe airport transfer
Benefit from an economical private transfer
Choose an eco-friendly option
fullDescription:
Skip the long lines for taxis on landing at Cairo International Airport and avoid traveling on the public transport system with heavy bags. Pre-book a guaranteed transfer between the airport and hotels in Cairo or Giza and travel in comfort instead.

The service is available 24/7 in either direction, for arrival or departure flights. Located in Heliopolis, Cairo International Airport is approximately 15 kilometers northeast of the city center and the transfer time will be about 1 hour.

Relax in air-conditioned comfort, and get dropped off directly at your hotel with no need for extra stops along the way.

title: From Hurghada: Dolphin Watching Cruise and Massage
Luxor Full-Day Sightseeing Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Explore the temple ruins of Luxor
Go to the mortuary temple of Queen Hatshepsut
Marvel at the rams heads of the Temple of Karnak
Descend into the tombs of Egyptian rulers,
Admire the giant statues of the Colossi of Memnon
See ancient hieroglyphs and paintings
Travel to the Valley of the Kings
Drive along the banks of the Nile Valley and see the villages of Upper-Egypt
fullDescription:
Travel back to the days of Ancient Egypt on a full-day tour of Luxor, with round-trip transfers by air-conditioned vehicle from Hurghada. En route, admire views of the River Nile and the villages of Upper-Egypt.

Upon arrival in Luxor, go to the Colossi of Memnon to admire the gigantic statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III, built 3,400 years ago. Continue to the Valley of the Kings to see where the ancient Egyptians buried their most powerful nobles. Descend into the tombs of Egyptian rulers, and admire well preserved paintings and hieroglyphs.

Next, learn the legend of the 1st female pharaoh of Egypt at the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut. Discover the extraordinary mortuary temple she had built, complete with terraces of colonnades, a hypo-style hall, and hundreds of statues, paintings and reliefs.

After lunch at a local restaurant, continue your tour at the Temple of Karnak. Beautifully preserved, it provides the perfect opportunity for an imaginative journey back in time to the days of the Ancient Egyptians. Stroll at leisure to form an impression of how the immense pylon was built. Walk the avenue of ram-head criosphinges, marvel at more than 100 pillars at the hypo-style hall, and see ancient hieroglyphs, chapels, statues and a holy lake.

The superstitious can approach the scarab close to the lake and surround it 3 times clockwise; according to legend, offspring will soon follow!

title: Cairo: Sound & Light Show Giza Pyramids
experiences:
Enjoy Giza pyramids plateau after sunset
Watch fantastic visuals projected onto the ancient Giza Pyramids
Enjoy the Sound and Light show at the Giza Pyramids
fullDescription: Try something different by attending the dazzling Sound and Light show at the Giza Pyramids of Cheops, Chefren and Mykerinus. The Sound and Light show will whisk you away on a narrated journey of Egypt's history through dramatic storytelling, lights, and music. Watch as lights illuminate the sphinx and pyramids, in a show considered one of the best tourist attractions in Cairo.\r\n\r\nBegin your show with the tale of the Sphinx, who has been the vigilant guardian of the city of the dead for 5,000 years. Discover the story of the building of the pyramids, as well as the history of famous figures from ancient Egypt such as Thutmosis IV, Akhnaten, Nefertiti, and Tut Ankh Amon.

title: Quad Bike Tour with Camel Ride
experiences:
Drive across the dunes of an Egyptian desert by Quad Bike
Experience the desert landscape from the back of a camel
Learn about life in a bedouin camp
Watch the sunset before dinner
fullDescription:
Escape the crowds of the Red Sea for the day, and explore the desert surrounding Hurghada.

Following a pick-up from your hotel by vehicle, transfer to the countryside for the start of a 40-minute quad bike adventure. Drive across the rugged terrain by ATV before continuing to a traditional Bedouin village.

You will be welcomed with light snacks and traditional tea. Marvel at Bedouin art in the pottery museum. Then, experience desert life from the back of a camel, enjoying the dramatic scenery like a nomad and, as the sun sets, dinner will be served. 

Transfer back to Hurghada for your hotel drop off.

title: Sunset Desert Safari Trip by Quad Runner from Hurghada
experiences:
Drive a quad bike through the Egyptian desert
Visit a local Bedouin village for a taste of culture, customs, and music
Ride a camel and watch the sun set over the desert
fullDescription:
Come along for an exhilarating desert safari on this day trip from Hurghada.

After picking you up from your hotel, you will be taken to a motorbike station for a test drive and quick training session.

From there, begin an 18-mile (30 kilometer) drive through the sandy desert towards a local Bedouin village. Here, enjoy a tour of traditional life for the local people living in the area. You will have the chance to ride a camel, as well as taking in some amazing sunset views.

Later, enjoy an traditional local show and performance of lovely folk songs, which will introduce you to the culture of the Bedouin people.

On the way back, glance up at the sky to see the starry night of the desert. Your tour will end with a hotel drop off.

title: Giza Pyramids and Sphinx: Half-Day Private Tour
experiences:
Learn the history of the Giza Pyramids and Sphinx
Enjoy a short camel ride around the Great Pyramid
Get there comfortably in air-conditioned, private transportation
fullDescription:
Meet your tour-guide in your hotel lobby and depart in a private, air-conditioned vehicle to the Giza Plateau.

The tour begins by exploring the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. You will visit the Pyramid of Cheops (The Great Pyramid of Giza), the largest pyramid in the world.

Continue your tour with visits to the Pyramids of Chephren and Mykerinos. Learn the architectural significance and fascinating history of these magnificent structures.

While on the Giza Plateau, you will see The Great Sphinx of Giza and learn about the mystery of one of the oldest and largest sculptures in the world.

title: 1-Hour Felucca Ride on the Nile
experiences:
Cruise the Nile river and enjoy some of the stunning views on board your Felucca
Enjoy a spectacular sunset over the River Nile
Discover Cairo's nightlife
fullDescription: Discover the river Nile as you cruise its waters in a traditional Felucca. Meet your guide in the lobby of your hotel and travel to the Nile pier in downtown Cairo and spend a day sailing down the same river Cleopatra did so many centuries ago. Enjoy a relaxing daytime cruise and let your hand glide along the Nile’s surface as you bathe in the warm Egyptian sun.\r\n\r\nChoose to take the cruise later on in the day and experience a spectacular sunset over Cairo from the deck or your boat, or alternatively hop on board the Felucca after the sun has set and observe Cairo’s buzzing nightlife from the river.

title: From Hurghada: Giftun Island Snorkeling Day Trip
experiences:
Relax during a 45-minute boat ride to Giftun Island
Marvel at the marine life in the crystal waters and swim with dolphins
Enjoy a delicious lunch on board while soaking up the sun
fullDescription:
After pick-up in Hurghada, head to the port. Here, board your boat to start a 45-minute voyage across the Red Sea.

Once you arrive at the National Park of Giftun Island, relax on the white sands of the island. When ready, gear up for your snorkeling adventure. Meet your professional snorkeling team who will take you to amazing underwater sites while providing interesting facts about marine life. Admire the coral reefs and observe fish as you snorkel through coral forests, maybe meeting a dolphin if you're lucky.

Return to the boat to enjoy a delicious lunch. Take in the spectacular views as you cruise back to Hurghada.

title: Cairo: Egyptian Museum & Khan El-Khalili
experiences:
Tour the marvels of the Egyptian Museum
Admire Tut-Ench-Amun’s collection
Enjoy shopping at Khan El-Khalili
fullDescription:
Journey to the heart of the pharaohs' civilization in an air-conditioned car that will pick you up from your hotel. Arrive in style at Tahrir Square in front of the Egyptian Museum, a majestic building constructed in 1902. The ground floor contains colossal statues spanning thousands of years, arranged in chronological order. Take an informative and enlightening tour of the upper floor, marveling at smaller statues, fossils, paintings, sarcophagi and ancient Egypt maps. The famous Tut-Ench-Amun also has an exclusive section in the museum. 

Before returning to your hotel stop by the vibrant colored market. The shops and bazaars display and sell a dizzying array of trinkets and artworks, giving you the chance to take home a small piece of Egyptian culture and civilization. Buy souvenirs for your friends or simply meander around the bustling shops.

Your guide will then drop you off at your hotel in Cairo.

title: Cairo Day Tour with Entry Fees and Lunch
experiences:
Take a guided tour of the 3 Pyramids of Giza
See the famous treasures of King Tutankhamun at the Egyptian Museum
Visit a papyrus workshop
Enjoy lunch at a Cairo restaurant
fullDescription:
Visit the most famous sights of Cairo on a full-day guided tour. A tour representative will meet you outside your hotel for the transfer to Cairo by comfortable bus.

When you arrive in Cairo you’ll be met by an Egyptologist guide and begin your tour of discovery at the Pyramids of Giza. Learn about each of the 3 pyramids, Khufu, Khafra and Menkaure, and then visit the Great Sphinx, the monumental statue with the head of a pharaoh on the body of a lion.

Lunch will be served at a local restaurant in Cairo. Afterwards, your tour continues with a visit to the world-famous Egyptian Museum. The museum houses over 165,000 Egyptian artifacts and the immeasurable riches of the golden treasures of King Tutankhamun are undoubtedly the highlight of the exhibition.

The 6 Tutankhamun gold sarcophagi are found in the main exhibit area, with his magnificent death mask the most important piece of this collection. Your guide will tell you about other top exhibits, and you’ll have plenty of time to explore the museum on your own.

If you’d like to buy some souvenirs of your trip, you might find some items you like when you visit a papyrus workshop and see the production of these works of art.

title: Hurghada: 5-Hour Quad Bike Desert Safari and Barbecue
experiences:
Take an adventurous ride on quad safari through the deserts of Hurghada
Discover the beauty of the desert by quad
Enjoy a 5 hour long exciting excursion and a well-earned barbecue
fullDescription:
You will picked up directly from your hotel, and taken to the quad bike training center, where you will get acquainted with your vehicle, and have the chance to take a few practice turns. As it has an automatic gearbox, all you need to do is accelerate and brake; learning to ride a quad bike isn't difficult!

Visit the deserts around Hurghada and become enchanted with the breathtaking atmosphere of this unique landscape. This tour does not start directly from Hurghada, but goes through the desert of El-Gouna, because the sands there are still largely free of tourists.

After around 1 hour, you will reach a small Bedouin encampment. A traditional Egyptian tea will be waiting for you as a sign of welcome. Relax and enjoy a Shisha pipe. With a little luck there will be camels at the camp, and you can take the opportunity to ride one through the desert. Riding on a camel is an experience like no other, which you should be sure not to miss.

After a pause for rest in the Bedouin encampment, you will ride on another hour through the desert to the next encampment. You'll be invited to lie down in a large tent, with soft blankets and cushions, and be served a delicious traditional Bedouin meal of grilled meats. Indulge your palate with carefully selected local specialties.

title: Cairo: Nile River Dinner Cruise with Entertainment
experiences:
Take in the sights of Cairo illuminated at night on a Nile River cruise
Savor a variety of dishes from an international dinner buffet
Enjoy folkloric and belly dancing shows
fullDescription:
Enjoy a night out in Cairo with this 3-hour Nile River dinner cruise. Board a steamer and experience the comfort and elegance as you take in the lights of Cairo after dark.

Feast on an open buffet that features Egyptian and international cuisine. In addition, you’ll be entertained by folkloric and belly dancing shows.

Experience a perfect ending, or addition, to your Egypt visit. This is the perfect opportunity to enjoy good food, unique entertainment and a romantic evening gazing at the glittering lights along the banks of the Nile River.

title: Cairo 4-Hour Guided Tour of the Egyptian Museum
experiences:
Discover the treasures of the Egyptian Museum with an Egyptologist guide
See the gold and jewelry that was entombed with King Tutankhamen
Enjoy transfers between your hotel and museum in air-conditioned comfort
fullDescription:
Add an in-depth tour of the Egyptian Museum to your stay in Cairo. You’ll visit the most important museum in Egypt with an Egyptologist as your guide.

On this 4-hour tour you’ll be picked up at your hotel and transferred to the Egyptian Museum, where your guide will show you highlights of the unbelievable collection of artifacts from the old, middle, and new kingdoms.

The museum house over 250,000 genuine artifacts, including the treasures of the most famous Egyptian pharaoh, Tutankhamen. The gold and jewelry on display was enclosed in his tomb for over 3,500 years before it was discovered in the 1920s during excavations.

At the end of the tour you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.

title: One-Way Transfer: Hurghada Airport to Makadi Bay
experiences:
Watch the scenery in comfort as your driver takes you from Hurghada International Airport to Makadi Bay
Enjoy the privacy and comfort of a private ride in an air-conditioned vehicle
Fly to Hurghada knowing that a punctual and safe trip to your destination awaits you
fullDescription: Enjoy a relaxing and comfortable transfer service from Hurghada International Airport to Makadi Bay. Save yourself the hassle of finding a taxi and negotiating prices with the driver, and arrive at your destination comfortably and on time. Book a private limousine or van and reach your destination in Makadi Bay in no time.\r\n\r\nYour driver will meet you at the airport and will be holding a sign with your name written on it. Get in the air-conditioned vehicle and experience a comfortable and stress-free start to your stay in Egypt. You can determine the speed of the drive as your transfer to your hotel in Makadi Bay. Along the way you can enjoy the views and gain your first impression of the wonderful vacation destination of Egypt.

title: Giza Pyramids and Egyptian Museum Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Explore the Great Pyramid of Giza and Great Sphinx
Take a tour of the Egyptian Museum with an expert guide
See artifacts from the pharaonic era and learn more about Ancient Egypt
fullDescription:
Journey by private air-conditioned vehicle to the Giza Plateau to discover one of the last remaining 7 Wonders of the World.

Benefit from the services of an Egyptologist guide at the Giza Pyramids complex and get detailed explanations about the structures, including the limestone statue of a reclining sphinx. 

Then, go to Cairo city center and enter the Egyptian Museum on Tahrir Square. Take a guided tour of the halls to see thousands of artifacts and learn more about the pharaonic era. Explore more than 5,000 years of Egyptian history through statues of kings, models of daily life and mummified animals.

title: From Hurghada: Full-Day Trip to Cairo by Plane
experiences:
Visit the famous pyramids of Giza
Admire the uniqueness of the Sphinx
Discover more about the history of the country at the Egyptian Museum
Enjoy shopping at the Khan el-Khalili market
fullDescription:
Travel from Hurghada to Cairo by plane, where you can enjoy an exciting day tour. You will be picked up at your hotel in Hurghada in an air-conditioned vehicle and transferred to the airport to catch a domestic flight to Cairo. Upon arrival in Cairo you will be greeted by the Egyptologist who will accompany you throughout the tour.

The tour starts in Giza, where you visit the famous and impressive pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinos as well as the Sphinx. After a break for a delicious lunch, the tour continues on to the Egyptian Museum. Here you can admire the treasures of the young pharaoh Tutankhamun as well as other artifacts. In the afternoon you can enjoy shopping at the Khan el-Khalili market.

At the end of the tour you’ll be transferred to the airport in Cairo to catch the flight back to Hurghada. Once there you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Sharm el-Sheikh: Evening Desert Tour with Bedouin Dinner
experiences:
Enjoy a candlelit dinner at a Bedouin camp in the Mander Valley
Ride a camel across the desert sands
Watch amazing fire and belly dance shows
Look at the stars through digital telescopes and learn about the constellations
Try some traditional Bedouin "habbak" tea
fullDescription:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh and then journey to a quad bike center far from the crowds and traffic, in an isolated desert location.

Meet your instructor and get a safety briefing. Benefit from the expertise of your instructor as they escort you through the desert for about 2 hours. You will make your way to a Bedouin camp, where you can take an optional camel ride. 

Reconnect with nature, surrounded by mountains, and get welcome drinks on arrival at the camp. Try some traditional habbak (wild mint) tea and learn how the Bedouins bake their bread. Then, climb to the top of a small hill to watch an amazing sunset and feel the desert breeze at the end of the day. Return to the Bedouin tent to enjoy an open buffet dinner of rice, vegetables, salads, tahini, fried chicken, shish kebab, fruits, local bread and sodas.

Watch an incredible fire show and belly dance show before looking at the stars through digital telescopes. Get interesting explanations about the night sky from an English-speaking astronomer. Return to Sharm el-Sheikh and get dropped off at your hotel on arrival.

title: From Hurghada: Full-Day Tour of Luxor
experiences:
Explore the world-renowned Valley of the Kings
Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut
Admire the Colossi of Memnon
Discover the spectacular Karnak Temple
fullDescription:
Explore the amazing sights of Ancient Egypt in Luxor with transfers to and from Hurghada. After picking you up from your hotel in Hurghada, we will drive to Luxor in an air-conditioned deluxe vehicle through lush farmland and sugar plantations to edge of the desert where you will find the tombs of the pharaohs in the Valley of the Kings.

Cutting directly into the mountains, the tombs were filled with treasures and covered in beautifully-painted hieroglyphics depicting the life of the king they housed. Your guide will bring the stories to life as you explore the tombs before continuing to the impressive mortuary Temple of Queen Hatshepsut.

Architecturally stunning, the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut contains beautiful murals on its inner walls. On our return to Luxor’s East Bank, we will visit the Colossi of Memnon – two gigantic statues that stand proudly, yet virtually alone at the entrance to what was Amenhotep III’s mortuary temple.

After lunch, we continue on to visit the famous Karnak Temple – the largest place of worship that was ever built. Its ancient name Ipet-isut means “the most sacred of places.” The temple, or, more correctly, the complex of temples, was built more than two thousand years ago by generation after generation of pharaohs. Within the complex, the great “Hypostyle Hall” is an incredible forest of giant pillars.

title: Quad Runner Bike Adventure: Sharm el Sheikh
experiences:
See the desert of Egypt in a whole new way
Race through the sands on your four-wheeler
Enjoy a picture perfect sunrise or sunset
Stop for tea in a traditional Bedouin tent
fullDescription:
As the sand whips past your eyes and ears, your heart beats faster. Here you are, in the grand desert near Sharm el Sheikh, driving your very own Quad Runner through the dunes and desert in a way that you'll never forget.

Your day begins with a pick-up from your hotel in Sharm el Sheikh, and then a quick drive to get some safety instructions and lessons on the bikes. You'll also be taught how to tie up your headropes, so that you don't come back all covered in sand and bruised from the pressure.

Then, we're off to the races. This unmissable experience brings you through the desert at the perfect time of day: sunrise or sunset! You will head to a high point in Wadi Al-Aat, where tea is served in a traditional Bedouin tent. At the end of your tea, we'll race back to town, and then finally return to your hotel.

title: Half-Day Red Sea Dive from Hurghada or El Gouna
experiences:
Explore the Red Sea marine life at popular dive spots in Hurghada
Swim with turtles, dolphins, and skate
Discover the great diversity of underwater life in the coral reefs
Enjoy 2 dives at 2 different dive sites
Relax over lunch on board the dive boat
fullDescription:
Experience the unique marine life of the Red Sea on a thrilling half-day dive tour from Hurghada or El Gouna.

A driver will pick you up from your hotel and transfer you direct to the dive boat. Climb aboard for your magnificent Red Sea adventure under the sea, and see underwater flora and fauna at popular dive spots.

Swim among coral gardens, and observe a great variety of animals, from schools of colorful fish to elegant skates, and even the occassional inquisitive dolphin or turtle.

You will make 2 dives in 2 different dive spots, such as Abu Ramada, Small Giftun, or Umm Gummar. An experienced guide/instructor will help you discover all the underwater wonders of the Red Sea, large and small.

Back on board the boat, lunch and soft drinks will be served as you sail between dive sites, or sunbathe on the transfer back to the port at Hurghada.

title: From Hurghada: Full-Day Tour to East & West Banks in Luxor
experiences:
Discover the treasures of Luxor with an Egyptologist guide
Explore the royal tombs in the Valley of the Kings
Visit the Temple of Queen Hapshepsut
fullDescription:
On this full-day excursion, you’ll be picked up early in the morning for the ride by luxury air-conditioned bus to the ancient city of Thebes. Drive along the beautiful Nile River Valley and admire the mountain and desert scenery along the way.

At the end of the 4-hour drive, you’ll be met by an Egyptologist guide, who will show you around the ruins.

Discover a land of mystery and ancient wonders as you cross the Nile to the West Bank to visit the famed Valley of the Kings. Tour the incredible complex of 63 tombs of the pharaohs dating back nearly 4,000 years.

See the royal tombs, decorated with scenes from Egyptian mythology, providing clues to the beliefs and funerary rituals of the period. Almost all of the tombs were opened and robbed in antiquity, but they still give an idea of the opulence and power of the rulers of the time.

Next, visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, one of the most successful female rulers of all time. Continue to the Colossi of Memnon, and admire the massive stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III.

Drive back to the East Bank, where you'll enjoy lunch at a local restaurant and a chance to freshen up. The last visit of the tour is the Karnak Temple before you begin the drive back to Hurghada.

title: Sharm El-Sheikh Airport Transfer
experiences: Enjoy a private transfer from Sharm El Sheikh airport to your hotel\r\nGet advice about where to go, where to shop and what to eat during your stay from your knowledgeable driver\r\n
fullDescription:
Our Representative will meet you at Sharm El Sheikh airport holding a sign with your name on it. From there, enjoy a comfortable transfer to your hotel in Sharm in an air conditioned private van. Upon arrival, your driver will help you until you arrive in your room at the hotel .

We offer transfers from Sharm airport to any hotel in Sharm and from any hotel to the airport .

During the transfer our representative will give you plenty of information for your holiday in Sharm, including, for example, tips about the weather, shopping, restaurants and much more. Our representative will also provide you with an idea of all the tours and excursions available to you during your vacation.

Feel free to book a one-way or return transfer as you prefer .The minimum number to book this transfer is only 2 people.

title: Half-Day Tour of Old Cairo & Khan El Khalili Bazaar
experiences:
Stop off at the Hanging Church and Ben Ezra Synagogue
See the Church of St. Barbara and the Church of Abu Serga
Browse the bazaar at Khan El Khalili
fullDescription:
Spend a half day seeing important cultural and historical sites in Cairo when you travel to Old Cairo and the Khan El Khalili Bazaar.

The bazaar is one of the most famous and oldest bazaars in all of the Middle East, dating back to 1382.

After spending time walking around the bazaar or shopping, continue to Old Cairo. Visit the Hanging Church, which dates back to the 3rd century AD. Then see the Ben Ezra Synagogue, which is, according to a local tradition, located on the site where Moses was found when he was a baby.

Continue on to see the Church of St. Barbara and the Church of Abu Serga, two of the oldest churches in Cairo.

title: Hurghada Grand Aquarium Entry Ticket and Tour
experiences:
Take a guided tour of Hurghada Grand Aquarium
Encounter the wildlife of rainforest, freshwater and sea environments
Benefit from hotel pick-up and drop off (optional)
fullDescription:
Discover the ""Red Sea in Glass"" with an entrance ticket and tour of the Hurghada Grand Aquarium, one of Egypt’s newest, family-friendly attractions!

Upon arrival at the park, enter a lush rainforest and visit the freshwater and marine aquariums to encounter up to 1,200 species in a series of 24 galleries that describe the world's natural ecosystems. See beautiful marine life, including stingrays, sharks and turtles, and get interactive at the touch tank!

Learn about the park's efforts to improve animal management and conservation, and go to the open area mini zoo to get up close to native wildlife. Once you have finished your tour, a guide will be waiting to take you back to your hotel (if option booked).

title: Cairo Airport: Private Transfer Service
experiences:
Experience our hassle-free transfer either to or from the Cairo Airport
Enjoy the comfort of our private air-conditioned vehicle
Relax and let us take care of your luggage for you
fullDescription:
If your plans call for a transfer from the Cairo Airport to a city hotel, our representative will meet you at the airport’s exit, holding a sign with your name on it. You’ll travel in air-conditioned comfort to the hotel. The car can accommodate up to 4 passengers.

On the other hand, if you’re traveling from your Cairo hotel to the airport, we’ll meet you at the reception area of your hotel in plenty of time to make your flight. Whether you’re arriving or departing, we’ll look after your luggage so that you can relax and enjoy yourself.

In order to avoid any delays due to heavy traffic in Cairo we always depart from city center hotels 3 hours before scheduled flight time.

Please note that if you require a vehicle that is accessible by wheelchair we can accommodate this need on request and at an additional charge.

title: Cairo Day Tour from Sharm El Sheikh by Air
experiences:
Take a full-day tour to Cairo from Sharm El Sheikh, including a return flight
Visit some of Cairo's most amazing sights and attractions, including the Great Pyramids and the Egyptian Museum
Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant in Cairo
fullDescription:
Our representative will pick you up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh. You will then be transferred to Sharm El Sheikh Airport to catch your flight to Cairo. At Cairo Airport you will be met and assisted by another of our representatives.

Our Egyptologist guide will accompany you to visit the great pyramid of Giza, which is the only existing wonder of the seven wonders of the ancient world. At the Giza plateau, you will not only see the great pyramid of Khufu, known as Cheops, but also the pyramid of Chefren, the pyramid of Mykerinus, the valley temple of Khefren and the iconic Great Sphinx. This amazing complex of structures dates back to almost 5,000 years ago.

From there, you will be taken to the Egyptian museum, which houses around 150,000 artifacts that date thousands of years to ancient Egyptian civilization. This is considered the largest and most precious collection of Egyptian art in the world. Take your chance to admire the incredible treasures of the boy-king Tutankhamun.

After the museum, you will also have the chance to wander in the oldest bazaar in the middle east, the Khan El Khalili Bazaar, where you will feel the atmosphere of living in Islamic Cairo hundreds of years ago. The bazaar dates back to 1382, A.D., and is just one of the fascinating places we will see, giving you a real taste of the ancient city of Cairo.

At the end of the day you will be transferred to Cairo Airport for a flight back to Sharm El Sheikh.

title: Sound and Light Show at the Karnak Temple Complex
experiences:
Experience the magic of the world-famous Karnak Temple sound and light show
Marvel at the colorful lights in the sky along the Nile River
Learn the fascinating story of the temple and the history of Thebes
fullDescription:
Watch in awe as the bright illuminations reflect off the water and light up the sky and the splendor of ancient Thebes comes back to glorious life.

Experience the world-famous one-hour sound and light show at the Karnak Temple on the banks of the Nile River. This unique show tells the story of the temple and the history of Thebes, including the lives and celebrated achievements of the great pharaohs who built the necropolis.

Marvel at the sheer size of the great hypostyle hall and view the eerie reflection of the temple at the Sacred Lake as you wander around the illuminated monuments and towering obelisks. Enjoy the perfect setting for a dramatic finale to an exciting show.

title: All-Inclusive Guided Tour of Luxor from Cairo by Plane
experiences:
Explore the most important treasures of the ancient world in Luxor led by an expert guide
Relax with return plane transfer from Cairo and air-conditioned transportation
Dine in a local restaurant with all food (not drinks) inclusive in the price
Experience the East Bank with the Luxor and Karnak temples
Explore the West Bank and visit the Valley of the Kings and the Colossi of Memnon
fullDescription:
Explore the many treasures of the ancient world on this all-inclusive day tour to Luxor from Cairo, traveling by plane and bus.

After being collected from your hotel in Cairo at around 05:30, drive by air-conditioned vehicle to the airport, ready to fly to Luxor. Your expert guide will meet you at the airport and your tour will begin.

Make an excursion to the Necropolis of Thebes on the Western Bank. Crossing the Nile, visit the Valley of the Kings, and see the grand tombs of some of the most powerful nobles and pharos of Ancient Egypt. On the return journey stop-off at the Colossi of Memnon, 2 gigantic statues representing Amenophis III facing the Nile. You will also have the chance to visit the famous Temple of Queen Hatshepsut.

Explore the Luxor Temple and marvel at the granite statues of Ramses the Great in the courtyard. Proceed by carriage or bus to Karnak–a series of temples spanning from different reigns and eras.

Walk through the Avenue of Sphinxes, visit the Hypostyle Hall with its 134 gigantic columns, see the Obelisks of Queen Hatshepsut and Tutomosis III, and witness the temple of Amon, adorned with exquisite lotus and papyrus designs.

After a whirlwind exploration into the treasures of the ancient world, transfer back to the airport for your return flight to Cairo, and to your hotel.

title: From Marsa Alam: Full-Day Tour of Cairo with Flights
experiences:
Immerse yourself in the impressive world of the pharaohs and explore the fascinating Pyramids of Giza
Discover the treasures of former kings and queens in the Egyptian Museum
Learn more about the history of Egypt
Admire the famous Sphinx, the guardian at the foot of the pyramids
fullDescription:
You will be picked up by air-conditioned vehicle at your hotel in Marsa Alam early in the morning and welcomed by your tour guide in Cairo. Your guide will accompany you throughout your tour of Cairo and tell you all about the history of Egypt.

The first destination on the day trip to Cairo is the Egyptian Museum. There you can explore the ancient treasures of the pharaoh Tutankhamun. After visiting the museum you will have time to rest a little and enjoy lunch at a selected restaurant.

After lunch you will visit the oldest surviving Wonders of the World – the Great Pyramid of Giza – as well as the Pyramid of Khafre and the Pyramid of Menkaure. Enjoy the fantastic view of all the pyramids of former kings and queens. You can then admire the famous guardian of the pyramids – the Great Sphinx.

At the end of the tour you will fly back to the airport in Hurghada and then driven back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

title: Cairo, Giza Pyramids, Memphis & Sakkara Day Tour
experiences: Make a full-day tour to the pyramids, one of the 7 wonders of the world\r\nSpend a day in Cairo with an Egyptologist guide\r\n
fullDescription:
See the wonders of Egypt on this tour. First you will visit the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus. Then make a stop at the Great Sphinx, which has the head of a pharaoh with a lion's body. The Sphinx dates to the time of Chephren. This tour also includes a visit to the Valley Temple, which belongs to the Pyramid of Chephren.

Continue sightseeing with an exciting tour to the Step Pyramids of Zoser, the world's oldest major stone structure. It was built in the 3rd Dynasty (around 2630 BC) for King Djoser.

Transfer to Memphis, which was founded by King Menes, and was the capital of Old Egypt during the Old Kingdom. It was considered to be a center of rule and culture for over 3000 years. The Statue of Ramses II is a highlight of this stop.

title: Hurghada: Sunset Desert Safari by Dune Buggy
experiences:
Cross the desert dunes outside Hurghada by dune buggy
Watch the sunset over the desert dunes
Enjoy a barbecue dinner under a canopy of stars
fullDescription:
Following pick-up from your hotel or assigned meeting point in Hurghada, journey to the outskirts of the Red Sea resort, passing local villages en route to an off-road base in the desert wilderness.

Upon arrival, get a briefing on how to operate the dune buggy before embarking on a self-drive adventure across the desert sands. Follow the guides in convoy, traveling through pristine sand dunes for a roller-coaster ride with stops to take stunning souvenir photos.

Watch a beautiful sunset as it melts across the horizon in a rainbow of colors, and then join an evening barbecue dinner before heading back to Hurghada, where you will be dropped off at your hotel.

title: From Aswan: Private Tour to Abu Simbel
experiences:
See the magnificent temples of Abu Simbel
Marvel at the rock-cut Small Temple of Queen Nefertari
Travel across the desert in the cool early morning
fullDescription:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Aswan, and then journey across the desert by private, air-conditioned vehicle in the cooler temperature of the morning.

Make your way to Abu Simbel to see the Great Temple of Ramses II and the temple of Queen Nefertari, both discovered in 1813 when they were almost completely covered with sand. Learn how they were moved in 1960 with the help of the government of Egypt and UNESCO to avoid the rising waters of the River Nile.

See the mural depicting the famous victory by Ramses II at the Battle of Qadesh and admire the Small Temple that he built for his favorite wife, Queen Nefertari. Marvel at the rock-cut sanctuary and its amazing bas reliefs before returning to Aswan to get dropped off at your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Private City Tour
experiences:
Discover the highlights of Hurghada on a private 3-hour tour in an air-conditioned vehicle
Enjoy the colorful crowds and the aroma of the Middle East with a wander through a traditional Egyptian bazaar
See the largest mosque in Hurghada and get to know a local fisherman at the harbor
fullDescription:
