Enjoy a 3-hour city tour with a personal guide through the sights of Hurghada. Admire the Great Mosque with its two tall minarets, the church of Santa Maria, and the harbor. Enjoy the typical Middle Eastern flair and the colorful crowds in a characteristic bazaar.

After pick-up from your hotel, take a discovery tour through the inner city of Hurghada before enjoying the chance to meet a local fisherman at the harbor. 

Take an breathtaking look at the Red Sea and wander through different parts of the city before returning to your hotel in Hurghada.

title: Cairo: Day Tour from Sharm el Sheikh
experiences:
Embark on a journey through time into the history of Egypt's ancient pharaohs and visit the main sights of Cairo
Drive through the Sinai Desert and visit the fascinating Egyptian National Museum with over 120,000 artefacts
Admire the Pyramids of Giza, take a look at the impressive Sphinx and stroll around the exotic markets
fullDescription:
Visit the impressive capital of Egypt with all its fascinating sights and enjoy the beautiful route along the coast of the Gulf of Suez and through the imposing Sinai Desert.

Visit the Egyptian Museum and admire the collection of more than 120,000 pieces of art. Take a look at the fascinating artifacts from the Old, Middle and New Kingdoms of Egypt as well as the exhibition of King Tutankhamen.

Then visit the pyramids of Giza – one of the seven wonders of the ancient world and the only one largely intact. Admire the imposing pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos. Explore the Giza Plateau and admire the beautiful scenery.

Then explore the Valley of the Kings and admire the impressive Sphinx. Visit the surrounding temples and enjoy lunch at one of the local restaurants. Stroll through the markets of Cairo and see the local produce, before returning to your hotel at the end of the day.

title: Cairo: 2-Day Bahariya Oasis Camp with White & Black Deserts
experiences:
Enjoy the drive into Egypt's western desert
Visit the crystal mountain
Discover the valley of the Golden Mummies
Explore the Famous White Desert and Black Desert
fullDescription:
At 07:00 on day one, your tour guide and driver will pick you up from your hotel in Cairo and take you to Bahariya Oasis, about 350 km east. This journey takes about 4 hours: lunch will be served at a local restaurant at Bahariya oasis. From here, you will continue on to the Black Desert, and the natural hot springs in the Valley of El Haize, before driving to the quartz crystals at Crystal Mountain, and the rocky formations in the Valley of Agabat.
 
Later on day one, explore the White Desert National Park, the most well-known desert destination in Egypt. The quantity of unearthly and beautiful wind-carved rock formations shaped in the form of giant mushrooms or pebbles is unequalled by any desert in the world. Arrive at the White Desert by sunset, and our Bedouin staff will arrange dinner and desert camping.

On day 2, you'll enjoy breakfast in the desert, before driving to Bahariya Oasis to get some rest and take a shower. Then drive back to Cairo.

title: Hurghada: 6-Hour 4WD Desert Safari, Dinner, and Show
experiences:
Stop to view mirages during a 4WD drive through the desert
Visit a Bedouin village and take a ride on a camel
Enjoy a traditional meal and see the Sahara Park show with traditional dancing
See the stars in the desert sky through a powerful digital telescope
fullDescription:
Experience the Hurghada desert and Bedouin life on this 4WD Land Cruiser Sahara Park Safari. You’ll be picked up at your hotel and drive through the desert, kicking up the sand on the Hurghada highway.

Along the way your driver will stop a couple of times for you to marvel at the mirages and to climb up a massive sand dune. When you arrive at the Bedouin village you’ll enjoy a welcome drink with a tasty boxed lunch.

On this 6-hour adventure, you’ll have time to tour the village and learn more about the traditional Bedouin way of life. Afterwards, you’ll climb on board a camel for a thrilling desert ride!

Enjoy the sunset from a mountaintop, taking in the spectacular views before you enjoy an open buffet dinner with soft drinks.

Thrill to the Sahara Park show, which begins with a tanura dance, followed by belly dancing, and folk songs.

Experience the stunning desert sky at night, watching the stars and planets through a powerful digital telescope.

At the end of the day you’ll be driven back to your hotel.

title: Giza Pyramids, Sakkara and Memphis Museum Guided Tour
experiences:
See the monumental Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau
Explore the burial sites of Egyptian pharaohs at the Pyramids of Giza
Wander through the Valley Temple
Visit the first step pyramid in history, built for the 27th century BC pharaoh Djoser
fullDescription:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Cairo or Giza, and then travel to the Giza Plateau to explore the pyramids of Ancient Egypt with an Egyptologist guide. Hear the amazing story about how the pyramids were built, and for what purpose, and get panoramic views of all the pyramids and Great Sphinx from a high vantage point.

Then travel to the step pyramid of Sakkara, built in the 27th century BC as a burial site for the pharaoh Djoser. Learn about the evolution of pyramid construction at one of the oldest and most important temple sites of Ancient Egypt.

Continue on to explore the Open Air Museum at Memphis and see the biggest statue in the world of Ramses the second.
Later you will be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Cairo: Camel or Horse Ride By the Pyramids
experiences:
Go on a camel or horse ride at the Giza Pyramids
See the Giza Pyramids from a unique perspective
Take a romantic, relaxing and unique tour
Visit the Valley of the Sphinx
fullDescription:
Have you ever been on a discovery tour in the desert? Then, try a horse or a camel riding experience at the Giza Pyramids during sunrise or sunset.

While experiencing the camel or horse ride, enjoy the fascinating view of the Great Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus and the Sphinx from the outside. The Great Pyramids and the Sphinx are considered the oldest of the seven wonders of the ancient world, tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years and the most important tourist site in Egypt.  

Have dinner or lunch after your ride camel in a good restaurant offering Egyptian food such as oriental soup, fish grilled or fried, shish kebab, chicken, five kinds of salad, one appetizer, rice, bread and dessert including a welcome drink karkadi. Then, head back to your hotel in the center of Cairo or Giza. This is a private tour, you will not be added to another group. All tours are accompanied by an expert tour guide and a groom to ensure that you will have a pleasant time in the desert including water and soft drinks.

title: Half-Day Cairo Sightseeing Tour to Pyramids of Giza & Sphinx
experiences:
Discover the Great Pyramid of Giza and the legendary Valley Temple
Explore the ancient Pyramid of Khufu and the Pyramid of Cheops
Gaze in awe at the Great Sphinx
fullDescription: Begin this half-day tour of the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx straight from your hotel in Cairo. Head toward the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus and discover the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, and the only one to remain largely intact. Egyptologists believe the Pyramid of Cheops (also known as the Great Pyramid of Giza) was built as a tomb for the Egyptian Pharaoh Khofo and constructed over a 14 to 20-year period in 2560 BC.\r\n\r\nAfterwards, continue on toward the Great Sphinx. The Sphinx has the head of a pharaoh with a lion's body and dates back to the time of Chephren. This sphinx was made to guard the pyramids of King Chefren. Next, visit the Valley Temple which belonged to the Pyramids of Chephren. The temple acted as a place for the purification and mummification process of the king before burial.

title: Full-Day Snorkeling Trip to Utopia Island from Hurghada
experiences:
Explore the fascinating and diverse underwater world of the Red Sea at various snorkeling sites
Admire the natural reefs, beautiful corals, and colorful fish surrounding Utopia Island
Enjoy a relaxing ride onboard a glass-bottomed boat
fullDescription: Experience a fascinating snorkeling adventure in the Red Sea. After the pick-up at your hotel you will head to the beautiful peninsula of Soma Bay, which will be your first snorkeling stop. Here there is also a pier, from which you will start the boat tour. Around Utopia Island are several natural reefs where you can enjoy snorkeling. Explore the unique underwater world and admire the countless colorful fish and beautiful corals.\r\n\r\nAfter a few snorkeling stops you can relax with a delicious lunch onboard the boat and recharge your batteries. Afterwards you will transfer to a glass-bottomed boat and spend a memorable few hours admiring the underwater world of the Red Sea below your feet. For two hours you will have a direct view into the crystal-clear waters surrounding Utopia Island.

title: From Cairo: Full-Day Tour of Giza Pyramids & Simon Cave
experiences:
Spend 8 hours visiting the Giza Pyramids, the Sphinx, Simon Church and the Hanging Church
Explore the land of the Pharaohs and the Holy Land
Enjoying tasting Egyptian food
Explore the cave of Saint Simon from inside the Mountain of Maqatam
fullDescription:
Your guide will meet you at 8:00 AM in your hotel lobby and will pick you up in an air-conditioned car to start your full-day tour. You will visit the Great Pyramids and have a close-up look at the Sphinx. You will have an extra half-hour in the desert between the three pyramids to have a look around the remains of this ancient civilization.

Then, continue your tour to visit the Coptic area of Cairo, where you can see the church of Abu-Sergah and St. Barbara, the hanging church and the old Jewish synagogue, Ben Ezra.

Your guide will then take you to Moqatem to visit Simon the Tanner, a famous church in Cairo, named for the Coptic Orthodox saint. After you finish your visit to Simon Cave, you will enjoy lunch at a local restaurant to taste Egyptian food. The tour ends here and you will then be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Full-Day Scuba Diving Tour with Lunch & Pick-Up
experiences:
Learn the basics of scuba diving from a certified instructor
Take in the beautiful views of the water and land as you cruise along the Red Sea
Go scuba diving at 2 different dives sites
Enjoy swimming and snorkeling in the water
Relax and eat an onboard lunch with drinks
fullDescription:
Spend a day out on the water learning to scuba dive on an 8-hour experience. This trip is suited for beginners and experts alike who simply want to enjoy the waters of the Red Sea.

After pick-up, you will be taken out on a boat to your first diving spot. Experienced instructors will guide you around the location and explain the specifics of the diving site. Then head into the sea and explore the underwater realm.

Once your first dive ends, enjoy an on-board lunch. Then you will move to a new site for the second dive. Opt to snorkel or swim if you feel like it. You will also have plenty of time to relax and sample the provided refreshments. In the late afternoon, you will be returned to shore.

title: From Hurghada: Pirates Premier Sailing Boat Trip
experiences:
Enjoy a day of premier snorkelling
Sail aboard the largest boat in the Red Sea
Admire coral reefs
Eat lunch and on board
fullDescription:
From your hotel you will be driven to Hurghada Marina, sailing for approximately one and a quarter hours towards Hurghada islands, Enjoy panoramic views of the islands and then two stops for swimming or snorkeling.

Lunch is served with an open buffet after the second stop. Relax and enjoy the sunshine. The duration of the trip is approximately 6 hours. Lunch and all drinks throughout the trip are included. Snorkeling equipment and life jackets are also included.

This luxury boat is the only one of its kind in Hurghada and is equipped with all kinds of rest and safety equipment in accordance with international standards. Sail for an hour to discover coral reef with two comprehensive snorkelling stops before returning to the Marina.

title: From Sharm: Introduction to Scuba Diving with Lunch
experiences:
Sail along the Red Sea to your first dive spot, where you'll see bright marine life
Receive diving instruction and carry out a safely dive with your guide
See native wildlife in their natural environment
fullDescription: Pick-up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh will be around 8:15 AM.On arrival at the marina, you are off to Tiran island for the day to receive your introduction to diving. The experienced diver will talk through with you all the basics of the dive and introduce you to the aqualung. Once you have this mastered, the rest is easy. They will go through the safety precautions that are taken and ensure that you fully understand the sign language that is used underwater. After being kitted up with the jacket, tank, weights and mask, its time to enter the water. When you are ready they will take you down below the surface at a steady pace and they will be with you at all times.\r\n\r\nThe rest of the day is spent taking a second dive if you have booked one or swimming or snorkeling at either of the other two stops the boat will make. The transfer vehicle will be waiting for you when you return to the port in the late afternoon and they will transfer you back directly to your hotel.

title: Private Sharm El Sheikh Airport Transfers
experiences:
Enjoy Sharm El Sheikh's scenery without having to worry about traffic or maps
Relax, knowing your driver will track your flight and allow for delays and early arrivals to Sharm El Sheikh Airport
Enjoy the privacy and comfort of a private ride through the Red Sea region
Avoid Sharm El Sheikh Airport's long lines for cabs with your priority reservation
fullDescription:
Arriving at a new destination can be a stressful experience. But with this private transfer from Sharm El Sheikh Airport to Sharm El Sheikh hotels, you can take the worry out of finding a taxi and skip the long lines with a guaranteed meet and greet.

An Egypt Excursions representative will pick you up outside the exit door of Sharm El Sheikh Airport and assist you with your luggage. They will be holding a sign with your name written on it, ready to transport you by private air-conditioned vehicle to your hotel.

The vehicles can take up to 4 passengers, and wheelchair accesible vehicles are available on request, for a small extra charge. Simply provide your flight details and hotel name on booking, and Egypt Excursions will make the arrangements. For transfers to Sharm El Sheikh Airport at the end of your trip, a transfer time of 2 hours before your flight time will be necessary.

title: From Sharm el-Sheikh: Mount Sinai Sunrise Climb
experiences:
Climb Mount Sinai to watch the sun rise over the Sinai Desert
Explore St. Catherine's Monastery
See where Moses received the 10 Commandments
fullDescription:
Watch the sunrise and see the amazing scenery of the Sinai Desert on an overnight tour to Mount Sinai, where Moses received the 10 Commandments.

Travel by private, air-conditioned van and retrace the footsteps of Moses to the summit of the mountain in time to see the sun rise over the desert as it was thousands of years ago. Make your way down at around 7:00 AM and stop at St. Catherine's Monastery to explore one of the oldest monasteries in the world.

Learn more about Saint Catherine, who was tortured to death for the sake of her religious beliefs, and see the chapel of the church where the Mosaic of Transfiguration is held.

title: Cairo Citadel, Old Cairo & Khan El Khalili Full-Day Tour
experiences:
Immerse yourself in Egyptian history with a sightseeing tour of Old Cairo's major sights
Visit the Cairo Citadel on the Moqattam Hills for grand views over the city
See the beautiful alabaster Mosque of Muhammad Ali, built for Muhammad Ali Pasha between 1830 and 1848
Discover the sights of Old Cairo, such as the Hanging Church and the Ben Ezra Synagogue
Wander the alleys of the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar and try out your bargaining skills
fullDescription:
Enjoy a fantastic orientation tour of Cairo on an 8-hour excursion that takes in the major monuments of Old Cairo and the maze of streets and stalls of the historic Khan El Khalili Bazaar.

Following a hotel pick-up from Cairo or Giza, you will drive up to the Saladin Citadel, constructed by Salah al-Din on the Moqattam Hills in 1183 AD as a defence against Crusader armies. Known for its fresh air and sweeping views of Cairo, it is now a preserved historic site of mosques and museums, including the Mosque of Muhammad Ali Pasha.

Designed by the Turkish architect Yousif Boushnaq, who came to Cairo especially from Istanbul to build the great building, the mosque's alabaster structure stands in beautiful contrast to the sandstone city. Continue to the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar, one of the oldest bazaars in the Middle East. Discover a maze of alleys that has been at the center of Cairo’s trading activities since the 14th century.

Then, visit Old Cairo to see major attractions such as the Hanging Church, the Ben Ezra Synagogue, the Church of St. Barbara, and the Church of Abu Serga, one of the oldest Coptic churches in Cairo.

title: Sharm el-Sheikh: Panoramic Submarine Adventure
experiences:
Immerse yourself in Nemo's world and let the beauty of the world under the Red Sea enchant you
Enjoy an incredible look at the colorful fish and impressive coral from your submarine
Relax as you explore the depths of the sea
fullDescription: Discover the breathtaking underwater world of the Red Sea from an incredible new perspective. After a pick-up from your hotel, go directly to the submarine and immerse yourself in the Red Sea. This modern submarine features over 18 panoramic windows, which offer unique views of the coral reefs and a fascinating variety of exotic and colorful fish.\r\n\r\nSit back and relax in your seat as you venture to the depths of the sea. Discover the breathtaking varieties of coral and fish of all shapes and sizes.

title: Hurghada Jungle Aqua Park Tickets, Transfer, and Lunch
experiences:
Choose from among the 35 water slides at Jungle Aqua Park
Swim in one or more of the 14 outdoor pools at Hurghada’s largest water theme park
Relax by a pool or use one of the sun beds
fullDescription:
Fun and thrills await you at the largest water theme park on the Red Sea coast. Enjoy the water games, huge swimming pools, wave pools, rafting, and more with a full-day admission ticket.

A tour company representative will pick you up at your hotel at the agreed time and drive you to Jungle Aqua Park, where you’re sure to enjoy the wide range of water sports and social activities with your family and friends.

The Jungle Aqua Park features 35 water slides, 14 outdoor swimming pools, a heated pool, water lakes, poolside umbrellas, and sun beds. Hurghada’s largest water theme park is located just 25 minutes by car from the downtown area.

At the end of your day of fun you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Full-Day Snorkeling Tour to Utopia Island with Pick-Up
experiences:
Enjoy a wonderful day in Safaga and Utopia Island
Snorkel among colorful fish and corals
Explore the exotic underwater world at two different snorkeling sites
Enjoy a delicious lunch with soft drinks onboard the boat
Experience a ride onboard a glass-bottomed boat
Discover the exotic and colorful flora and fauna of the Red Sea
See corals, plants, fish, and other marine animals
fullDescription:
Discover the underwater world of Egypt on this full-day snorkeling trip from Hurghada. You will be picked-up at your hotel early in the morning and driven to Safaga. Here you will meet your guide, who will accompany you throughout the day.

After a brief introduction and overview of the day’s program, the boat will anchor at the first snorkeling site. Your snorkeling guide will select the best places for snorkeling depending on the weather, allowing you to experience as much of the colorful underwater world of the Red Sea as possible.

Cruise to the location on the program, where you can once again observe numerous exotic and colorful fish, plants, corals, and other marine life. Enjoy a delicious lunch onboard the boat before cruising to Utopia Island on a glass-bottomed boat. You will have a fantastic view into the sea through the transparent bottom of the boat. You will then have enough time on the island for swimming in the sea or relaxing in the sunshine.

title: Snorkeling Adventure: Ras Mohammed National Park by Boat
experiences:
Sail into the beauty of Egypt's only National Park
Dive into the refreshing waters for a look at the underwater world
Make 3 stops along the way
Relax on board with free water and soft drinks
fullDescription:
The crystal clear waters stretch out in front of you as you sail towards one of the most beautiful sites for snorkeling anywhere in the world. An easy drive and sail from Sharm el Sheikh, your day of snorkeling will be filled with colorful creatures and over 130 sorts of coral and 1,000s of brightly colored fish in Egypt's only National Park.

Departing your hotel in Sharm el Sheikh at 8:00, you will take a quick drive to the dock before sailing off into the paradise. There are two or three stops for snorkeling along the way, depending on conditions. You will stop in the Red Sea, Gulf of Aqba, and the Gulf of Suez. There's gear to hire on board, or bring your own and enjoy your day out at sea!

Arrive back at your hotel around 17:00.

title: From Marsa Alam: Day Trip to Luxor by Bus
experiences:
Experience the Temple of Karnak, the largest temple ever constructed
Have a delicious lunch at a restaurant
See the two statues of Amenhotep III
Visit the royal tombs in the Valley of the Kings
Discover the life of a female Pharaoh at Hatshepsut temple
fullDescription:
You will be picked up from your hotel in Marsa Alam and driven to Luxor in an air-conditioned vehicle. Here you will visit the famous Temple of Karnak, the largest religious building ever constructed. The ancient Egyptian name for the place is Ipet-isut, meaning the holiest of all places.

After this, you will enjoy a wonderful lunch at a restaurant. Then you will head to the western bank of the Nile, where the colossal statue of Amenhotep III, the colossus of Memnon, awaits. Continue on to the Valley of the Kings, to see the breathtaking graves of the Pharaohs.

You will visit 3 tombs and then continue on to the Mortuary Temple of Hatshepsut in El Deir El Bahary. This imposing temple, dedicated to Queen Hatshepsut, the only female Pharaoh, rises in a series of terraces from the desert plain, perched on sandstone cliffs. At the end of your tour, you will be returned to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

title: One-Way Airport Transfer from Hurghada to El Gouna
experiences:
Experience pure luxury with this relaxing transfer from Hurghada International Airport to your hotel in El Gouna
Sit back, relax, and enjoy your first impressions of Egypt along the way
Enjoy a stress-free arrival in Egypt with a pre-arranged airport transfer
Save yourself the hassle of searching for a taxi at the airport
fullDescription: Experience a stress-free arrival at Hurghada International Airport and treat yourself to a little luxury after a long, tiring flight. With this transfer service you will be picked up at the airport and driven in a private limousine or van to your hotel in El Gouna.\r\n\r\nEnjoy a relaxing start to your vacation with this pre-arranged transfer service. Your friendly driver will meet you at the airport and will be holding a sign with your name written on it. You will then enjoy a relaxing drive to your hotel in El Gouna in an air-conditioned vehicle with room for up to 8 people. Simply sit back, relax, and enjoy the view along the way.

title: Cairo Food Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a food tour of Cairo
Visit traditional restaurants
Taste the best food in Egypt
fullDescription:
To enjoy the real taste of Egypt you have to try the best Egyptian food - one of life’s great pleasures, Discover off-the-beaten-path spots and the real Egypt that is not covered in any guidebook.

This food tour offers an unforgettable and amazing experiences in one of the oldest cultures and cuisines in the Mediterranean. Find the best places to eat in Egypt and enjoy many delicious food tastings.
Become an Egyptian food expert and learn how to spot the fake stuff from the real thing!

title: Desert Safari by Quad Bike Around Pyramids
experiences:
Enjoy a desert safari
Ride a quad bike
Travel around the Pyramids
fullDescription:
Your tour guide will be waiting at your hotel for you. They will be holding a sign of your name. From the moment your tour starts, your guide will give you their full attention. Once in the car, your guide will talk to you about all the things on the way as well as other aspects of your tour that will interest you.

Enjoy the only place in Egypt where you can experience the wonders of the ancient world through the quad bike tour Desert Safari by Quad Bike Around Pyramids experience with a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus.

What is unique about this tour is getting there is half the fun, Be near the great pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx enjoying the adventure of quad bikes. Afterwards travel in comfort back to your hotel.

title: Day Trip to Old Cairo and 3-Hour Dinner Cruise
experiences:
Visit Sultan Hassan Mosque
Marvel at Old Cairo
Enjoy sailing on the River Nile aboard a traditional felucca wooden sailing boat
Watch traditional folkloric and belly dancing shows
fullDescription:
Your guide will pick you up ftom your hotel in Cairo or Giza to visit everything special in Cairo. First, go to the Sultan Hassan Mosque, which is one of the largest and most important medieval mosques in Cairo.

Next, you drive to Old Cairo. In old Cairo, you will be able to visit the Babylon fortress and the St. Sergios Church with its crypt, where the holy family took refuge. You will also visit the hanging church, rich in antiquities from the early Christian period, as well as St. Barbara Church, where the relics of Saint John are kept.

Saving the best for last, your tour will end with a 3-hour Nile cruise with dinner. An evening cruise on one of the Nile boats is a wonderful opportunity to spend and look at Cairo's skyline at night. During the evening, you will find everything your heart desires at an open buffet. In addition, on this Nile cruise in Cairo you will watch a belly dance show, Arabic songs and music, along with a Tanoura show while delighting in your delicious meal. Spend an evening in the open air, enjoy the good food, the unique entertainment and the magnificent views of the banks of the Nile.

title: Giza Pyramids & Egyptian Museum from Hurghada by Bus
experiences:
See the best of Cairo's monuments in one day
Visit the Great Pyramids of Giza and see the pyramids of Cheops, Khafre and Mykerinos
Explore the massive mortuary tombs and the statue of the Great Sphinx
Go to the Valley Temple
Tour the Egyptian Museum, home to more than 120,000 relics of Ancient Egypt
Marvel at the treasures of the child King Tutankhamen
Wander the narrow streets of the Khan El Khalili Market, the oldest bazaar in the Middle East
fullDescription:
Explore the best of Cairo’s monuments on a full-day coach tour from Hurghada, and see the Giza Plateau and Egyptian Museum, home to more than 120,000 relics of Egyptian history.

A tour representative will pick you up at 02:30 from your Hurghada hotel for the coach transfer to Cairo. Upon arrival, your Egyptologist guide will take you to the stunning Pyramids of Giza in the Giza Plateau. The oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, the pyramids of Cheops, Khafre and Mykerinos form the major highlight of the Giza Necropolis.

Tour the massive mortuary tombs of the Pharaohs, and the Great Sphinx statue, constructed in the shape of a lion’s body with a human head. Explore the Valley Temple before a light lunch at a local restaurant.

Continue into central Cairo to wander the galleries of the remarkable Egyptian Museum, home to an astonishing collection of relics from the pre-dynastic era to the Pharaonic era and the Greco-Roman period. A highlight of its treasures are the artifacts of the child King Tutankhamen, but look too at the displays of other Pharaonic Gods and Goddess, and visit the mummies room to learn about mummification art in ancient Egypt.

Finally, visit the Khan El Khalili Market, the oldest market in the Middle East, and search for unique souvenir gifts, before the drive back to Hurghada.

title: Hurghada: 3-Hour Morning Quad Safari
experiences:
Drive a beach buggy through the Hurghada desert
Meet friendly Bedouins in their tents
Ride a camel and explore the Bedouin village
fullDescription:
You’ll be picked up at your hotel and transferred by air-conditioned bus to the beach buggy station. Begin your 3-hour tour with a 25-kilometer buggy drive to the Bedouin village.

When you arrive, you’ll meet friendly locals and have a chance to sit and talk with them. Learn about their inspiring culture and way of life while enjoying the taste of Bedouin tea.

You’ll ride a camel around the village to see more of the area. Return to your beach buggy and drive it back to the beach buggy station.

From there you’ll be transferred back to your hotel by bus.

title: Hurghada: Full-Day Scuba Diving Adventure Tour with Lunch
experiences:
Discover the magnificent flora and fauna of the Red Sea's underwater ecosystem
Get dive tips and advice from a dive master who will be nearby at all times
Enjoy a complimentary lunch
fullDescription:
Following an early morning pick-up from your hotel in Hurghada, transfer to a tour boat for the start of your dive adventure in the Red Sea.

Go to the first dive spot and prepare to discover the incredible underwater ecosystems. You don't need to know how to dive to take part; a dive master or instructor will be there to help you for the entire tour. All you need do is breathe and take in the magnificent surroundings!

Dive in the pristine waters of the Red Sea to see its remarkable flora and fauna. If you decide not to go underwater, enjoy some casual snorkeling or sunbathe on the white sand beaches. After the first dive spot, head to another reef for a second dive.

Lunch will be served at approximately 14:00 and you will return to your hotel at around 16:30.

title: From Cairo: Alexandria Day Tour
experiences:
See the library of Alexandria and the statues of Alexander and Ptolemy keeping watch outside
Wander around the markets in the old city center where you're sure to find a treasure or two
Explore the Montaza Gardens surrounding the palace
Admire the Abbo Elabbas Mosque, the most beautiful mosque in the city
Stop for unique photo opportunities
fullDescription:
Alexandria has so much to see, feel, eat and buy – fit in as much of it as possible on this day tour from Cairo. Start your day trip to Alexandria with pick-up from your accommodation in a comfortable vehicle. The first stop on this full-day tour will be a visit to the Library of Alexandria, the biggest library in the world. Now housing 8 million books, you can visit its open court to see the statues of Alexander the Great and Ptolemy the First keeping watch over the library. 
 
The car will then whisk you off to the Church of St. Mark, the oldest church in Africa. Then, continue on to the old downtown of Alexandria where you can walk through traditional markets where everything and anything is sold. Admire the downtown’s Baroque designs and Italian- and French-style properties. If you choose, have lunch in a famous restaurant called “Mohamed Ahmed’s” – the Queen of Spain has eaten here! Take a break in a coffee shop or shisha café before continuing on with your tour.
 
Continue your Alexandria adventure in the afternoon with a packed itinerary of sights. See the city’s oldest market area which contains both the women’s markets and the most spectacular gold market where everyone buys their wedding jewelry. See the prettiest and largest mosque in the city, the Abbo Elabbas Mosque, and the ancient fun-fair located just outside of it where children still play. Opposite is the corniche and old harbour where you can see fishing boats and traditional fishers making nets. From here, walk 5 minutes to see the Quaitbay castle. See Memorial of the Unknown Soldier, and the beautiful coastline on the way to the Montaza Palace and Gardens (also known as the Love Garden for its popularity with couples!). All of these will make for excellent photo opportunities, so don't forget your camera. Finally, cross over the modern Bridge of Stanley before travelling in comfort back to your hotel.

title: Cairo: Tahrir Square Tour & Egyptian Museum
experiences:
See the Tahrir Square, where the Egyptian revolution broke out
Explore the Egyptian Museum
Marvel at Tutankhamun's exclusive section in the museum
fullDescription: You will find an air-conditioned bus waiting for you at your hotel at the arranged pick-up time. Heading for the Egyptian museum and your courier will be holding a sign with your name. Refresh yourself by cool drinks served to you during the drive.\r\n\r\nThe first step of the day tour is to the home of the monuments to the Pharaohs’ history. This museum  hosts more than 120,000 rare artifacts from the Three Kingdoms, At least half of which are on display. You have two “full” floors with 107 halls to view. While the ground floor holds heavy statutes,  the second floor contains the small statues, papyrus, the mummies and the world’s most extensive collection of the boy King of Tut-Ench-Amun. Take your time discovering his shining items, but pull yourself from the bewitching room and put in mind, the most astonishing has not been shown yet.

title: Dolphin Red Sea Clear Water Snorkeling
experiences:
Experience the fun of snorkeling
Watch dolphins in their natural habitat
Enjoy this relaxing trip with lunch and a soft drink
fullDescription:
Begin the trip by setting sail at around 9:00 AM where the astonishing clarity of the water will reveal a mesmerizing underwater world full of colors you don’t see above the Red Sea.

Upon arrival at the marina, your guide will provide you with all the equipment you need, before explaining how to use it, as well as how to ensure that you will be warm and comfortable during your snorkeling tour.

Later, your boat will sail for around 1 hour to the first snorkeling spot, where you will have chance to see dolphins. Then, it will take you to the other area for snorkeling with around 30 minutes of sailing between each one.

After the second snorkeling area, you will be offered lunch on the boat with 1 soft drink.

The trip will finish around 4:00 PM when you will be taken back to the marina.

title: Sharm: Tiran Island Snorkeling Day Trip with Lunch
experiences:
Sail across the Red Sea to Tiran Island
Snorkel with the marine life of an underwater sanctuary
Enjoy lunch aboard the boat and relax on the white sand beaches
fullDescription: Climb aboard and set sail across the Red Sea from Sharm El Sheikh to the sanctuary of Tiran Island. Upon arrival, discover an underwater paradise for snorkeling and avail of the services of experienced instructors. Benefit from tips for beginners and explanations about the local marine life.\r\n\r\nTake 1 or 2 dives to experience the underwater landscapes and encounter a variety of different fish and other sea life. Avail of soft drinks throughout the day, along with lunch served on board the boat in the afternoon. Find perfect spots to relax on the white sandy beaches.

title: From Hurghada: Cairo Full-Day Tour including Flights
experiences:
Discover the fascinating world of the pyramids and visit the Great Pyramid and the Pyramid of Khafre in Giza
Admire the treasures of the pharaohs in the Egyptian Museum as well as the largest collection of Egyptian relics
See the largest and most famous Sphinx in the world – one of the most important landmarks of Egypt
fullDescription:
Combine your vacation in Egypt with a day trip to Cairo. You will be picked up at your hotel and driven to the airport. Your tour guide will be waiting for you in Cairo and will take you to visit the Egyptian Museum. There you can admire the magnificent treasures of the young pharaoh Tutankhamun and the impressive ancient riches of human culture.

Afterwards you can enjoy traditional Egyptian cuisine at a local restaurant before heading on to the oldest surviving wonder of the world – the Great Pyramid of Giza. You will also see the Pyramid of Khafre and the Pyramid of Menkaure, and can enjoy the breathtaking view over all the pyramids of the former kings and queens from the plateau. You will then drive to the guardians of all pyramids – the Great Sphinx of Giza.

At the end of the day you will be driven to the airport in Cairo, where you will catch the flight back to Hurghada. You will be met at the airport in Hurghada and transferred back to your hotel.

title: From Cairo: Overnight Trip to Alexandria
experiences:
See the catacombs of Kom El Shokafa
Stop for a photo at Pompay's Pillar
Walk through the Library of Alexandria Manuscripts museum
Discover the Castle of Kaitbey
Visit the Montaza Gardens and the Palaces
fullDescription:
On day one, you will be picked up from your hotel and begin the journey to Alexandria. Once there, visit the insides of the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa which are the largest Roman Cemetery consisting of three levels cut in the rock. 

Then, drive to visit the Roman Amphitheater of Alexandria with the display of the sunken monuments of Alexandria which were discovered under the East harbor of Alexandria. You will also drive by Pompay’s Pillar and stop for a photo stop. 

After that, visit the Citadel of Quaitbay from inside and take outstanding photos inside and outside of it before heading to the library of Alexandria. Visit it’s open court where you can see the statue of Alexander the Great and the statue of Ptolemy the first. There, visit the library's reading halls, president Saddat Museum, and the impressions of Alexandria Museum.

The car will then take you to visit the church of St. Mark, the oldest church in Africa, and El Nabi Daniel Mosque before taking you back to your hotel to stay overnight in Alexandria. 

On day two, be picked up from your hotel by your tour guide after breakfast. Then, travel to the biggest mosque in the city, the Abbo Elabbas Mosque before continuing to see the outside of Quaitbay castle which was built on the same site as the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria, one of the seven wonders of the world. 

Next, head to the gardens of Montaza where you can visit the royal gardens of King Farouk and see the royal palaces of Haramlek and Salamlek as well as walk along the famous Montaza bridge.

On your way back, stop over the famous bridge of Stanley, the landmark of modern Alexandria before returning to Cairo with an A/C car.

title: From Makadi Bay: Day Trip to Cairo by Bus
experiences:
Spend an exciting day in Cairo on a bus tour and immerse yourself in the history of ancient Egyptian pharaohs
See the Egyptian Museum's countless exhibitions and the treasures of Tutankhamen
Visit the Pyramids of Giza with Cheops, Khafra and Menkaure, and see the Sphinx
fullDescription:
Discover the beauty of Cairo in one day. Enjoy an incredible view along the coast of the Red Sea during your arrival by bus.

Once in the city, visit the Egyptian Museum with the incredible treasures of the boy king Tutankhamen and countless artifacts of Egyptian history. Then see the Pyramids of Giza (Cheops, Khafra and Menkaure). Learn more about the fascinating construction of the pyramids and see the world-famous Sphinx.

During the tour, enjoy a delicious lunch at a restaurant near the pyramids and return to your hotel in Makadi Bay at the end of the day.

title: Sharm : Quad Bike Safari Adventure with Transfers
experiences:
Cross the dunes of the Sinai Desert by Quad Bike
Stop at a Bedouin tent and try some local Bedouin tea
Experience a Sinai Desert sunset from a unique perspective
fullDescription:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh, and then journey to a Quad Bike center not from the resort, but far from the crowds and traffic in an isolated desert location.

Meet your instructor and get a safety briefing and some tips on how to get the best out of what lies ahead. Benefit from the expertize of your instructors as they escort you through the desert for about 2 hours. Make your way to a Bedouin tent, where you will be welcomed with a complimentary drink.

Get some time to freshen up while the Quad Bike engines cool down. Purchase extra drinks if you still need hydrating before setting off again. Experience the drama of Echo Mountain, where the fun really kicks in! Scout around the mountain landscape and take stunning souvenir photos.

Follow your instructors to secret passages deep in the desert for the most thrilling Quad Bike ride. At the end of your adventure, sit back and relax on the journey back to your hotel.

title: Hurghada Dolphin Show Tickets and Transfer
experiences:
Get up close and personal with dolphins
Witness their amazing intelligence and charm for yourself
Enjoy an admirable show with a dolphin and a friendly sea lion
fullDescription:
Enjoy an unforgettable stay in Hurghada unforgettable and witness an extraordinary 1-hour dolphin show at the beautiful Dolphin House.

Get picked up directly at your hotel in Hurghada in the afternoon and enjoy a convenient 20-minute drive to the Dolphin House in a comfortable, air-conditioned vehicle. Once you arrive, get ready for an incredible 1-hour dolphin show with 3 incredibly smart and playful dolphins.

Get up close and personal to the dolphins, and witness the intelligence and charm of these special animals with your whole family, while taking as many photos as you can of this unforgettable show.

After the 1-hour spectacle, enjoy a transfer directly back to your hotel in Hurghada.

title: From Marsa Alam: All-in-One Super Desert Safari
experiences:
Climb a mountain to watch the sunset over the desert
Visit a Bedouin village to learn more about traditional life near Port Ghalib
Watch folk shows and belly dancing under a canopy of stars
fullDescription:
Benefit from hotel pick-up in Marsa Alam, and then journey by 4WD jeep towards the El Fayrouze Hotel, 5 kilometers from Port Ghalib. Continue to a Bedouin village to experience the traditional life of the desert.

Stop to take photos of the famous acacia trees and get a window into life in the wilderness. Take a tour of the village and stimulate your senses by going on a camel ride across the sands. Get the option to explore by Quad Bike on request to experience the landscape from a different perspective.

Visit a Bedouin pharmacy and enjoy some Bedouin tea before climbing a 400-meter mountain to watch the sunset. Relax under a canopy of stars and enjoy dinner as you watch traditional folk shows, such as belly dancing and the whirling dance of the tanoura show.

title: Cairo: 2-Hour Felucca Ride on the Nile
experiences:
Enjoy a ride on the Nile in a traditional Egyptian sailboat and relax away from big city stresses
Admire the highlights of Cairo from the water and learn about the history of Egypt
Experience the incredible colors of sunrise or sunset from the water
fullDescription: After pick-up from your hotel in Cairo, take a felucca ride on the Nile. Enjoy refreshing breezes with a ride on a traditional Egyptian sailboat. Along the way, learn interesting facts about the history of Cairo.\r\n\r\nEnjoy an incredible outing with friends or family away from the stress of the big city and see a spectacular view of Cairo from the water. Sit back, relax, and watch the sun set.

title: Marsa Alam: Sunset Desert Safari Excursion By Quad Bike
experiences:
Ride a quad bike in the Egyptian desert near Marsa Alam
Visit a Bedouin village to learn about local traditions and culture
Enjoy a delicious buffet dinner and a Bedouin show
fullDescription:
You will be picked up from your hotel in Marsa Alam in the afternoon and drive to Sheikh Malek, 25 kilometers north of Marsa Alam airport. Once you feel comfortable on the quad bike, ride through the desert for approximately 22 kilometers between the mountains of the Eastern desert to a Bedouin village to visit a local tribe.

At the Bedouin village, you'll be welcomed with tea and learn more about the life and traditions. See how traditional bread is baked, see the water well, and try smoking a water pipe. Then you'll take a camel ride to witness the amazing views of the sunset. Afterwards, have a barbeque dinner in the heart of the mountains.

Enjoy watching a Bedouin show and you savour a delicious barbeque open buffet dinner. The show includes the performance of folk songs, and belly dancing. At the end of the evening, you will drive your quad bike back to the station, then transfer back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

title: Sharm El Sheikh: Private Airport Transfer with London Cab
experiences:
Be driven by a professional chauffeur
Choose between airport or hotel pick-up
Enjoy a private transfer
Relish in the transport of an air-conditioned vehicle
fullDescription:
Avoid the torment and stress of waiting for taxis by opting for this affordable airport transfer. Your skilled driver will be waiting for you at the airport with a name sign in the arrivals hall. From here they will help with your luggage before guiding you to your premium airport transfer.

For hotel pick-up, your driver will meet you at your hotel lobby. Please be ready and waiting 10 minutes before your designated meeting time. It is recommended to give your flight number in advance, so your driver can arrive at the appropriate time. If there happens to be a delay in your flight, your driver will be waiting until you arrive safely at no extra fee.

All drivers have excellent experience and a wealth of knowledge of the city. If you have any questions at any stage of your transfer, simply ask. Whether you’d prefer music, talking or simply snoozing after a long journey, your driver will get you safely to the right destination.

title: Hurghada: 6-Hour Evening Experience with Show & Dinner
experiences:
Experience the special oriental atmosphere of Alf Leila Wa Leila hotel
Admire a breathtaking show with traditional music and stunning light effects
Enjoy a delicious dinner with traditional delicacies
fullDescription: Immerse yourself in the world of Arabic myths and legends, and enjoy an evening of One Thousand and One Nights. You will be picked at your hotel in Hurghada and driven to the magnificent hotel Alf Leila Wa Leila.\r\n\r\nAt the hotel you can enjoy a delicious dinner with traditional delicacies. Following this, you can enjoy a fantastic show that will not only impress you with exotic music and stunning light effects but also take you back to the time of the pharaohs. Admire the replica exhibits and marvel at the famous monuments of bygone times. Be enchanted by a fascinating belly dance and a pharaonic horse show.

title: From Hurghada: Sharm El Naga Full-Day Snorkeling Tour
experiences:
Admire the gorgeous bay of Sharm El Naga and enjoy a relaxing and peaceful day
Discover the beautiful coral reefs and enjoy snorkeling in the bay among the stunning marine life
Enjoy the fantastic sandy beach, relax in the sunshine, and be enchanted by a touch of paradise
fullDescription:
Discover the gorgeous bay of Sharm El Naga. Located just 40 kilometers from Hurghada, this bay offers the perfect balance for all visitors seeking peace and quiet. After the pick-up at your hotel, the guide will drive you to the bay in an air-conditioned vehicle, where you will start the day of pure relaxation.

Upon arrival you can explore the unique nature reserve. This quiet bay is a great location for you to relax on your vacation. Sharm El Naga is famous for its beautiful coral reefs and crystal-clear water. Relax on the fantastic sandy beach and enjoy swimming and snorkeling in the protected reef. Discover the magnificent underwater world and explore a little paradise.

Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant before returning to Hurghada by bus in the afternoon, where you will be dropped off at your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Classic Family Red Sea Cruise
experiences:
Swim and snorkel in selected coral reef spots
Explore the crystal clear waters of the Red Sea
Relax on board on the special sun deck
Enjoy a delicious traditional lunch buffet served on board
fullDescription: Discover the beauty and secrets of the Red Sea on a day-long boat cruise. Explore 3 select snorkeling sites where you will have the opportunity to explore the colourful underwater world and coral reefs. Keep your eyes peeled for rays, sea turtles, angelfish, and playful dolphins in their natural habitat. \r\n\r\nEnjoy a sumptuous lunch buffet served onboard with salads and grilled dishes prepared in the traditional way.

title: 7-Hour Desert Safari from Sharm el-Sheikh
Cario: Pyramids Viewpoints Tour
experiences:
See the pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus
Visit the Valley Temple where the Pharaoh was mummified
Learn hidden stories about the monuments
fullDescription: See the Pyramids from 7 magical vantage points which are unique for taking pictures. Hear about all the hidden stories of these great Pyramids. See special panoramic views of the Pyramids as you learn about the history of Ancient Egypt.\r\n\r\nThe tour includes many outstanding photo stops and a visit to the Valley Temple which belongs to the Pyramids of Chephren. This temple served for the purification and mummification process of the king before his burial.

title: Cairo Day Trip with Egyptian Museum Tickets: From El Gouna
experiences:
Visit the Egyptian Museum and see masterpieces of art and artifacts from Dynastic Egypt
See the Pyramids of Giza
Experience daily life in Egypt at the Khan-el-Khalili bazaar
fullDescription:
Early in the morning, around 2:30, you will be picked up from your hotel in El Gouna or its vicinity, to travel in an air-conditioned minibus or car, to Cairo. The journey lasts around 5 hours.

At the half-way point you will stop for a rest and a break at a service station. The day will be long, and full of excitement, so we recommend you sleep through this part of the journey, taking you through the desert, where there isn't so much to see.

When you arrive in Cairo your guide will be waiting for you by the Egyptian Museum. He will accompany you the whole day.

The first thing you will see is the Egyptian Museum. Your guide will take you through the vast museum, showing you the masterworks of the collection, and explaining them expertly. By the time you're finished it will be midday, and time for lunch.

After lunch you will go to see the pyramids of Giza. You can examine each of the pyramids from outside at your pleasure, and with a little luck (there is a limited number of guests allowed inside each day) enter the chambers inside, for an extra fee. After this exploration of history, you will have a chance to see Egyptian life as it is today, in the Khan-el-Khalili bazaar. It is the largest bazaar in the whole of the Middle East, and still retains its characteristic ancient flavor.

The return journey to Hurghada/El Gouna is at around 17:00.

Come along on this exclusive tour, and immerse yourself in the past!

title: Cairo: Best Kept Secrets Tour
Aswan to Luxor: 3-Day Guided Tour with Transfers
Hurghada: Day Trip to Pyramids, Memphis & Sakkara by Flight
experiences:
Fly from Hurghada to Cairo on a full-day tour
Marvel at the pyramids of Giza
See the Sphinx
Enjoy lunch in Cairo
Wander through Khan el-Khalili bazaar
Visit the step pyramids of Sakkara and Memphis
fullDescription:
Enjoy the variety of Egypt and visit Cairo from Hurghada.

An air-conditioned car will bring you from your hotel to Hurghada airport where you will board your flight to Cairo. On arrival in the Egyptian capital, an Egyptologist guide will be waiting for your arrival.

The journey begins in Giza, where you will visit 3 of Egypt's largest and most famous pyramids. The Great Pyramid is the oldest, and is the last remaining Wonder of the 7 Wonders of the World. The tip of the Pyramid of Khafre is still partially covered with limestone. The Pyramid of Menkaure is surrounded by 3 other, much smaller pyramids.

Visit the step pyramids of Sakkara. The necropolis of Sakkara is the next most important burial site of Lower Egypt, after Giza. The largest and most impressive burial site is that of the Pharaoh Djoser, from the 3rd dynasty of the Old Kingdom, around 2650 B.C. He is buried in a famous step pyramid.

You will also visit Memphis, the old capital city, where you will see ruins and the giant toppled statue of the Pharaoh Ramses II, as well as the Alabaster Sphinx.

In the afternoon you can visit Khan el-Khalili bazaar to go shopping. You'll also get to visit the famous antiques market in Cairo.

After an unforgettable day, you will be brought back to the airport in Cairo in the evening. Fly back to Hurghada where you will be transferred back to your hotel having enjoying a great day in the Egyptian capital.

title: Mahmya Island Full-Day Snorkel Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Explore the underwater world of the Red Sea
Sail to the protected island of Mahmya
Look for the playful dolphins of Giftun Island National Park
Enjoy a lunch of seafood and Italian specialties
Relax on white sand beaches and swim in crystal clear sea
fullDescription:
Discover the unique island of Mahmya in the Red Sea, part of the protected Giftun Island National Park just off the coast from Hurghada. The full-day tour includes round-trip transfers by air-conditioned vehicle direct from your hotel, and a 1-hour sailing tour.

Following your transfer, start by sailing the turquoise waters on board a comfortable boat. Marvel at views of the white sand beaches and palm thatched beach huts. Soak up the Red Sea sun, watching for playful dolphins as you go. Then, upon arrival at Mahmya, you are free to snorkel the impressive coral heads of the clear lagoon. Relax on the beach and swim in crystal clear waters.

A lunch of Italian and seafood specialties will be served at the island restaurant, and drinks are available from the bar throughout the day.

Maintained under strict conservation guidelines, Mahmya is the perfect getaway from the urban sprawl of Hurghada, offering peace and privacy for all ages. Glass bottomed boats are available to rent, allowing you the chance to look at the underwater world without getting (too) wet!

Sail back to the marina for a transfer to your hotel at the end of the day.

title: Aswan 4-Day Nile Cruise to Luxor
experiences:
Enjoy a 5-star luxury Nile River cruise
See the Philae Temple and the High Dam in Aswan
Explore the Valley of the Kings in Luxor
Marvel at the Temple of Horus in Edfu
Visit the Temple of Karnak, the oldest religious structure in the world
fullDescription:
Start your adventure with a pick-up from your hotel in Aswan or Aswan airport, bus or train station. Transfer to your cruise ship to check in and freshen up. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple. 

In the morning the cruise will start sailing towards Kom Ombo, where you will visit the largest temple in Egypt. Continue to sail towards Edfu where the biggest temple of the god Horus located. Arrive in Luxor in the late afternoon and visit the East Bank of the Nile, take in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II. 

On the final day, cross to the West Bank to the Valley of the Kings. See the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. At the end of the tour, you will be transferred back to your hotel in Luxor, the airport, train, or bus station.

title: Sharm el-Sheikh Day Tiran Island or Ras Mohamed Park Snorkel
experiences:
Discover the underwater life and amazing corals of the Red Sea while snorkeling
Let your snorkel guide show you all the colorful fishes and corals
Have lunch and soft drinks served on-board
fullDescription:
Enjoy a full-day snorkel trip by boat to the best spots of Ras Mohamed or Tiran Strait. The trip is suitable for the whole family. You will discover many beautiful corals, which seem like underwater gardens. Besides that, you will meet plenty of colorful fishes, which are typical for the Red Sea. Your snorkel guide will gladly show you the best snorkeling places.

Transfer from your hotel to the jetty, where you will board a comfortable and specious boat, equipped with sun decks, perfect for relaxing or sunbathing the whole day. You will make 2 to 3 stops for snorkeling.

In the meantime, soft drinks and lunch will be served. The meeting time in the morning will be given after reconfirmation. You just need to bring your swimsuit, towel, suncream and good mood.

title: From Makadi Bay: Desert Jeep Safari
experiences:
Experience a Jeep safari through the Hurghada Desert and see countless sand dunes
Visit a Bedouin camp and learn more about the life and culture of these desert denizens
Enjoy characteristic Arabian delicacies and see a show with belly dancing, folk music and snake charming
fullDescription:
Experience the unending expanse of the Hurghada Desert, admire one of the usual Fata Morgana mirages, and see the countless sand dunes in the middle of the desert.

After the tour through the desert, arrive at a traditional Bedouin camp. After a bit of relaxation, enjoy the opportunity to explore the camp and learn more about the life and culture of these desert denizens.

Watch the sunset and enjoy a dinner buffet. Try Middle Eastern specialties and see an incredible performance with belly dancing, Arabian music and a snake show.

Admire the night sky and see the planets and stars with a digital telescope before returning to your hotel.

title: Sharm el-Sheikh: Snorkel & Camel Safari at Blue Hole
experiences:
See the incredible landscape of the Sinai Desert with its rock formations on the way to the Blue Hole
Learn more about the life of the desert denizens, visit a Bedouin cemetery and ride a camel
Discover the vibrant underwater world or relax on the beach at the Blue Hole
fullDescription:
After a pick-up from your hotel in Sharm el-Sheikh, get your first look at the incredible landscape you'll explore further on this tour of the Sinai Peninsula. Enjoy a view of the natural colors and rock formations and stop at a little oasis to get a closer look.

Then ride along the coast on the back of a camel to the Blue Hole, a renowned spot for diving and snorkeling 10 kilometers north of Dahab on the east coast of the Sinai Peninsula on the Gulf of Aqaba.

Let the stress of the everyday float away as you immerse yourself in this relaxing environment. Enjoy incredible views from atop a camel and under the water; immerse yourself in this unique world and watch the countless colorful fish and vibrant coral reefs up close or relax on the sand in the sun.

During the tour, enjoy a delicious lunch. On the journey back, enjoy an opportunity to walk around Dahab and do a bit of shopping before returning to your hotel.

title: 3-Hour Sinbad Submarine Red Sea Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
Take a trip in the Sinbad Submarine for an exciting excursion
Enjoy incredible views of the underwater world of the Red Sea
See life underwater for 50 minutes at a depth of 72 feet (22 meters)
fullDescription:
Go on a fantastic underwater trip on the Sinbad Submarine and discover the marine life in the Red Sea on a 3-hour trip from Hurghada.

After you are picked up from your hotel, you will be transferred to the pier for boarding. The Sinbad Submarine seats 44 people and 2 pilots, and has windows specially constructed to maximize your underwater viewing. Once you head below the water, you will have approximately 50 minutes to enjoy the views of the Red Sea at a depth of 72 feet (22 meters) below the surface.

When you are done exploring the underwater ecosystem, the submarine will return you to the surface. You will then be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Super Safari Quad Bike, Camel Ride & Bedouin BBQ
experiences:
Drive a Quad Bike across the desert sands surrounding Hurghada
Visit a Bedouin camp and learn more about their lifestyle and culture
Climb on the back of a camel to experience the landscape from a different perspective
fullDescription:
Depart Hurghada to experience the surrounding desert from multiple perspectives on a combined Quad Bike drive, camel ride and visit to a Bedouin camp. 

Following pick-up at your hotel, journey to the Quad Bike park by air-conditioned vehicle. Upon arrival, take a test drive on the ATV (All Terrain Vehicle) to get used to how it drives. Each bike is equipped with automatic transmission to make it easy to operate; all you need to do is accelerate and brake! Once you feel confident on your bike, set off into the desert.

Journey for approximately 1 hour to a Bedouin camp, where you will be welcomed with traditional tea. Learn more about the Bedouin lifestyle, and get the chance to ride a camel. Climb back on your bike and drive back to base before traveling back to Hurghada for your hotel drop off.

title: Marsa Alam: Airport to Hotel Private Transfer Service
experiences:
Begin your Marsa Alam holiday in style with a luxury airport transfer
Enjoy a convenient and comfortable journey to your hotel
Experience a high-quality service for up to 8 passengers
fullDescription:
Start your visit to Marsa Alam in style with a luxurious and private 15-minute transfer from the airport to your hotel. Travel from the Marsa Alam airport in a vehicle that has a capacity of to 8 people.

The tour provider’s representative will be waiting for you in the arrivals area of the airport to meet and greet you, based on your time of arrival.

You’ll be shown to your air-conditioned vehicle and you’ll soon be on the way to your destination in comfort.

title: Great Pyramid Inside - Sphinx and Solar Boat Trip
experiences:
See the great pyramids of Giza
Admire the Sphinx
Go to the Valley Temple
Explore the Solar Boat Museum
fullDescription:
Listen to stories about the history of Egypt and learn about ancient Egyptian culture, all told by your expert guide. Travel to the Great Pyramids - one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Visit and enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus.

The tour also includes many outstanding photo stops and a visit to the Valley Temple which belongs to the Pyramids of Chephren. This temple served for the purification of the mummy of the king before its burial. It was also used for the mummification process of the king.

Then you will visit the Solar Boat Museum next to the Great Pyramid of Cheops which includes the solar boats that were made out of cedar wood and they were used in religious rituals during the time of the Pharaohs. Then travel in comfort back to your hotel.

title: Wadi El Natrun: Full-Day Monasteries Tour from Alexandria
experiences:
Visit Deir al-Baramus, the oldest monastery of your tour
Explore 4 traditional monasteries
Join a professional local guide
fullDescription:
Meet your guide in the lobby of your hotel and start your day. Hope into your car and rely on your guide to devote their full attention to you throughout the day.

On your way to your first stop, listen to your guide as they explain the sights you pass and the culture of the area. Transfer by modern air-conditioned vehicle to see the last 4 working monasteries of this once enveloped place.

For your first stop, visit Deir al-Baramus, the oldest monastery that you will see. Move on to Dier Anba Bishoi, whose body is still in the monastery. Proceed to Dier Abu Maqar, the richest of the monasteries, and end your trip as you visit Deir El-Suryani, the smallest and most compact of the 4 monasteries. Upon return to Alexandria, if you have time, stop to take some scenic photos. Travel in comfort back to your hotel in Alexandria.

title: Sound and Light Show at Philae Temple
experiences:
Explore the ancient Philae Temple
Immerse yourself in the ancient and the contemporary cultures of Aswan
Enjoy a sound and light show suitable for the whole family
fullDescription:
At the Philae Sound and Light show, the Egyptian gods and goddesses are resurrected before your eyes to tell of their life stories. The myth of Isis and Osiris comes to life through dazzling lights and capturing music, with sounds from the deepest accounts of ancient history. Presenting the myth of Osiris, the goddess of death and his beloved wife Isis, who resurrected her husband using life rituals after being killed by his brother, Set, the God of Evil in ancient Egypt.

Discover  the temple and how it came to be called Philae, from the ancient Egyptian word Pilak, meaning “the remote place.” Learn about the enduring task to restore the temple from watery ruin. 

Enjoy the spectacular lights of the multimedia presentations which vividly reveals the form and majesty of this ancient site and walk through the magnificent temple as its history is narrated. A show for the family to appreciate, and old world skills and new world technologies come together for an evening. After the show transfer back to your hotel.

title: From Marsa Alam: Beach and Snorkelling With Sea Turtles
experiences:
Swim with giant sea turtles and dugongs ("sea cows") in Turtles Bay
Marvel at the well-preserved coral of the coral gardens
Get access to the beach
Enjoy a tasty lunch on board
fullDescription:
You will be picked up from your hotel in Portghalib or Marsa alam, It takes 30 minutes driving to Abo Dabab Bay.

Abo Dabab Bay is a beautiful snorkeling and dive site in the area of Marsa Alam. It has coral reefs with plenty of colorful fish, which you can see when snorkeling.

The bay has a sandy beach with sea grass and crystal clear, warm water. As well as hosting a great variety of colored fish, the Bay is also home to Green Turtles and the endangered Dugong that occasionally visit the sheltered bay to feed on the sea grass. Afterwards, return to your hotel.

title: Carnival Super Snorkeling Spot Day Trip from Hurghada
experiences:
Spend an amazing day snorkeling in Makadi Bay
Enjoy a massage on the beach
Relax on the beach with sunbeds, bean bags, and floating toys
Take part in the games and competitions to win prizes
Let your kids enjoy the animation team entertainment
fullDescription: Be collected from your accommodation and head to Makadi Bay. Discover the best corals and underwater world in the red sea. Have the opportunity to see turtles and many kinds of fish. Snorkeling equipment and life jackets are provided and a professional guide will show you the best spots.\r\n\r\nEnjoy the sunshine on the beach or swim with floating toys. Learn about belly dancing and wear belly dancing costumes. Take advantage of a 10 minutes massage and the free WiFi. Your kids can enjoy the kids' area with the animation team. There will be game competitions with prizes. Have a tasty lunch, served with a wonderful sea view.

title: Cairo: Private Airport Transfer with London Cab
experiences:
Be driven by a professional chauffeur
Choose between airport or hotel pick-up
Benefit from a private transfer
Be transported in an air-conditioned vehicle
fullDescription:
Avoid the torment and stress of waiting for taxis by opting for this affordable airport transfer. Your skilled driver will be waiting for you at the airport with a name sign in the arrivals hall. From here they will help with your luggage before guiding you to your premium airport transfer.

For hotel pick-up, your driver will meet you at your hotel lobby. Please be ready and waiting 10 minutes before your designated meeting time. It is recommended to give your flight number in advance, so your driver can arrive at the appropriate time. If there happens to be a delay in your flight, your driver will be waiting until you arrive safely at no extra fee.

All drivers have excellent experience and a wealth of knowledge of the city. If you have any questions at any stage of your transfer, simply ask. Whether you’d prefer music, talking or simply snoozing after a long journey, your driver will get you safely to the right destination.

title: Wadi El Natrun Tour from Alexandria
experiences:
Visit the monasteries of Wadi El Natrun
See the oldest surviving monastery, Deir al-Baramus
Check out Deir El-Suryani, housing the body of Saint Pishoy
fullDescription:
You will drive in a modern, air-conditioned vehicle to Wadi El-Natrun, which is regarded as the "birthplace for monasticism". There were around 50 monasteries originally, but only 4 have survived until today.

Your tour will start with a visit to Deir al-Baramus, the oldest of the surviving 4 monasteries, and the most isolated one, before proceeding to Deir Anba Bishoi, home to the body of Saint Pishoy.

You will end your trip with a visit to Deir El-Suryani - a Coptic, orthodox monastery which is the smallest yet best-preserved monastery.

title: Aswan Philae Temple, Obelisk and High Dam Tour
experiences:
Take a tour of Aswan and visit the High Dam
Cruise the Nile and visit the Philae Temple
Marvel at the work of the ancient Egyptians at the unfinished obelisk
fullDescription:
Your guide will pick you up from your hotel to start your tour in Aswan. Your first stop is the High Dam, an engineering miracle built in 1960 to save Egypt from the flooding of the Nile. The Dam provides a huge water reservoir known as Lake Nasser, one of the biggest artificial lakes in the world.

Afterwards, you will get to visit the unfinished obelisk (the largest known ancient obelisk), and see how the ancient Egyptians used to cut them. 

Finally, you will get to sail along the Nile to visit the majestic Philae temple which was built in honor of the goddess Isis, the chief deity of the island. The temple is associated with various love story sagas.

title: Discover Mosque, Church and Harbor with Local Guide
experiences:
Explore the Red Sea's most famous resort town
Enjoy an orientation tour of Hurghada's Big Mosque and Coptic Church
Discover the boutique gift stores of Hurghada
Visit the New Marina to promenade on the sea front
Choose from 2 optional activities to explore the marine life of the Red Sea
fullDescription:
Enjoy a half-day tour of Hurghada and explore the biggest port resort of the Red Sea. While it lacks a long history or many spectacular buildings, as a tourist center it offers numerous activities and is definitely worth a look.

Get your first impressions by cruising the streets on board a high quality air-conditioned vehicle. Stop at the Coptic Church and Big Mosque. Then, it’s time to enjoy some of the resort’s legendary shops, will plenty of opportunities to purchase unique souvenirs, aromatic spices, or new items of clothing. Your guide will be on hand to help.

For the remaining 2.5 hours you have the choice to either continue shopping, find a nice café or restaurant for something to eat or drink, or take part in one of the optional activities (surcharge applies). Explore Egypt`s underwater flora and fauna without getting wet on board the Red Sea’s only tourist submarine. Descend to a depth of 25 meters (84 feet) to see a variety of colorful fish. Alternatively, visit the Red Sea Aquarium, where an abundance of fish and other marine animals includes dolphins and turtles.

Finally, spend some time in the beautiful New Marina, Hurghada’s luxury yacht harbor. Pop into the upscale shops, enjoy a refreshing drink in a café, or just promenade along the sea front.

title: 4-Day Nile Cruise from Aswan to Luxor
experiences:
Relax on a 3-night Nile River cruise on board a floating hotel, with sundeck, swimming pool and full-service meals
Enjoy the on board evening entertainment, such as a belly dance show, Captain's welcome cocktail party, Nubian folk show, and more
Take a tour of the Valley of the Kings and learn about the burials of Pharaohs
Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple
Cross to the West Bank to visit the Necropolis of Thebes and Temple of Hatshepsut
Admire the massive stone statues of the Colossi of Memnon
Explore the East Bank of Luxor, said to be the 2nd most visited site in Egypt after the Pyramids of Giza
fullDescription:
This 4-day luxury cruise from Aswan to Luxor on the Nile River is the perfect way to see many of the most important archaeological sites of Egypt. Visit the Valley of the Kings at Luxor, take in the splendors of the Kom Ombo Temple and see the Necropolis of Thebes.

Your luxury boat will serve lunch and dinner throughout the cruise and you can dance the night away to an on board disco. Relax by the sundeck and swimming pool, or seek out the services of an Egyptologist guide to learn more about Ancient Egypt.

Day 1: Departure from Aswan (Monday, Wednesday, or Friday)
On arrival in Aswan, meet your local tour representative for the start of your tour. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple. Then, board your cruise in Aswan. Enjoy lunch on board, as well as afternoon tea, dinner and an evening disco party.

Day 2: Kom Ombo – Edfu - Luxor
Enjoy breakfast on board your cruise boat. Then, set sail to visit the Kom Ombo Temple, dedicated to the crocodile-god Sobek, and the falcon-god Haroeris. Located on a bend in the Nile, it is said that in ancient times, sacred crocodiles would bask in the sun on the banks of the area.

Sail to Edfu, site of the Ptolemaic Temple of Horus. After lunch, visit the temple and ancient settlement, known in Roman times as Apollinòpolis. Cross the lock and sail to Luxor, enjoying an on board dinner and overnight stay.

Day 3: Luxor
After breakfast on board, cross the Nile to the West Bank to tour the Necropolis of Thebes, Valley of The Kings, Temple of Hatshepsut, and the Colossi of Memnon.

Luxor has often been called the world's greatest open-air museum and the number of preserved monuments are unparalleled anywhere else in the world. Focusing on the West Bank, you will stroll around the ruins at the Valley of the Kings and Valley of the Queens, used primarily for the burials of Pharaohs. Admire the massive stone statues of the Colossi of Memnon and the mortuary temples of the Temple of Hatshepsut.

Return to your boat for afternoon tea and relax on board, soaking up the sun by the swimming pool. Enjoy dinner and a last overnight stay on board.

Day 4: Luxor - Departure
After breakfast, visit the East Bank of Luxor to see Luxor Temple, built by Amenhotep III from Nubian sandstone. You will also visit the other great monument of the East Bank, Karnak Temple, said to be the 2nd most visited site in Egypt after the Pyramids of Giza.

Transfer to Luxor Train Station, Luxor Airport, or a Luxor hotel for the end of the tour and your final departure.

title: Cheops Pyramids with Transfer and Options
experiences:
Travel in comfort with transfer from your Hotel
Marvel at the Three Pyramids of Giza
Discover the majestic Sphinx
fullDescription: Visit one of the Seven Wonders of the Old World, the oldest one actually, and the only one that still remains. The Three Pyramids of Giza: Khufu, Khafre and Menkaure have preserved the past for about 5000 years and the time is coming to explore the long-vanished world.\r\n\r\nLook at the 2.3 million stones of the Great Pyramid which was once a burial site for the Egyptian Pharaoh in the bygone era. Now the decorated tomb, the red granite sarcophagus and the elaborate wall paintings do not illustrate how Egyptians died but how they lived. A few miles away from the necropolis area, you can find the 5000 year-old limestone structure of the silent, mysterious Sphinx with a lion’s body and a Pharaoh’s head belonging to the King Khefre.

title: Egyptian Museum of Antiquities Entrance Ticket
experiences:
Explore tbe two huge levels of the Egyptian Museum
Marvel at Tutankhamun's exclusive section in the museum
See statues, fossils, paintings, and more!
fullDescription: Once you arrive at the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities, which is located in Tahrir square, you'll find a representative who will give you your tickets. Or, if you've selected a transportation option, be picked up from your hotel in downtown Cairo or Giza and taken to the museum in a comfortable air-conditioned bus. Then you'll be ready to explore the fascinating exhibitions that will teach you all about Egypt's past, and in fact show you rare and unique items from each era of the country's history.\r\n\r\nConstructed in 1902, this is the largest museum in the region and houses 250,000 rare artifacts of all sizes. The ground floor contains the large heavy statues arranged in chronological order. Then take a tour of the upper floor to see the smaller statues, fossils, paintings, sarcophagi and ancient Egyptian maps. Be sure to visit the exclusive section dedicated to Tutankhamun to see all his treasures, which were discovered in his tomb in Luxor, including his golden mask. Be sure to set aside the whole day to cover the vast expanses of time and space that this museum covers!

title: Budget Egypt Nile Cruise from Aswan to Luxor
experiences:
Visit the temple shared by the two gods Sobek and Haroeris.
See The Temple of Horus in Edfu and cross the lock
Discover the Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon.
Explore The East Bank: Karnak and LuxorTemples
fullDescription:
At 6:00 you will be picked up from your hotel in Aswan or from Aswan Airport, met and assisted by a local representatives before being transferred to the cruise. Boarding will be before lunch, then begin your day tour in Aswan Visiting the High Dam and the Philae temple around 13:00 pm the cruise Sail to Kom Ombo. Have lunch on board followed by afternoon tea, then visit the temple shared by the two gods Sobek and Haroeris.

Dinner is on on board, followed by a disco party. Overnight you'll go past in Edfu. On day two, visit the Temple of Horus in Edfu, cross the lock and sail to Luxor. Afternoon Tea, Dinner on board & Galabya party. On day three, cross to the West Bank to visit Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. You'll enjoy an excursion to the Valley of Kings, a visit to the tombs of various dynasties and the Temple of Deir El Bahari. On the return journey, stop at the Colossi of Memnon where you'll find two gigantic sitting statues, representing Amenophis III, facing the Nile. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and return for lunch on board and an afternoon spent at your leisure. Disembark on day four and begin your tour of the east bank, with Karnak and Luxor Temples. The excursion to the Luxor Temple will bring you to its courtyard and the granite statues of Ramses the Great. Proceed by carriage or bus to Karnak, which is a series of temples built in different reigns.

Finally, start by the Avenue of Sphinxes and visit the Unfinished Propylon, the Hypostyle Hall with its 134 gigantic columns, the Obelisks of Queen Hatshepsut and Tutomosis III, the temple of Amon adorned with lotus and papyrus designs, the Granite Scarbeus of Amenophis III and the Sacred Lake. You'll be transferred to the airport at the end of your tour.
