title: Sharm El Sheikh Bedouin Village and Dinner Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a barbecue dinner with the Bedouin villagers
Experience a camel ride across the desert
Watch an oriental show and listen to traditional music
fullDescription:
Your tour guide will pick you up from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh and take you to the Bedouin village for a traditional dinner and to witness their daily life activities and traditions.

Then, you will have a chance to ride a camel - a classic Egyptian experience. You will also be able to witness the amazing panoramic views of the desert and sunset.

Finally, you will have a barbecue dinner and enjoy an oriental show including folkloric songs before being driven back to your hotel.

title: From Alexandria: El Alamein Day Tour
experiences:
Learn about this important part of World War 2 from an expert on the subject
Visit the picturesque town of El Alamein right on the Mediterranean sea
Look at the memorabilia and weaponry used in battle, see a piece of history
fullDescription:
Travel in comfort with an expert guide to see the town of El Alamein. Learn about Rommel, the Desert Fox, and other figures of World War 2 who fought in Egypt and their significance in the war. Ask any questions you have as you talk with an expert on the subject.

On site visit an enlightening local war museum, which tells the story of El Alamein through war memorabilia. The gardens outside of the museum are scattered with huge army tanks and large scale weaponry that were used during the battles of El Alamein. Inside there are five halls, each dedicated to a country involved in the war, with uniforms, weapons, models and records on display. 

Continue your way to the beautiful town of El Alamein overlooking the Mediterranean sea. Pay your respects and visit the World War Cemeteries, the final resting place for so many Greek, Italian and German soldiers.

title: Cairo: Half-Day Mummies & Pyramids Tour
experiences:
Visit the Egyptian Museum
Uncover the Tut Anch Amun Treasures
Wander around the curious Mummies room
See the Great Pyramids
fullDescription: Meet your tour guide at your hotel lobby, and benefit from his or her full attention from the word go. Head out from your hotel in Cairo to visit the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Visit The Great Sphinx, and make use of many outstanding photo stops.\r\n\r\nEnjoy a visit to the Valley Temple, which belongs to the Pyramids of Chephren, and served for the purification of the mummy of the king before its burial. After that, move on to visit The Egyptian Museum, with more than 250,000 pieces on display, including a rare collection of Egyptian art from over 5,000 years. Explore the Tutankhamen room and its treasure, jewelry and gold, enclosed in his tomb for over 3500 years before it was discovered in 1920 during excavation. Finally, travel in comfort back to your hotel.

title: From Luxor to Aswan 5 Day 5 Star Nile Cruise Guided Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a 5-star luxury Nile River cruise
Explore the Valley of the Kings in Luxor
See the Philae Temple and the High Dam in Aswan
Marvel at the Temple of Karnak, the oldest religious structure in the world
Visit the spectacular Temple of Queen Hatshepsut
fullDescription:
Day one: Luxor East Bank with Lunch and Dinner
Begin your adventure with a pickup from your accommodation in Luxor or at Luxor airport, bus, or train station. Be transferred to your cruise to check in and freshen up. Later, your friendly guide will accompany you for a visit to the East Bank of the Nile, taking in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II. 

Day two: Luxor West Bank with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Enjoy breakfast on board. Cross to the West Bank to visit the Valley of the Kings. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. Enjoy an afternoon tea when start sailing towards Kom Ombo temple. 

Day three: Kom Ombo to Edfu with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
After breakfast, visit the Temple of Kom Ombo. Sail to Edfu. After lunch, visit the Temple of Horus. Cross Esna Lock and sail to Aswan.

Day four: Aswan with Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner
Arrive in Aswan and visit the High Dam and Philae Temple. Return to the cruise ship then enjoy your free time. Lunch and afternoon tea will be served on board. 

Day five: Aswan with Breakfast
After breakfast, check out and be transferred to your accommodation in Aswan or Aswan airport, bus, or train station.

title: Sharm: Overnight Moses Mountain Climb & Sunrise Breakfast
experiences:
Visit Saint Catherine's Monastery, one of the oldest in the world, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ascend the same mountain as Moses, in an overnight climb
Watch the sun rise from the summit of Mount Sinai
Eat breakfast at St. Catherine's Monastery after your epic climb
fullDescription:
You will be picked up from your hotel in Sharm el Sheikh at 7:00 PM and then drive for about 2 hours from Sharm to Moses Mountain in a coach.

On arrival you will start the ascent to the top of Mount Sinai. Reaching 2,285 meters, the climb includes about 750 steps, and will take you through the night to finish. On reaching the summit, gaze in awe as the sun rises, flooding the mountain with light.

After seeing the sunrise, you'll descend to St. Catherine's Monastery for breakfast. Saint Catherine's Monastery is on the Sinai Peninsula, at the mouth of a gorge at the foot of Mount Sinai in the city of Saint Catherine in Egypt. The monastery is Orthodox and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

This monastery is one of the oldest working Christian monasteries in the world together with the Monastery of Saint Anthony, situated across the Red Sea in the desert south of Cairo, which also lays claim to that title.

After visiting this incredible ancient site, you will leave for Sharm El Sheikh, and arrive in Sharm at about 1:00 PM, enjoying a transfer you back to your hotel.

title: Aswan 4-Day Nile Cruise with Cairo & Luxor Night Train
experiences:
Experience first-class VIP train travel between Cairo and Aswan
See the Philae Temple and the High Dam in Aswan
Visit the Valley of the Kings in Luxor
Enjoy a 5-star luxury Nile River cruise
fullDescription:
Take a 4-day luxury Nile cruise and admire the beauty of the Nile River Valley. See the important sites in Luxor, including the Karnak Temple, Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. In Aswan, you’ll visit the Philae temple and the High Dam. Travel by VIP first-class train between Cairo and Aswan.

Detailed Itinerary
Day 1
Transfer to the Cairo train station to catch the overnight train to Aswan.

Day 2: Aswan – Kom Ombo (Meals: Lunch, Dinner)
Arrival in Aswan, where you’ll meet your tour representative at the train station. Visit the High Dam and Philae Temple before transferring to the cruise ship. Lunch and afternoon tea will be served on board. Sail to Kom Ombo. Dinner and overnight on board.

Day 3: Kom Ombo – Edfu – Luxor (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
After breakfast, visit the Temple of Kom Ombo. Sail to Edfu. After lunch, visit the Temple of Horus. Cross Esna Lock and sail to Luxor. Overnight on board.

Day 4: Luxor West Bank (Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)
Breakfast on board. Cross to the West Bank to visit the Valley of the Kings. Visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari. See the Colossi of Memnon and visit an alabaster institute. Afternoon tea and dinner and overnight on board.

Day 5: Luxor East Bank (Meals: Breakfast)
Breakfast on board before disembarkation from the cruise ship. Visit the East Bank of the Nile, taking in the Temple of Karnak, the Temple of Luxor, and the Obelisk of Ramses II. Transfer to the train station to catch the overnight train back to Cairo.

Day 6
Arrival in Cairo and transfer to your hotel.

title: Aswan: Full-Day Private Tour to Abu Simbel Temples
experiences:
Explore the best temples ever for King Ramses and his wife Nefertari
Marvel the most amazing scenes inside the temples
Enjoy personalized attention from an Egyptologist guide
See the stunning rock-hewn temples of Abu Simbel on the banks of Lake Nasser
Benefit from some free time to explore at your leisure
fullDescription:
Depart Aswan to journey 280 kilometers to the stunning rock-carved temples of Abu Simbel. Relocated to the west banks of Lake Nasser, the temple complex is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the "Nubian Monuments."

On arrival, take a short walk to the temple entrance, where your Egyptologist guide will explain the history of the site. Hear details of the UNESCO-led relocation of the entire cliff face to higher ground, and how the temples were only discovered by accident in 1813.

Due to the large number of visitors, guides are not permitted inside the Great Temple of Ramses II or the smaller Temple of Hathor. However, by using photos and illustrations your guide will explain the structures and their interior artworks before giving you some free time to enter the temples and explore at leisure.

As one of the few Ancient Egyptian sites that largely escaped damage from past invaders, the interiors of the Abu Simbel temples are astounding. The scale of the buildings and their detailed decorations leave most visitors in awe. The experience is further enhanced by the scenic location on the edge of Lake Nasser in the orange sands of the desert.

After visiting the temples, benefit from some time for a short visit to the small visitor's center to see documents relating to the UNESCO relocation project (time permitting) before the drive back to Aswan.

title: Cairo: Private Two-Day Tour
experiences:
Enjoy a special private tour to visit the Pyramids of Giza
Walk through the streets of historic Islamic and Coptic Cairo
Discover the treasures of the Egyptian museum on a guided tour
fullDescription:
Spend two days exploring Cairo and Giza on a private tour with an Egyptologist as your guide. Visit old Islamic and Coptic Cairo, explore the Egyptian Museum, and see the Giza Pyramids and Sphinx.

Day 1
Explore old Islamic and Coptic Cairo with a guide. Visit the Hanging church, the Coptic Museum, and Ben Ezra Synagogue. See the Citadel of Saladin before stopping for lunch. Enjoy a walk along Khan El Khalili Street and experience a traditional Egyptian market.

Day 2
Start your day with a visit to the Egyptian Museum with your guide. Home to 165,000 Egyptian artifacts, the priceless treasures of King Tutankhamen are the highlight of the museum. Choose to visit the Mummies Hall for an additional fee. Sail along the Nile on a small boat and take in the sights or enjoy lunch at a restaurant by the Nile River.

Visit the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx. The sphinx is an enigmatic symbol of Egypt. Enter one of the Pyramids (for an additional fee) if you wish. You’ll have the opportunity to do some shopping and visit a perfume factory and a traditional papyrus institute as well.

title: The Grand Egyptian Museum and Giza Pyramids with Transfer
experiences:
Visit the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx
Enjoy a tour at the two-floor Egyptian Museum
Learn about ancient Egypt's boy-king Tutankhamun and visit his collection inside the museum
fullDescription: Enjoy a pick-up service, avoid the crowded roads and travel to the Pyramids of Giza. If you are staying in Cairo, it is only a short drive before the Pyramids of Giza are in view. Your bus will park as close as possible. Watch the oldest wonder of the Old World and  the only that still remains. The three pyramids of Giza; Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinos have not been affected by time or natural catastrophes.\r\n\r\nYour next stop is the Egyptian Museum, home to more than 120,000 rare artifacts from the Three Kingdoms. Here, you have two full floors with 107 halls to visit. While the ground floor holds large statutes, the second contains  small statues, jewelry, papyrus, the mummies and the world’s most extensive collection of the boy King, Tutankhamun. Take your time discovering his shining items and discover all that the museum has to offer.

title: Transfer to Giza Pyramids, Memphis and Sakkara
experiences:
Visit the Three Pyramids and the Sphinx
Explore Sakkara, home to the famous Step Pyramid of Djoser
Discover Memphis and have a look at the monuments there
fullDescription: If you are lucky enough to be staying in Cairo then you are only a short while from the Three Pyramids of Giza. On arrival, your bus will park as close as possible. Discover the oldest wonder of the Old World and marvel at the Pyramids of Giza. All 3 of which have not been affected by time or natural catastrophes.\r\n\r\nTake photos of the incredible pyramid with an estimated total of 2,300,000 stone blocks. Beside it you will meet the eyes of a sculpture formed of lion’s body and Pharaoh’s head which belonged to King Chephren. It is the mysterious Sphinx. Then, you will be transferred to Sakkara, home of the Step Pyramid of Szoser. After that, you head towards Memphis, the ancient capital city of old Egypt, before enjoying a final visit to Dahshur. After your tour you will be dropped back to your hotel.

title: Cairo: Pyramid of Djoser & Dahshur Tour
experiences:
See the Step Pyramid of Djoser, considered to be Egypt's oldest pyramid
Visit Memphis, the first capital city of Egypt
Travel in comfort in a modern, air-conditioned vehicle
fullDescription:
Begin by visiting Sakkara and the Step Pyramid of Djoser, which dates back to 2600 BC under the 3rd Dynasty. It is considered the oldest stone structure and it was built for king Djoser.

Proceed to visit Memphis, which was the first capital city of Old Egypt, and see the Statue of Ramses II at Memphis. On your way to the south you will visit the Red Pyramid and the Bent Pyramid of Dahshur

Travel in comfort back to your hotel. Cairo has so much to see, feel, eat and buy, so if you have time and want to add more to your itinerary, let the local operator know if there is anything you would like to add to your itinerary.

title: Hurghada: Private Fishing Boat Full-Day Trip with Lunch
experiences:
Enjoy a day on a private boat on the Red Sea
Go snorkeling and swimming in the warm waters
Spend a worry-free day fishing
Enjoy an board seafood lunch buffet
fullDescription:
Go fishing in the Red Sea with a private full-day trip from Hurghada. Enjoy an all-inclusive tour that provides you with the equipment you need, along with food and drinks to stay refreshed.

In the morning, you'll be picked up from your hotel and transferred to the jetty. After boarding, set out on the water. Take in the nature and the beauty of the small islands you pass by. Eventually you will drop anchor and have time to go fishing. You will also be able to swim, snorkel, or scuba dive.

At lunchtime, dine on an open buffet lunch of fresh seafood. Then enjoy the rest of your afternoon in the sun before you are returning to your hotel in the early evening.

title: Cairo at Night: 4-Hour City Tour & Nile Felucca Cruise
experiences:
Explore the sights in Cairo at night
Enjoy sailing on the River Nile aboard a traditional felucca wooden sailing boat
Admire the beautiful sunset and experience Cairo’s nightlife
fullDescription:
Explore Cairo at night while sailing in a traditional felucca wooden sailing boat, and have a guided city tour in an air-conditioned car in Cairo. Join us and don't miss this exciting tour!

Relish the feeling of discovering the sights in Cairo at night by a traditional felucca sailing boat on the River Nile. Discover the charming night life of Cairo. Cairo is very alive at night and offers you many possibilities to have a great evening. Depending on whether you prefer to explore the nightlife or enjoy sailing, you can also admire the beautiful sunset.

If you have a special occasion, such as a birthday, you can have your party arranged while sailing across the Nile. Feel the charm of the Egyptian Nile and the atmosphere of Cairo.

title: Aswan Sound Light Show: Philae Temple
experiences:
Spectacular Philae Temple sound and light show
Comfortable door-to-door transport from Aswan
See the temple in a different light with fascinating historical commentary
fullDescription: Your guide will pick you up from your hotel to spend the evening enjoying the Sound and Light Show at Philae Temple. Watch in awe as a rainbow of lights and laser projections illuminates the temple, bringing it to stunning life. Walk through the atmospherically lit courts, halls and colonnades, as the English commentary summons up the ghosts of pharaohs past and recounts the temple’s history through the ages.\r\n\r\nDiscover the symbolic meanings behind the wall reliefs and admire the lights of the floodlit edifice reflected in the lapping Nile waters. After the show, return to your private vehicle and travel directly back to your hotel or cruise ship, where your tour ends.

title: Mini Egypt Park Tickets with Transfer from Hurghada
experiences:
Take a walk through Egypt in miniature
See scale models of iconic monuments such as the Pyramids of Giza
Enjoy a day out suitable for all ages
fullDescription: See historic monuments and the most popular tourist attractions of Egypt in miniature at the Mini Egypt Park open-air museum. Journey through the history of Egypt as you encounter scale models of iconic structures such as the pyramids and Great Sphinx of Giza and Basilica Church of Heliopolis.\r\n\r\nGet the chance to walk from Cairo to Luxor in just a few steps as you stroll amongst the collection of 60 works of art. Learn the story of how Mini Egypt Park came to life as you encounter models of the Abu Simbel Temple, Aswan High Dam, Temple of Edfu and more.

title: Marsa Alam: Ancient Cairo & Giza Pyramids Day Trip by Plane
experiences:
Visit the Pyramids of Giza and the Great Sphinx
Admire thousands of antiques in the Egyptian Museum
Learn more about the impressive Egyptian art
Wander through the endless lanes of Khan el Khalili Bazar
fullDescription:
Explore fantastic Cairo on this day trip from Marsa Alam to the Pyramids. You will be picked up from your hotel in Marsa Alam and taken to Hurghada Airport. From there you will fly to Cairo, where you will be picked up and accompanied by your guide.

Your Egyptologist tour guide will take you on a visit to the Great Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Then go to take memorable photos and to see the Sphinx with its lion body and the head of a pharaoh - the statue dates back to the reign of King Chephren.

You will have lunch at a local restaurant in Cairo. After that you will have the opportunity to visit the Egyptian Museum with all its treasures from the times of the Pharaohs. It displays more than 250,000 real artifacts, including Tut Ankh Amun's treasure collection. Continue to Cairo, where you will have the opportunity to visit Khan El Khalili, Cairo's oldest bazaar.

In the evening you will be transferred back to the airport and fly to Hurghada. There will be a vehicle waiting for you upon arrival, which will take you back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

title: Hurghada: Red Sea Royal Cruise Tour with Snorkeling
experiences:
Discover the beauty of the Red Sea onboard a luxury cruise boat
Explore the secrets of the sea and swim with sea turtles, rays, and angel fish
Relax with an onboard massage and enjoy a lavish Egyptian style buffet
fullDescription:
Travel around the Red Sea in style on this luxury, adult-only cruise around the Hurghada. Explore the underwater world as you snorkel alongside some of the most impressive coral reefs with the guidance of expert crew and discover the secrets of the sea as you swim around the home of stripy angel fish, sea turtles and rays.

Take a small break from snorkeling to enjoy a lavish buffet with a selection of seafood, BBQ, and a wide choice of salads, all cooked to the traditional Egyptian recipes.

Relax onboard and catch a tan on deck, make sure you choose the perfect sunbathing spot to keep a watchful eye out for dolphins, then treat yourself to an onboard back massage and release any stress you might be carrying around.

title: Marsa Alam: Wadi El Gemal National Park
experiences:
Explore the Wadi El Gemal National Park with the Bedouins
See wild dromedary herds and with a little luck also the offspring
Drive through the wadi with your knowledgeable Bedouin
fullDescription:
Meet your guide at your accommodation in Marsa Alam and head to Wadi El Gemal, which is 45 kilometers from South Marsa Alam. Wadi El Gemal includes many different ecological habitats and a variety of animal and bird species, including several endangered species.

Along the way, visit the landscape and ruins and then drive through the Wadi. The shores of Wadi El Gemal are heterogeneous in nature and include rocky, sandy, and muddy beaches. After that, visit Cleopatra Temple then discover the acacia and arak trees.

The park's coastline is about 120 kilometers and has several important landmarks including the headlands of Ras Baghdadi and Ras Honkorab, el Qulaan. You can enjoy the sunset, see an amazing snake show, and have dinner with the Bedouins of the region. Then sing and dance with the Bedouins. At the end of your Wadi El Gemal tour, you will be transferred back to your accommodation.

title: Hurghada Airport to Soma Bay Private Transfers
experiences:
Enjoy a stress-free transfer service from Hurghada International Airport to Soma Bay
Travel in a comfortable limousine or a spacious van
Reach your destination quickly and safely
fullDescription: Treat yourself to a private transfer from Hurghada International Airport to Soma Bay. Spare yourself the hassle of searching for a taxi and negotiating prices with the driver, and reach your destination comfortably and on time. You can book a private limousine or van to quickly reach Soma Bay.\r\n\r\nYour driver will meet you at the airport and will be holding a sign with your name written on it. Get in the air-conditioned vehicle and start your vacation comfortably and stress-free as your driver takes you to your hotel. You can determine the speed of the drive. Along the way you will gain a first impression of the wonderful vacation destination of Egypt.

title: Hurghada: Day Tour Super Giftun Island Snorkeling with Lunch
experiences:
Explore the underwater marine life of the Red Sea
Stop off at 3 different snorkeling locations around the Giftun Islands
Marvel at corals, exquisitely colored fish, and dolphins
Enjoy lunch and soft drinks onboard your boat
Soak-up the sun on the lounge deck
Enjoy a safe tour led by a professional English-speaking guide
fullDescription:
Explore Giftun Island and spend the day snorkeling in the Red Sea.

After an initial safety briefing, set off toward the Giftun Islands, ready to explore the underwater world of corals and colorful fish, not to mention dolphins. The snorkeling tour is led by a professional guide for your utmost safety and enjoyment in the water.

Stop off at 3 different locations to snorkel, before enjoying lunch onboard your boat. Relax and soak up the sun on the plush sundeck, while taking in the spectacular surroundings of the Giftun Islands.

As your snorkeling adventure draws to a close, enjoy a quick transfer back to your hotel.

title: From Cairo: Pyramids, Memphis, and Sakkara Visit
experiences:
Marvel at the famous Great Pyramids of Egypt at the Giza Plateau with your Egyptologist guide
Explore the Valley Temple and the Ancient Sphinx, and wonder at the ancient rites of mummification
See the ancient Step Pyramid of Djoser in the Sakkara archeological site as you learn about the evolution of pyramid design
Visit Egypt's former capital of Memphis, once the cultural center of the ancient world
fullDescription:
Start your day trip to the Great Pyramids, Memphis, and Sakkara, with an 08:00 pick-up at your hotel. Your guide will take you to the Giza Plateau where you will see the famous Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus.

Next, see the Great Sphinx statue and visit the Valley Temple, which is a part of the same ancient complex. Marvel at the ancient structure as you learn about the burial rites of the Pharaoh kings.

The next stop on your day tour is the Step Pyramid of King Djoser, at the fascinating Sakkara archeological site. Built in the 3rd Dynasty (around 2630 B.C.E.), this special pyramid is the world's oldest major stone structure.

From the Step Pyramids transfer to Memphis, the former capital city of ancient Egypt during the Old Kingdom. Having once reigned as a cultural center for over 3,000 years, Memphis offers stunning ancient sites and intrigue.

title: Cairo: Full-Day Islamic and Coptic Cairo Excursion
experiences:
Visit the Citadel of Salah al-Din and the Alabaster Mosque
Explore the shops in the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar
See the Hanging Church, one of the oldest churches in Egypt
fullDescription:
Be met outside your cruise ship by a tour representative and board an air-conditioned, private vehicle for the trip to Cairo, to enjoy a sightseeing tour of the Islamic and Coptic sites of the old city.

On this full-day excursion, your guide will take you to the Salah al-Din Citadel. Admire the Alabaster Mosque and also the Al-Gawhara Palace, which was built by Mohammed Ali Pasha in 1814. Visit El Moez Street to see the most beautiful examples of Islamic architecture.

Then proceed to Coptic Cairo to visit the the Hanging church, also known as the Al Mo'allaka Church, to see Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church, which sheltered the holy family, and visit Ben Ezra Synagogue.

You can take a break for lunch any time you like during the tour.

title: Alexandria: Archeological Day Tour
experiences:
Visit the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa
See the Roman Amphitheater & The Library of Alexandria Manuscripts museum
Stop for a photo at Pompay's Pillar
Visit the oldest church in Africa
See the site of the Lighthouse, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
Walk across Stanley Bridge
fullDescription:
First, you will be picked up from your hotel before visiting the Catacombs of Kom El Shokafa which are the largest Roman Cemetery. Then, visit the Roman Amphitheater of Alexandria with the display of the sunken monuments. Drive by Pompay’s Pillar and stop for a photo.

Your next stop is the library of Alexandria; the biggest library in the world. Visit its open court, manuscripts museum, president Saddat Museum, and the impressions of Alexandria Museum.

Afterwards, visit the church of St. Mark – the oldest church in Africa as well as the Abbo Elabbas Mosque. Continue to see the outside of Quaitbay castle which was built on the same site as the ancient Lighthouse.

Then, visit the gardens of Montaza and the royal gardens of King Farouk. See the royal palaces of Haramlek and Salamlek, and finally, walk along the famous Montaza bridge.

title: Sharm El-Sheikh Full-Day Scuba Diving Tour
experiences:
Scuba dive at some of the best dive sites in the Red Sea
Discover old shipwrecks that provide shelter to hundreds of fish, including big fish like tune
Tailor the dive experience to suit your skill level
See the Lara wreck, and the wreck of SS Thistlegorm, where World War II equipment is still stored
Admire the soft and hard coral of Jackson Reef
Dive among sharks, large pelagic and the occasional hammerhead
Enjoy the shallow swim throughs and sandy patches
fullDescription:
Explore the underwater world of the Red Sea on a full-day diving tour from Sharm El-Sheikh. Following a meet up with your guide, who will provide all necessary equipment, you will enjoy a local dive to get orientated, before heading to the Lara wreck, Jackson Reef, and the Sinai Peninsula.

You can receive instruction tailored for beginners, and for those with more experience. Depending on your skill level, swim through schools of fish to a spot where sharks often gather. Proceed toward the wreck Yolanda to reach a plateau 15-25 meters (50-80 feet) deep, scattered with small ergs and coral outcrops where stone fish and scorpion fish feed. The wreck of the Yolanda, complete with its cargo of toilets and baths, provides home to big fish, such as tuna, bluefish, and the occasional hammerhead.

Another popular dive site is Jackson Reef on the northernmost of the 4 reefs that separate the Sinai and Saudi Arabia. Strong currents make it ideal for large pelagic, sharks and other big fish. Admire soft and hard coral, and look for barracudas, jacks, hammerheads, and tiger sharks.

The remains of the Cypriot merchant ship Lara, which collided with the reef in 1981, lies at depths of 45 meters (147 feet) and more, while the wreck of the SS Thistlegorm holds World War II machinery and equipment, still neatly stowed in its open holds, making for a fantastic dive experience.

This most famous Sinai Peninsula dive has to be experienced to truly appreciate its wonders. The group of coral heads at Temple come up from a depth of 12-20 meters (40-65 feet). If viewed in the right position, and using your imagination, they look like columns of a temple.

For a less challenging dive, there are sandy patches at about 8 meters (25 feet) with lots of inlets into the shore reefs, and coral heads about 2 meters (6.5 feet) apart, allowing you to swim between them.

title: Glass Bottom Boat
experiences:
See the underwater world without getting wet
Ideal choice for families
Choice of several departures throughout the day
Availability of snorkeling from the boat
fullDescription:
Not everyone is a water sports person, so this trip, created for families with children and perhaps the not so active elderly family members, is great for families to enjoy some time together at sea in a comfortable and educational setting.

You will be picked up from your hotel at 11.00 or 15.00, and will drive for around 10 minutes to the glass bottom boat dock.  You will take a 1.5 hour trip in the glass bottomed boat to see Napoleon Reef, The Islands and Lagoon Reef.

If you decide you want to up the ante and dive into an adventure, there is the chance to snorkel if you wish. After the trip, you will be driven back to your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Private Airport Transfer with London Cab
experiences:
Be driven by a professional chauffeur
Choose between airport or hotel pick-up
Benefit from a private transfer
Be transported by an air-conditioned vehicle
fullDescription:
Avoid the torment and stress of waiting for taxis by opting for this affordable airport transfer. Your skilled driver will be waiting for you at the airport with a name sign in the arrivals hall. From here they will help with your luggage before guiding you to your premium airport transfer.

For hotel pick-up, your driver will meet you at your hotel lobby. Please be ready and waiting 10 minutes before your designated meeting time. It is recommended to give your flight number in advance, so your driver can arrive at the appropriate time. If there happens to be a delay in your flight, your driver will be waiting until you arrive safely at no extra fee.

All drivers have excellent experience and a wealth of knowledge of the city. If you have any questions at any stage of your transfer, simply ask. Whether you’d prefer music, talking or simply snoozing after a long journey, your driver will get you safely to the right destination.

title: Best of Cairo: Day Trip from Alexandria
experiences:
See the Great Pyramids, the Sphinx and the Valley Temple
Take an optional trip to some traditional bazaars
Visit Cairo stress free as your guides take care of all transportation and organization
fullDescription:
Your day excursion to Cairo will start with your tour guide waiting for you at the lobby of your hotel in Alexandria. From the moment your tour starts, your guides will give you full attention. In the car on the way to the first attraction, your guide will tell you all about what you are seeing outside the windows as well as other aspects of the tour to come that might interest you. Your day in Cairo has been designed to give you the best overview of the city’s most amazing monuments in just one day.
 
Travel first to the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren and Mykerinus. Continue on with spectacular, once-in-a-lifetime visits to the Great Sphinx, the Valley Temple, and many other outstanding photo stops.
 
Move on to the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities, which includes an exhibition of King Tutankhamen’s treasures. End the day with an optional visit to some traditional bazaars before being driven back to Alexandria.

title: Cairo Stopover from Airport
experiences:
Visit the famous Great Pyramids and the Sphinx
Admire 250,000 artifacts in the Egyptian Museum
See the treasure of Tutankhamun
fullDescription:
Enjoy warm welcome in Egypt with round-the-clock pick-up in accordance with your flight arrival time. Meet your tour guide at Cairo airport; they will be holding a sign of your name.

Begin your tour by heading to the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Visit and enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Visit The Great Sphinx, the Valley Temple, and many other outstanding photo stops.

Then, visit the Egyptian Museum which holds 250,000 artifacts and the treasure of Tutankhamun which were enclosed in his tomb for over 3,500 years before it was discovered in 1920 when his tomb was excavated.

After finishing the tour, you will be transferred to Cairo Airport at least 2 hours before your international flight time.

title: Marsa Alam: Semi Submarine
experiences:
Explore the coral reef without getting wet
See coral reefs and tropical fish of all different shapes and sizes
Discover the Marsa Alam underwater world with your family and friends
fullDescription: Be collected at your accommodation in Marsa Alam. Travel to the harbor and board the seascape, which is air-conditioned and has a deep hull fitted with 20 panoramic windows, offering excellent underwater views. While sitting in your personal chair, you can see the coral reef and tropical fish of all different shapes and sizes.\r\n\r\nJourney to the most beautiful reefs of the region and be shown the abundance and multitude of the local marine life. There is a huge variety of fish species, colorful corals, and various sea plants. It looks like an enormous aquarium but this is the real natural world. Marvel from the comfort of the observation lounge. You can get snap happy with your camera or video throughout your journey. Be returned to your accommodation after the trip.

title: Hurghada: 2-Hour Speedboat with Snorkelling Tour
experiences:
Admire Hurghada Marina seafront landmarks from the water on a speedboat tour
Enjoy two snorkeling stops
Choose from various start times to suit you, beat the heat or see the city lights
fullDescription:
Start your experience with a pickup from your centrally located Hurghada hotel. Then, travel by comfortable minivan to the Hurghada Marina Yacht Club where your speedboat awaits. Complimentary water and soft drink are available on this intimate small-group cruise, limited to 6 people only.

Feel the coastal breeze as the boat picks up speed, reaching over 40 miles (64 km) per hour, so it’s an exhilarating feeling. Two snorkeling stops are included on the tour around the nearest island to the marina where you can see coral and colored fish.

Finally, relish the stunning views of the Hurghada marina before heading back. Your experience ends with a drop-off at your hotel in Hurghada.

title: Cairo Full-Day Bus Tour from Hurghada
experiences:
See the famous pyramids of Giza
Admire the world-famous Sphinx
Visit the impressive Egyptian Museum
Learn more about the pharaohs of ancient Egypt
fullDescription:
Discover Cairo on a day trip by bus from Hurghada. Get on the bus at your hotel and enjoy the ride to Cairo in an air-conditioned bus, driving along a beautiful stretch by the Red Sea and through the imposing desert.

Your tour guide will be waiting for you in the Egyptian capital and will take you through Cairo in a small group. Visit the Egyptian National Museum, one of the largest museums in the world. Admire the pharaonic treasures including burial objects, coins, clothing, and jewelry. See the golden treasure of Tutankhamen and fascinating sarcophagi.

Enjoy lunch at an excellent restaurant before continuing the tour. Visit the famous pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, which include the pyramids of Cheops, Cephren, and Mykerinos. Experience the fantastic view from the plateau before visiting the popular Sphinx.

title: Marsa Alam: Snorkeling at Abu Dabab Beach
experiences:
Snorkel directly off Abu Dabab Beach, with easy access to the waters of the Red Sea
Look for giant sea turtles and dugongs ("sea cows") in Turtles Bay
Marvel at the well-preserved corals of the coral gardens
fullDescription:
Benefit from pick-up at your hotel, and then journey by air-conditioned vehicle to Abu Dabab Beach. Located some 31 kilometers south of Marsa Alam Airport, Abu Dabab is one of the most popular bays in the Marsa Alam area. Also known as "Turtles Bay," the beach is said to be the prettiest along the entire coast.

Marvel at its clean and sandy beach, and collect your snorkeling equipment to venture into the sea. Your snorkeling guide will give you time to relax and change before your first snorkel adventure, either at the coral reefs to the north or south of the aqua center. Get some time at leisure to relax before your second snorkeling session, with the aim of seeing the green turtles and dugongs (sea cows) that normally frequent the middle of the bay.

Along the way, admire the colorful and well-maintained coral reefs, and look for all kinds of marine life that live around the underwater gardens. Benefit from easy access to the water direct from the beach, making it a perfect snorkeling adventure for children and the less experienced.

Get some more free time to check out the beach bar, before you journey back to your hotel at around 13:00.

title: From Hurghada: Paradise Island Full-Day Snorkeling Tour
experiences:
Explore the fantastic underwater world of Paradise Island and enjoy snorkeling stops at different locations
Experience a relaxing day away from the tourist bustle and enjoy the beautiful sandy beaches of the island
Relax on the beach or enjoy swimming and snorkeling among the unique variety of fish along the coast
fullDescription:
Discover the fantastic underwater world of Paradise Island. After the pick-up at your hotel you will be driven to the pier, from where you will cruise approximately 1 hour to Paradise Island. Along the way you can enjoy numerous short opportunities for snorkeling.

The paradise beach is part of Giftun Island National Park near Hurghada. The island is perfect for those seeking tranquility. Paradise Island has a beautiful sandy beach and offers the opportunity to spend your time as you wish. Enjoy the sunshine on the beach or enjoy swimming and snorkeling along the coast. Even in the shallow water you can see a unique variety of fish.

Onboard the boat you can enjoy a delicious lunch. You will then return to the pier in Hurghada in the afternoon and transfer back to your hotel.

title: From Hurghada: Cairo 2-Day Tour incl. Flights and Hotel
experiences:
Visit the fascinating Egyptian Museum
See the Pyramids of Giza and the famous Sphinx
Admire the beautiful Alabaster Mosque
Browse through Khan el-Khalili bazaar
Marvel at the step pyramid of Saqqara
fullDescription:
Discover Cairo on this 2-day tour including accommodation and flights form Hurghada. You will be picked up at your hotel in the morning and driven by air-conditioned vehicle to the airport. Upon arrival in Cairo you will be met by your tour guide.

First you will visit the Egyptian Museum. During the visit your guide will answer all your questions about the exhibits. Afterwards you can enjoy a traditional Egyptian lunch and visit Alabaster Mosque, a landmark of Cairo.

At Khan el-Khalili bazaar, the largest bazaar in the Arab world, you will encounter people of all social classes and religions. Spend an hour browsing through the bazaar before heading to your hotel in Cairo. After check-in at the hotel, you will have some time to rest and prepare for the night in Cairo. Spend the evening as you wish or book a fantastic sound and light show at the pyramids.

The next morning you will be picked up at your hotel at 09:00 and driven to the famous pyramids and the Sphinx. Here you will have three hours to admire these fantastic ancient structures. Afterwards you will head towards Saqqara, where you can enjoy a delicious lunch before visiting the step pyramid of Saqqara.

In the afternoon you will leave Cairo and return to Hurghada. You will be transferred to the airport in Cairo, where you will say goodbye to your tour guide. A driver will be waiting for you in Hurghada to take you back to your hotel.

title: From Makadi Bay: Full-Day Tour of Luxor by Bus
experiences:
Explore the Valley of the Kings in Luxor and immerse yourself in the history of former kings and queens of Egypt
See the impressive tomb of Queen Hatshepsut, guarded by the massive Colossi of Memnon
Visit the Karnak Temple and admire the unique architecture of the former temple building
fullDescription:
Explore the sights of Luxor and immerse yourself in the history of the Valley of the Kings. After pick-up at your hotel, drive to the final resting place of the pharaohs and learn all about the last journey of the ancient Egyptian kings.

Visit the gigantic twin statues of the Colossi of Memnon, built to protect the necropolis, and the impressive Temple of Queen Hatshepsut. Find out more about the 3-tiered mortuary temple located under a 90-meter cliff.

After a hearty lunch at a local restaurant, head to the impressive Karnak Temple and admire the soaring pillars, chapels, and statues before setting off on the return journey to your hotel.

title: Hurghada: Makadi Water World Entrance Ticket
experiences:
Escape from the heat with an entry ticket to Makadi Water World
Choose from 50 water rides, giant swimming pools and much more
Eat at the on-site restaurants or in the picnic area
fullDescription:
Escape the heat and jump in the water of one of Egypt's largest water parks, located just outside Hurghada and featuring 50 water attractions, swimming pools, a children's park, recreation areas and much more.

Benefit from pick-up at your hotel or Makadi Bay, and then have fun with all the family on the exciting water rides, or simply relax in the sun. Depart for the park at 09:00 or 10:00 to make the most of the day. Then, on arrival, take an adrenaline-pumping ride down one of the high-speed water slides, or float your cares away on the lazy river. 

When you get hungry, a selection of on-site restaurants and a supermarket are there to satisfy your cravings, The park also offers plenty of picnic tables and food areas for your convenience.

title: Cairo: Private 2-Day Tour
experiences:
Enjoy walking under the shadow of the great Pyramids of Giza
View the 3 pyramids in panoramic view from the highest point of Giza
Meet the kings and queens of Ancient Egypt in the huge museum where you can see the priceless masterpieces of the pharaonic King Tutankhamen
Walk in the old streets of Islamic and Coptic Cairo between the old monuments
Have lunch in a local restaurant by the Nile River
fullDescription:
Day 1: Pyramids of Giza and the Egyptian Museum

You will be met in your hotel by your guide and picked up by an air-conditioned van. Start your day by visiting the Egyptian Museum. You will get to see 165,000 Egyptian artifacts. The priceless treasures of King Tutankhamen are the highlight here. His six gilded coffins dominate the main hall, while his magnificent death mask is the star attraction. You can also visit the Mummies Hall (additional cost). Next, enjoy sailing along the Nile on a small boat and watch the sites of the city (optional).

You will have your lunch in a restaurant located by the river Nile. Next stop on your tour is the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx, one of the Seven Wonders of the World and still a riddle today. A truly unforgettable experience, the Sphinx is an enigmatic symbol of Egypt. You will have free time to enter one of the pyramids (additional cost) if you wish. You will also have a chance to do some shopping and visit a perfume factory and traditional Papyrus Institute, where you can see how they make papyrus and purchase a unique gift. Then, drive back to your hotel.

Day 2: Islamic and Coptic Cairo 

Have amazing day trip to old Islamic and Coptic Cairo, where you will walk in the oldest streets between ancient Islamic and Coptic monuments. You will be picked up by your guide to visit the Hanging Church (named for its location above a gatehouse of the Babylon Fortress.) Then, you will visit the Coptic Museum with the largest collection of Egyptian Christian artifacts in the world. Near by the Coptic Museum you will find located Ben Ezra Synagogue. This was the synagogue whose geniza or store room was found in the 19th century to contain a treasure of abandoned Hebrew. Next, you will visit the Citadel of Saladin which is a fortification in Cairo. You will then have lunch followed by a walk through Khan El Khalili Street. You could ask yourself how a market in Egypt is responsible for the founding of the United States. This is an experience you will find unforgettable. Return back to your hotel.

title: From Marsa Alam: Habu Temple & Valley of the Queens Day Trip
experiences:
Visit the stunning Colossi of Memnon
Marvel at the tombs in the Valley of the Queens
Enjoy Egyptian food at a local restaurant in Luxor
Explore the incredible Ramesseum Temple
Dive into the history of the Madinet Habu Temple
fullDescription:
Your driver will pick you up directly from your hotel in Marsa Alam and drive you to Luxor in an air-conditioned car before you'll meet your qualified Egyptologist guide. Your tour includes lunch at a local Egyptian restaurant.

Make a stop at the two Colossi of Memnon, huge stone statues of Pharaoh Amenhotep III. After you have taken some photos, you will visit the Valley of the Queens, considered the home of the women and children of the pharaohs. In addition to many queens, there are also numerous tombs of princes and princesses. Here, you can also visit the famous tomb of Queen Nefertari (Optional), one of the most famous queens of ancient times.

Saving the best for last, your tour will end with a visit to Medinet Habu Temple. Visit the Ramesseum Temple to explore the mortuary, built by Pharaoh Ramesses II. Admire the intricate carved reliefs depicting battles and festival scenes. At the end of your tour, the driver will transfer you back to your hotel in Marsa Alam.

title: Cairo: Giza Pyramids and River Nile Tour
experiences:
Take in the sight of the Great Pyramids of Giza
Admire the magnificent Sphinx
Visit the Valley Temple, where kings were mummified
Sail down the Nile on a felucca boat
fullDescription:
Your tour will start as your guide picks you up from your hotel. From the moment your tour starts, you will get full attention. In the car on the way to the pyramids, your guide will tell you all about what you’re seeing outside of the windows.
 
Travel in comfort to the Great Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, and truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Enjoy a panoramic view of the Pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Visit the Great Sphinx, and the Valley Temple, where the king was mummified and purified before his burial. Your tour guide will be sure to stop for many outstanding photo stops so you can capture these stunning sights. The itinerary will be flexible, so the tour can be adapted to your preferences and pace.

Then, your tour will move on to the Nile, where you will board a felucca boat and take a sailing tour down the river. This is another perfect opportunity for sightseeing, as the edge of the Nile features many more unmissable sights. Finish your tour with a comfortable ride back to your hotel.

title: Cairo: Full-Day Pyramid Tour and Egyptian Museum
experiences:
See the Great Pyramid of Giza
View the Great Sphinx of Giza
Visit the Egyptian Museum
fullDescription:
Listen to stories about the history of Egypt and learn about ancient Egyptian culture, all told by your expert guide. Visit the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

Enjoy a panoramic view of the Great Pyramid of Giza, the Pyramid of Khafre and the Pyramid of Menkaure. Walk past the Valley Temple of Khafre and take a photo with the Great Sphinx of Giza. 

Travel to the Egyptian Museum, displaying more than 250,000 pieces of rare Egyptian art. Enter into the room of Tutankhamun, decorated with the jewelry and gold enclosed within his tomb.

title: Alexandria: Day Tour
experiences:
See the famous Library of Alexandria
Visit St. Mark, the oldest church
Stop over Stanley Bridge
Take a walking Tour through the old city-center
See the site of the Lighthouse, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
Stop for photos at Quaitbay
fullDescription:
First, be picked up by your tour guide from your hotel, before heading to the library of Alexandria, the biggest library in the world. Visit its open court where you can see the statue of Alexander the Great and the statue of Ptolemy the First.

Then, visit the Roman Amphitheater of Alexandria with its display of the sunken monuments. Visit the church of St. Mark, the oldest church in Africa as well as the old downtown of Alexandria where you can walk through the old city-center before visiting Abbo Elabbas Mosque.

Continue to see the outside of Quaitbay castle which was built on the same site as the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria one of the seven wonders of the world and a great photo stop.

Next, visit Montaza Gardens, commonly known as the Love Garden, and the royal gardens of King Farouk and the royal palaces of Haramlek.

On your way back, stop over the famous Stanley Bridge – the landmark of modern Alexandria.

title: Bedouin Dinner and Camel Ride
experiences:
Enjoy Bedouin style BBQ in the Mountains.
Observe the millions of stars in the clear night sky.
Optional stay in a Bedouin camp for a special experience
fullDescription:
Bedouin people are excellent hosts and are well known for looking after guests and making them feel welcome. This is part of a tradition that has been passed down generation after generation.  Firstly there is the famous Bedouin tea, made from tea leaf with sugar, and desert herbs of habuck and marmaraya.

The second part of the hospitality always involves food, Bedouin people will always make sure their guest are well refreshed with tea, water and traditional Bedouin food. This includes delicious Bedouin bread cooked on an open fire, rice and either a meat, fish or vegetable dish. The cooking is always from fresh produce grown or reared locally. They take much pride in their cooking and food is always seen as a special event.
Itinerary:

Leaving Dahab at 05.30 pm and drive the car for 20 min. Then we'll ride the camel in the desert for 45 min towards the mountains to enjoy a Bedouin style BBQ. We'll arrive before sunset.

Observe the millions of stars in the clear night sky in this heavenly, tranquil place.

A drive back to the hotel will see you back at your hotel for around 10.00 p.m or choose to stay overnight a in Bedouin camp and drive back next day by car at 08:00 AM.

title: Aswan Trip by Nile Felluca
experiences:
Sail the River Nile
Marvel at the view
Learn about the region's history
fullDescription:
You will be picked up from you hotel or Nile cruise in Aswan by your tour guide to start sailing the Nile by the felucca for about one Hour around Elephentine Island. The unusual name has nothing to do with the presence of any large land mammals anywhere.

Next, visit the Botanical Gardens, which is rich in plants that were imported from all over the world. In the year of 1899 Lord Kitchener used this Island as a place for his campaign, and call it the Lord's house.

After his death, this Island belonged to the ministry of agriculture. From there you will be transferred back to your hotel or Nile cruise in Aswan.

title: Felucca Ride on the Nile in Aswan
experiences:
Sail the Nile in a Felucca
Visit the Botanic Gardens, with their vast collection of plants from around the world
Explore the Elephantine Islands on a sailing adventure
fullDescription:
Beginning the tour with a pick-up from your hotel or Nile cruise in Aswan, where you will board your felucca. Your tour guide will sail you around the anciently rich Elephantine Islands.

Visit the Botanical Gardens, rich with plants imported back in 1899 by the Lord Kitchener. Visit the sites of the historic campaign resting stop. Learn what became of the island after Kitchener's death, and about the ministry of agriculture. 

After the 30 minute sail and island visit, you will be returned to your hotel or Nile cruise in Aswan. Spend a day deep in history.

title: From El Gouna: Dry Canyon Quad Bike Tour
experiences:
Discover the Dry Canyon and see the fossils of ancient coral and shells
Experience the stunning view over the desert and canyon from 150 meters above sea level
Take a Quad Bike through the desert and have a thrilling ride
fullDescription:
Start your day with pick up at your hotel and a drive to the tour motor park. There, you'll take a training crash course on Quad driving, where you’ll receive all of the information necessary for this excursion. Then it will be time to start your exhilarating drive through the Dry Canyon, an approximately 40 kilometer round trip.

During the tour there will be three main stops. First, stop at a Bedouin camp, where you'll be served a complimentary drink and shisha by some local Bedouins. The second stop will be Wadi Billy, or Dry Canyon. This canyon was covered by the Red Sea waters millions of years ago. Here you'll enjoy the beautiful views of the canyon and see the fossils of ancient corals and shells. Your final stop will be at the top of Wadi Billy - here you will be almost 150 meters above sea level, granting you a stunning view into the canyon. 
Enjoy a final ride with the Quad bike through the desert before heading back to the motor park.

title: Ras Mohammed National Park: Snorkelling Trip
experiences:
Visit the Ras Mohammed National Park
Snorkel in the most beautiful reef in Egypt
Experience an impressively colorful underwater world
See mangroves, the only trees that grow in salt wate
Discover the magical deep lake, which is suitable for swimming
fullDescription:
Be collected at your accommodation in Sharm by a modern air-conditioned mini-bus. Take a for a short drive to the Ras Mohammed National Park. Your guide will tell you interesting facts on the way there.

Have the opportunity to go snorkeling in Egypt's most beautiful reef. Marvel at a remarkably colorful underwater world. Mangroves are the only trees that grow in salt water. In the Ras Mohammed National Park, you can find these unique trees that are actually native to Central Africa.

Discover the Magic Lake, a large deep lake suitable for swimming. The Bedouin gave his name to the magic lake and you will learn fantastic stories about him. After your snorkeling experience at the Ras Mohammed National Park, be returned to your accommodation in time for dinner.

title: Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx Half-Day Tour
experiences:
Explore the Pyramids of Giza on a half-day sightseeing tour with an Egyptologist guide
Learn about the pyramids constuction as far back as 2560–2540 BC
See the imposing Great Sphinx
Wander through the Valley Temple
fullDescription:
This 4-hour sightseeing tour explores the mysteries of the Great Pyramids of Giza and Great Sphinx in the Giza Plateau. The oldest and last remaining of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World, the site is not only the most popular attraction in Egypt, it’s one of the most loved destinations in the world.

In the company of an expert Egyptologist guide, you will visit the Pyramid of Cheops, the middle Pyramid of Chephren, and the small Pyramid of Mykerinos. Continue to the Great Sphinx with its head of a man and body of a lion, gazing imposingly across the valley.

Then, complete your tour of the pyramid complex with a walk through the Valley Temple, learning more about the site’s astonishing creation and construction back in 2560–2540 BC.

title: Great Pyramids of Giza Half-Day Adventure
experiences:
Visit the iconic Pyramids of Giza before the crowds and the heat
Snap those photos you’ve always wanted, without pesky tourists getting in the way
Marvel at one of the true ancient masterpieces: the Sphinx and his Pyramids
Indulge in a local lunch, making this tour of the Pyramids just a little bit different than the rest
fullDescription:
Get ready, get set, for an experience of a lifetime – a half-day trip to the Great Pyramids of Giza!               

The Giza Plateau is a formation of three pyramids, where a father, son, and grandson constructed their afterlife tombs and mapped their journeys to the afterlife. It’s still a bit of a mystery as to how the pyramids were constructed and how long they took to complete, but there’s no question that the pyramids still represent the pinnacle of ancient Egyptian architectural accomplishments. The whole area, really, continues to hold many secrets yet to be uncovered, making the pyramids one of the most alluring and inviting places in the world. 

Why not tick off that bucket list item, and then some, with a half-day tour to the pyramids that’s going to prove to you why everyone reveres this site so much. What sets this Pyramids tour apart from the others is that you'll beat the tourists and arrive at the Giza Plateau well before the crowds and that ruthless midday sun. You'll also be treated to a local lunch! Pyramids, Sphinx, and lunch? Oh my! 

The day starts by seeing the guardian of the necropolis, the Sphinx (you know, the one with the missing nose!), which stands in front of the second Pyramid of Khepren. Enter the Giza Plateau from the Sphinx Gate to beat the crowds to the site, and after seeing the Sphinx, walk to the mysterious great pyramid of King Cheops, where you can marvel at the sheer size of the construction, and try and formulate your own theories as to how it was built. 

The Pyramids tour continues to the second Pyramid of Giza, which is the second largest and the only pyramid that still caries part of its original casing. From there, continue to the third and the smallest of the Giza Plateau pyramids. And no visit to the Pyramids of Giza would be complete without stopping at the panoramic view point where you get to see the all the pyramids of Giza in the one spot (and take a photo like the ones you see in travel books – free of tourists! Well, almost…) 

Leaving the amazing pyramids behinds, head back out to the streets of Cairo and stop by a local restaurant for lunch. You'll be treated to Koshary, a dish of rice, pasta, lentils, fried onions, and chili sauce, and a favorite amongst young local Egyptians. After lunch, you'll be dropped back off at one of the starting points, where you can carry on your day (although the Pyramids are sure to have already been the highlight!).

title: Egyptian Pyramid Tour
experiences:
See the Great Pyramids of Giza
Look up at the mighty Sphinx
Catch a glimpse of the Valley Temple
Take a camel ride through the desert
Visit the Egyptian Museum
fullDescription:
Your tour begins with an easy hotel pickup, where your guide will be awaiting you in your hotel lobby. Now the fun really begins.

Journey back in time to the days of the Ancient Egyptians to see the legendary pyramids of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus. Get an up close look at the Great Sphinx, and visit the Valley Temple on the site where the ancient pharaohs were laid to rest. This is a family friendly tour, so kids are welcome!

Take a camel ride through the desert and feel just like an ancient Egyptian. This is truly an unforgettable experience!

Next, take a history tour of Cairo, which will take you along all the lesser known but must-see local spots. Take in the panoramic views of the Pyramids and the Sphinx, make an optional stop at Taverna's for local Cairo food, and visit the Egyptian Museum to see Egypt's hidden treasures. The city has a rich local history, ranging from the ancients to modern time. Learn about what is going on in Cairo today! Meet the locals, who will show you how to make the most of your trip.

At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.

title: Alexandria Independent Adventure
fullDescription: Delve into legendary Alexandria, Egypt's capital for a millennium and once home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Wander the Roman amphitheatres, palaces, and catacombs of Egypt's gateway to the Mediterranean. Starting from Cairo, spend a day and a half exploring Alexandria's Greek, Roman, and Byzantine history in one of the greatest cities of the Hellenic world. And with a top-notch Chief Experience Officer (CEO) from door to door, you'll know you're in good hands the whole time.

title: Private Tour: Giza Pyramids, Sphinx, Memphis, Sakkara
fullDescription: Step back in time to the days of ancient Egypt on a private tour of the Great Pyramids of Giza and Sphinx, the necropolis of Sakkara and the former capital, Memphis. With your own private Egyptologist guide to lead the way on this private tour, you can determine the amount of time you'd like to spend at each of the sites you'll visit.

title: Private Tour: Giza Pyramids and Sphinx
fullDescription: No visit to Cairo is complete without seeing the majesty of the Great Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx. With your own private Egyptologist guide to lead the way, you'll enjoy personalized attention on your private tour of these famous symbols of Egypt's ancient civilization. As this is a private tour, you can determine the amount of time you'd like to spend at each of the sites you'll visit.

title: Luxor West Bank Private Valley of the Kings, Hatshepsut Temple
fullDescription: Tour the most famous sites on Luxor's West Bank in the company of an expert private guide. You'll step back into Egypt's ancient history at the Valley of the Kings and Hatshepsut Temple on this private morning tour from Luxor. As this is a private tour, you can determine the amount of time you'd like to spend at each site.

title: Nile River Dinner Cruise in Cairo
fullDescription: Enjoy a Nile River dinner cruise aboard the Nile Maxim, one of the most elegant cruising restaurants sailing the world's longest waterway. You'll enjoy top-class service aboard your Nile cruise, gliding past Cairo's illuminated skyline while you dine, and with entertainment provided by a spectacular belly-dancing and folklore show.

title: Pyramids Sound and Light Show with Private Transport
fullDescription: Want a truly unforgettable evening of entertainment in Cairo? Then don't miss the world-famous Pyramids Sound and Light Show in Giza! You'll hear the story of Egypt as seen through the eyes of the Sphinx over the ages, and see the breathtaking site of the floodlit pyramids lit up under the stars.

title: Private Tour: Egyptian Museum
fullDescription: The second most frequently visited and certainly one of the most important attractions in Cairo is the Egyptian Museum. You will find the fabulous collection of King Tutankhamun and monuments from all periods of Egyptian history, from the pre historic era to the Greco-Roman period.

title: Full-Day Tour to Giza Pyramids, Memphis, and Sakkara
fullDescription: Private full day tour visiting Giza Pyramids, Sphinx, Memphis City - the ancient Capital of Egypt and Sakkara Pyramid where you visit the Step Pyramid of King Zoser. Tour includes pick-up and drop off transfers. Your tour will also include a Certified tour guide. This is a luxury Cairo day tour that covers the ancient sites of Cairo.

title: Private Tour: Alabaster Mosque, Sultan Hassan, Khan el-Khalili
fullDescription: Look beyond the pyramids and pharaohs, and discover the Citadel of Salah el Din, Sultan Hassan and the Khan el-Khalili Bazaar. This private tour will give you a deeper insight into the rich history that is Egypt.

title: Private Tour: Alexandria Day Trip from Cairo
fullDescription: Take a fascinating private tour to Alexandria from Cairo in the company of your own Egyptologist guide. With your own private Egyptologist guide to lead the way, you'll enjoy personalized attention on your private tour of Alexandria. As this is a private tour, you can determine the amount of time you'd like to spend at each of the sites in Alexandria you'll visit.

title: Private Tour: Abu Simbel by Minibus from Aswan
fullDescription: See the magnificent temples of Abu Simbel on a minibus tour from Aswan. With a qualified Egyptologist as your guide, you'll enjoy a personalized visit to Abu Simbel on this private tour. With its four rock-hewn pharaohs, you'll agree that the Great Temple is one of the most impressive sites in Egypt, and the highlight of any trip to Egypt.

title: Quad Biking in the Egyptian Desert from Sharm el Sheikh
fullDescription: This 2 hour quad-biking excursion takes you riding across the sands at sunrise or sunset, when the amazing colors of the desert are revealed in all their glory. You'll explore crags and dunes as you ride along the sands on a desert escape from Egypt's bustling cities.

title: Day Trip to Cairo by Bus
fullDescription: A tour guide will pick you up at 01:30 from your Hurghada hotel for a 5 hour coach transfer to Cairo. Upon arrival your tour guide will take you into central Cairo to wander Egyptian Museum and Inside this huge, world-famous museum you will find some of the most important treasures from Ancient Egypt. Built in neo-classical style, designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon the museum exceed 120,000 masterpieces. You will have free time to have your own tour and visit the Mummy room if you are interested.Your tour will continue to Giza to have lunch in a local restaurant before take you to the stunning Pyramids of Giza. The oldest of the 7 Wonders of the Ancient World you see the great Pyramid of Cheops which one of the world wonders, the Pyramid of Chephren (you have the chance to visit it from inside), and the smallest one of Mecarinus, the valley temple of Chephren. You will also see the great Sphinx and a panoramic view of the three Pyramids together. After you have viewed the ancient Pyramids, you will visit the perfume museum for a rest before you start your journey back to Hurghada.

title: Red Sea Snorkeling
fullDescription: No trip to Hurghada would be complete without a day spent exploring the underwater world of the Red Sea. This snorkeling trip will take you to three spectacular sites where you can choose to jump in the water or simply lie on the decks and work on your tan.

title: Giza, Saqqara, Dahshur, Cairo 2-Day All-Inclusive Private Tour
fullDescription: Do it all in two days. The target of this private tour is for you to visit all major pyramid sites in Saqqara, Dahshur and Giza, Admire the treasures of the Egyptian museum and the spiritual atmosphere of mosques and churches in the Citadel and in Old Cairo. Live the experience of bargaining in the famous Bazaar area of Khan el Khalili. Enjoy authentic Egyptian food, and enjoy entertainment during your evenings - one at the sound and light show in Giza, the other on a dinner cruise on the Nile with a belly dance and Tannoura (whirling Dervish) show.

title: Private Tour: Memphis and Sakkara
fullDescription: Discover Memphis and Sakkara, two of Egypt's most important archaeological treasures. Sakkara is home to the oldest pyramid in Egypt, and Memphis was the former capital founded in 3,100 BC.

title: Coptic Cairo Private Tour: Hanging Church, Abu Serga, Ben Ezra
fullDescription: Discover the ancient sites and culture of Coptic Christians on a private tour through Old Cairo. Visit Abu Serga where the Holy family sort refuge, and Ben Ezra, one of the oldest synagogues in Cairo. Learn about Christian life in Egypt, a country where Christianity is a minority.

title: Tiran Island Cruise and Snorkeling
fullDescription: Sunbathing, swimming, snorkeling - is there any better way to spend a day in the Egyptian sun? Escape the desert for a day of relaxation around the protected white sandy Tiran Island. Crystal clear blue water, lagoons and colorful coral reefs are waiting to be explored around Tiran Island, located north east of Sharm El Sheikh in the Gulf of Aqaba.

title: Morning Alexandria Day Tour from Cairo
fullDescription: Alexandria, city of Alexander and capital of Egypt for a thousand years. until 30 B.C. it was the biggest city of the world, then it was second only to Rome. It had the biggest library of the world and the most famous lighthouse (Pharos)

title: Nile River 3-Hour Buffet Dinner Cruise with Tanoura Sufi Show
fullDescription: Enjoy your dinner on this Nile cruise watching a belly dancer and and a Tanoura Sufi dance show. You can also go up to the sundeck to enjoy the view of Cairo - many great photo opportunities guaranteed

title: Cairo Sightseeing by Night Private Guided Tour
fullDescription: Enjoy this unique private night tour which will introduce you to nighttime Cairo, totally different to Cairo by day.You will be picked-up by your tour guide who will guide you around highlights of Cairo. Start your tour with Cairo tower (187m high) situated on Gezeira island on the Nile River, where you can see night-time Cairo in all its splendor.

title: Ras Mohamed Red Sea Cruise and Snorkeling
fullDescription: Hit the water at Sinai's famous Ras Mohamed National Park, where an abundance of underwater life is waiting to be discovered. Spend the day snorkeling, swimming or just relaxing on the sun deck the choice is up to you.

title: Hot Air Balloon Flight Over Luxor West Bank and Nile River
fullDescription: For unbeatable views of Luxor's famous temples, take a hot-air balloon flight over the Nile River's west bank. Away from the crowds in the peaceful glow of dawn, your sunrise flight over Egypt's ancient monuments promises to be a highlight of your visit.

title: Quad Bike Safari in Hurghada
fullDescription: Roar across Egypt's rugged Eastern Desert on a quad bike to a Bedouin village on this 5-hour desert safari from Hurghada. Sip Bedouin tea on Arabian carpets, brave an optional shisha pipe, enjoy dinner, ride a camel across the desert sands, learn about Bedouin culture from the locals, and maybe even catch sunset from a sand dune.

title: Giza, Dahshur, Saqqara and Memphis Pyramids Private Day Trip
fullDescription: Start your private tour with the step pyramid, the oldest, then visit Memphis, the first capital of ancient Egypt, then the Red Pyramid in Dahshur, the first true pyramid, and the Bent Pyramid, and lastly the Great Pyramid in Giza as well as as other pyramids and the Sphinx.

title: Private Tour: Abu Simbel Flight and Tour from Aswan
fullDescription: Fast track your journey and take the quick route to see the magnificent temples of Abu Simbel on an air tour from Aswan. With a qualified Egyptologist as your guide (fully guided or part guided depending on option selected), this private tour provides the most personalized visit to Abu Simbel, in the shortest time possible.

title: Glass Bottom Boat Cruise and Coral Reef Viewing
fullDescription: No need to get in the water to enjoy the spectacular coral reefs of the Red Sea near Sharm el-Sheikh. Board a glass bottom boat to see the underwater world while staying dry.

title: Nile Dinner Cruise with Belly Dancing and Hotel Transfer
fullDescription: One of the best things to do in Cairo at night is a dinner cruise on the Nile with Belly dancer and Tanoura Shows. Enjoy sailing on the Nile for 2 hours with open buffet dinner with varieties of food items that contains desserts and fruits too beside the main course and salad. This trip includes all pickup and drop off transfers from customers locations in Cairo or Giza.

title: Day Trip to Luxor from Hurghada with Hotel Pickup and Lunch
fullDescription: Go on this full-day excursion to Luxor from Hurghada with a local guide. You will get to visit the Colossi of Memnon, the Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, and the Temple of Karnak. Lunch will be served at a local restaurant. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

title: Cairo with Egyptian Museum and Khan Khalili Bazaar Day Tour
fullDescription: Enjoy a full day exploring Cairo on this sighting tour. You will visit the Egyptian Museum, where you can see the Treasures of King Tutankamoun before visiting the Citadel where you see the famous Mosque of Mohamed Ali and then visit Khan Khalili Bazaar. The tour could be sharing with others if there other guests booked it on same date

title: Quad Biking in the Egyptian Desert from Hurghada
fullDescription: Combine adventure with dramatic desert scenery, as you take to the sands on a quad bike, using the sunset against the Sinai mountains as your backdrop.

title: Private Tour: Dendara and Abydos
fullDescription: Combine a morning in Dendara where you can visit the Temple of Hathor, before continuing for an afternoon of sightseeing in Abydos, home to The Cult of Osiris . It is a place where most ancient Egyptians would have made a pilgrimage to at least once in their lifetime.

title: Day Trip to Luxor from Cairo by Plane with Lunch
fullDescription: If you have a limited time in Egypt and would like to explore the highlights of Luxor City in one day this is the best option.You will be picked up from your hotel by your driver at 4am. He will take you to the domestic airport for your flight to Luxor.Arriving in Luxor, you will be met at the airport by your tour guide (holding a sign with your name on it). In a modern, air-conditioned vehicle he will transfer you to the different sights. Enjoy an excursion to the Necropolis of Thebes, on the Eastern bank of the river.

title: Mt Sinai, St Catherine's Monastery Private with Sunrise Hike
fullDescription: See the sun rise over the desert on an unforgettable visit to the place where Moses received the 10 Commandments. You'll travel in air-conditioned comfort with your own personal Egyptologist guide, who will accompany you up Moses' Mountain and take you on a tour of St. Catherine's Monastery.

title: Private Tour: Hurghada City Sightseeing
fullDescription: The best way to find your bearings when arriving in a new city is to take a city tour. This three-hour trip with your own private guide is the perfect way to see the sights of Hurghada including the Big Mosque, St Mary Church, the port area and of course free time for shopping in the bazaars.

title: River Nile Felucca Sunset Sail 1-Hour Evening Tour in Cairo
fullDescription: Your driver will pick you up from your hotel at 4pm to take you to the Cairo pier. Get on a traditional Egyptian boat known as Felucca and enjoy a relaxing one-hour sail along the River Nile. Let the evening sun shine in your face and enjoy the fantastic views of the city while having soft drinks and snacks. Your driver will wait at the pier to take you back to your hotel after the cruise has finished.

title: Bedouin BBQ in the Egyptian Desert by 4x4
fullDescription: A one-hour drive by jeep through the desert brings you to the starting point of your tour. After an easy 30-minute walk up a small hill you will be met by your Bedouin hosts and introduced to their way of life.Settle in for the evening and gaze upon the spectacular desert sunset as you feast on a Bedouin BBQ dinner, before returning to your Hurghada hotel.

title: Full Day Tour to East and West Banks of Luxor
fullDescription: Start your full day tour visiting the Highlights of Luxor City where you visit valley of the Kings, the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut, also known as El Dir El Bahari and Colossi Of Memnon. Lunch is included and then continue to the East Bank where you Visit Luxor and Karnak Temples. At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your Hotel, Nile Cruise or to Luxor airport.

title: Camel Safari with Optional Bedouin Dinner
fullDescription: Can you truly say you have been to Egypt if you haven't ridden a camel? Find out for yourself on an afternoon Camel Safari through the desert, and finish the day with an authentic taste of Bedouin tea. You also have the option of dining on a Bedouin dinner including the unique bread.

title: Cairo Half-Day Downtown Tour Including Egyptian Dinner
fullDescription: Immerse yourself in the bustle and beauty of downtown Cairo on this fascinating 4-hour walking tour. Set off in the late afternoon at Zamalek Island to see the off-the-beaten track gems and major landmarks along both old and modern streets of this captivating metropolis. Freshly painted graffiti provides colorful context to Liberation Square (Midan Tahrir), and the grand 19th-century buildings set a perfect backdrop for downtown street theater. Hear fascinating facts and stories from your guide as you walk, and finish with supper at an authentic Egyptian restaurant.

title: Sinbad Submarine Under The Red Sea
fullDescription: Experience the underwater world of the Red Sea without getting wet! Board the Sinbad Submarine for an unforgettable underwater adventure, diving below the Red Sea to enjoy the tranquility of life beneath the waves.

title: Day Trip from Cairo to El Mokkatm Mountain Cave Church
fullDescription: Visit the famous church of Saint Simon the Tanner, the cave church. The largest church in Cairo located inside El mokkatam mountain in a small village named by zableen means garbage collectors. Inside the church Virgin Mary appeared in carved statue in ceiling without any human effort.

title: Tour to Luxor from Hurghada
fullDescription: If you remember reading about the city of Thebes, an ancient Egyptian city, then you will want to go on Tour to Luxor from Hurghada because Luxor is modern day Thebes and is filled with history dating back hundreds and thousands of years!

title: Private Tour: Pharaonic Village
fullDescription: Experience ancient Egypt like never before at the Pharaonic Village in Cairo. A great family-friendly activity during your Egyptian vacation, the Pharaonic Village is a living museum of ancient Egyptian life.

title: Private Tour: Dendara from Luxor
fullDescription: Travel from Luxor to Dendara either by road in an air conditioned vehicle or by boat along the Nile River to see the well preserved Temple of Hathor, Temple of Isis and Coptic Basilica. Your qualified Egyptologist guide will introduce you to the main features of the complex before allowing you additional free time to explore at leisure.

title: Hurghada Daily Scuba Dive Trip
fullDescription: Egypt's Red Sea is home to some of the world's most famous dive sites and Hurghada, on the Red Sea coast, offers some stunning coral gardens just off-shore. This 1-day, 2-dive trip, suitable both for absolute beginners and qualified divers, visits different sites depending on availability, weather conditions, and guests' experience level: lunch is included.

title: Nile River Dinner Cruise with Cultural Show, Private Transfers
fullDescription: The Nile River is considered the longest river in the world.
